NzStDBhbcdXgLVQXMvQOhQ.text: I'm at tofu hut on a weekly basis and i'm surprised i havent gotten sick of this place!!! My BF & I mostly go during happy hour (after 10pm) and our orders usually consist of : brisket, regular pork belly, ribeye and marinated pork belly. My top fave is not included during happy hr and u have to pay extra (Short ribs). I noticed a decline in their marinated pork belly. I noticed during the last several visits, most of the meat is fat. Brisket comes in different thickness/length with each order, but still tastes the same. (Pls keep it long & thick!...."that's what she said....")..When we first started coming here, we didnt know if what they gave us was brisket or tongue coz it ALWAYS looked so different every time they brought it out....I am a HUGE fan of their salad...so flavorful! i'm not a big salad girl and this is a definite must have every time i eat here..My bf loves their korean pancakes and i am a fan of the japchae. Overall, good banchan.  Our servers are usually the same 2 guys at night and they are both so friendly, attentive and hard workers!   This and Sura are my faves for Korean bbq...Honey Pig wasnt bad either!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qHXcIPUWVU290jvMvbvk4Q.text: We have dined at this Korean restaurant several times either cooking on the tableside BBQs or ordering kitchen prepared entrees. This night we chose the latter, sharing orders of spicy chicken and bulgogi (grilled marinated beef). The entrees were very good, but the 6 banchans (side dishes) were largely forgettable. I also tried for the first time a cup of mushroom tofu soup that I did not find to my liking.  Prices are moderate when combined with a KSHP discounted gift certificate.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spicy chicken
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bulgogi
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bulgogi

llZghiVCG4dPfZRB6y-v6Q.text: I asked my son to pick a place & invite some of his friends to have dinner after his graduation. So when he said he wanted to eat at Tofu Hut, my first thought was, "tofu? seriously?" But don't let the name fool you, Tofu Hut is a Korean BBQ restaurant. They offer a regular menu or a cook-it-yourself, all-you-can-eat BBQ menu ($16.99 10am to 11pm & only $13.99 11pm to 4am). We chose the all-you-can-eat (of course).  Once we were seated at one the built-in grill tables, we ordered the sliced ribeye, short rib, brisket & pork belly (there are other meats like chicken, tripe & beef tongue). The meats were quickly brought out on platters, portioned enough to cover the entire grill. All of the meats were good & the sliced ribeye was super tender & really flavorful.  An assortment of side dishes were brought to our table. Rice, salad, kimchee, bean sprouts, pickled cucumber & a bunch of other stuff that I don't know the names of. Everything was tasty & the salad - shredded cabbage & lettuce, more like cole slaw, but with a sweet Korean spiced dressing that made this a favorite. The only dipping sauce we got for the meat was an olive oil with salt & pepper, but it was good.   The servers frequently asked if we needed anything, so I can't complain about the service. The restaurant is small enough that you can flag one of the servers down, or just look toward the counter and get their attention, if you need anything. It's all you can eat, so just ask for more.   Overall, the food is really good, prices are reasonable, restaurant is clean & our group of 10 was easily accommodated. This is a fun & interesting place to bring a group of hungry people. Although we did go back to our hotel smelling like kalbi, we'll surely be eating here on our future visits to Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OvzBTETj02N5LnhK92BfUw.text: Decided to have dinner at Tofu Hut tonight. Overall experience was not bad, but I wouldn't call it great either.   They were a bit short staffed when we first walked in. I would say it took them over 5 mins to even acknowledge our presence even though they did see us walk in.  I expected a "Hello, or Welcome" at the very least.  We passed on the AYCE tonight & went ala carte. We ordered short ribs & spicy chicken. Both orders were good, but nothing memorable or anything to rave about. I did love their banchan offerings! I liked the fish cake, japchae, spicy cucumber, and I don't recall the others but it was yummy!  I would go back.. but don't think I'll be a regular at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. short ribs, spicy chicken, and banchan

1a1zOg8K8kw4HrEf735e3w.text: Cheap AYCE kbbq? I'm sold. I usually come here after 10 for the late night special ($15 per person). Be warned the wait can be very very long but it is definitely worth it.  I love their brisket, pork belly, and beef tongue. Sometimes I get a plate of marinated rib eye or marinated pork belly, but I generally stick to the brisket.

w-fg6QbXSaEPhdalLuhh2w.text: Ah KBBQ - I almost didn't believe it when a friend described it as "all you can eat meat buffett" but it was True, and a dream come True!  There are a couple AYCE KBBQ here in town, most right up in Chinatown on Spring Mtn. For the most part there are same, with some slight variations. Tofu Hut is one my favorite though.  Tofu is set-up where they bring the meet to you. Its a small place so there really isn't much room for you to actually go up and get the food yourself. This of course puts you at the mercy of the wait staff. But usually their service is on point and there isn't much of a delay in getting what you want.  The prices are pretty cheap when compared to some of the other KBBQ joints. AYCE is $17, and they knock off $4 after 10pm. They have the full of assortment of Korean meats: brisket, bulgogi, pork belly, squid, beef tongue, and the like. I absolutely love the Kalbi, its delicious as is the steamed egg. (I have been calling it egg soup and no one has ever bothered to correct me).  Despite the name Tofu.. this place is anything but it. Overall a above average KBBQ spot and a great value.

gGZ7Yf9CfXfJTiSTfHIJlA.text: Great place if you can wait for tou to cook your own food.  I was hoping to see more vegetable choices.  My family had a great time and we will definitely be back again when we are hungry.  Left this place feeling stuffed.  Price is worth coming here.

B7wRSfdDNeh2xK3NmmvmJA.text: Will not here ever since they got shut down from southern Nevada health district .......for spoiled food and meats not being stored in refrigerator ....I'm giving them 1 star because after they reopened after getting shut down I decided to give them a second try because my gf and I used to love eating here ....thinking that this place should b cleaned after they reopened but as I'm paying my bill I see a roach come from the kitchen never again will I eat here o and the line is crazy long your better off going to the gardens kbbq up the street plus there clean never been shut down...not to mention tofu hut had 50 something demerits u can check on southern Nevada website will show u everything that was wrong you'll prolly get grossed out

qkK6qRMUXquBL_txI3fEfw.text: I would give this place a 5 star if it wasn't for the mediocre service. I'm obsessed with the food here tho, it's a pretty good price for what you get and its always fresh!

-AB1mNkKQ6aDodY_v62mNQ.text: Absolutely delicious Korean food with great service and excellent prices.  We ordered two different combos - short rib & chicken each with their own tofu soup, rice and a bunch of different little sides.  YUM!  They have all you can eat BBQ too but we never bother with that (I rather have them cook for me - LOL) their combos are all under $15 sooooo good!

c1DSFKSHCsvF7rA-xujjdw.text: My parents are visiting here and they absolutely loved this place. They were very happy with service and the food. I would give 5 stars and recommend people to try them for sure.

0_1RxK7yGuUCNX34s4Y62Q.text: Driving through China town on a Saturday night about 11. Wasn't really hungry but saw a Fukuburger truck and pulled into the parking lot but now I wanted rice. Come on I'm in China town, I am not gonna eat a burger with all the different restaurants around. Saw this place in the same parking lot, what is this all about, a bunch of tofu dishes? ok I'll try it.   They offered a pretty small selection maybe 8 Items AYCE for 13.99 (the way we went), tongue, squid, brisket, spicy chicken, 2 types of pork belly, and a few more.16.99 for short ribs or steam eggs. Include a variety of Korean sides and a kinda salty salad. I think drinks like soda and alcohol were extra because they never offered drinks and kept giving us water. The tongue was surprisingly ok, tasted like regular meat.  Spicy chicken and marinated pork belly were good but took too long to cook.  The very first item on the menu, forgot what it was sliced something, but not a good choice for grilling it was in tiny chunks like ground beef but not as packed in and kept falling into the grill openings. If u do get this cook it as one whole piece like a burger and let it burn a bit, easier to flip that way.   Customer service was ok once we got going. Two other groups were there when got there, the girl told us take our seats, waited almost 15 mins before anything went on. They got our ingredients, etc quickly.   In comparison to the other self cooking Korean places that I've been to, two other places, it is my #3 choice. Because its cheaper but way lesser selections and have no idea about the drinks.

0DHayTFCyohMdO1V0ifNHA.text: As one of the late night options for Korean near work, Tofu Hut is not a shabby option. Is it my favorite for soon dubu? No, but their kalbi is rather delicious. A group of us came in to grab a bite after work. We did not feel like doing all you can eat, so we ordered off the menu.  Japchae- glass noodles with beef and vegetables used too much soy sauce. Normally they are lightly colored by the dark sauce and has a complimentary taste of sesame oil, but this one was predominately soy sauce. I didn't eat more than a few bites of it.  Mixed beef and seafood soon dubu had plenty of seafood and beef pieces. The abundance of soft tofu made the dish enjoyable, but it lacked flavor. Same could be said about the mushroom pot.  Bulgogi- thinly sliced beef marinated in soy sauce and sugar sauce with vegetables. This dish was on the sweet side. Combined with the kimchi, it balanced out, but too much on it's own.  Kalbi- soy sauce based marinated beef short ribs. These are the best! It was so good, that we ordered another plate. The flavor was balanced and the meat was so tender. I could pull the meat right off the bone without much resistance. It definitely was the saving grace of the meal.

_8ex1MDHBAKngacn259tRg.text: This place is very small. I had to wait for 1hr to be seated.  The food was not the best because the grill was not working. I think I ate raw pork and chicken because the grill was messed up. There was so much smoke coming from our grill that they didn't brother to fix it after we were done eating raw meat. Place was too small and not worth going even if the price was cheap.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat remind raw after 2hrs of cooking. Scary !

O3YFutujaMv2Rc6V3-K1HQ.text: Well it's freezing outside it only makes sense to go to tofu hut and sink your face into a steaming spicy hot clay pot of suun do boo. Well it hit the spot tonight. There is usually no wait if you are not getting the all you can eat bbq so if that's you check the right part of restaurant first there will prob be tables for you to start grubbing. I got the dumpling which comes with dumplings and beef. All tofu soup is $8 something. It wasn't the best I've had but I was impressed by the amount of beef and dumpling in it. Usually you get super shisted but they don't hold out. The ban chan is not bad either. Also the combo with tofu soup and meat is a good value. I tried the combo short ribs and it was good but you can tell it wasn't a great piece of meat. Service was fast and food was hot though and I am a very happy wannabe Korean despite the continuous play of ghetto Korean music videos with skinny Korean chicks' shaking their little butts and words like swag sporadicly pop up in mist of all the bootie shaking and tofu soup. You may think that I'm going off on a bit of a tangent but all these little elements adds to the dining experience. So yeah eat at your own discretion.

sPk-oyltheGmaWKvThjWEw.text: After visiting Sura so many times, we decided to give Tofu Hut a shot after a coworkers recommendation. In short, tofu is just the tip of the iceberg. This review is for the AYCE experience.  AYCE is served differently here than most buffet style restaurants. Yes, it's all you can eat, however you place up to four orders of meat and they bring it out to you, which are actually perfectly portioned so you don't get charged for wasting items.  Food wise, the food is fantastic. They bring you out six small appetizers to snack on while your meat arrived. We decided on the sliced ribeye, short ribs, beef tongue, brisket, and pork belly. All we satisfying. One of the things we wished we had was some kind of sauce (be it soy, tempura, teriyaki, anything) to dip our meat in. Granted, the natural flavors of the meats are great, however some of the meats other than the pre-marinated ones are lacking in seasoning.   The downside, the service is awful. We only seen our waitress twice, and that was to drop off our water, and present the check. We were never asked for any soft drinks, beer, etc, and we had to order from another server when we wanted refills on our drinks, and to order more meat. We just sat there wanting to eat more, and it was a good fifteen minutes before we grabbed the attention of a friendly male waiter. I know most traditional inspired Asian restaurants aren't known for their service, however if I'm giving you my money, I want to at least be acknowledged from time to time!  Decent experience, food was great, kind of overshadowed by lacking service. Oh well. Still full!

qoN80xcgrgIKLUEYxAENBg.text: I've heard a lot of people talk highly about this place and was really excited when I finally got to go here but it was a big disappointment. The food was okay. The only thing I really enjoyed was the ribeye. And I didn't like the fact the steamed egg was $5. I will admit the price from 10-2am is cheap but there wasn't much of a selection of meat. Also the wait is ridiculous.

6qmV6G1eoT4AaV27m6pC6Q.text: Huge fan of Tofu Hut when it comes to AYCE Korean BBQ. The one downside to this place is  it's quite small. Only half the restaurant is dedicated to BBQ and the other half regular menu service. So with that in mind, on busy nights, there can be quite a wait, especially if you have a larger party.  Now on to the good stuff. Everything here is awesome! I mean where can you go wrong with AYCE BBQ? There are plenty of sides and the staff is quite attentive. Personally I love to sit there, grill my meat and just mix it right in the salad bowl and go to town. Man do I miss this place. Because when it comes to Korean BBQ, fancy doesn't always mean good.   Tip: $13.99 all you can eat 2300-0500

cIHeZ8Uo7nn1h7MJ-_95KA.text: If I could give a negative star I would. My boyfriend and I put our names in and were given a wait time of 45 minutes. When we went back 30 minutes later our spot was given to people that came in many minutes after us. We were refused service, and felt very displeased and were dealing with Eddie the "person in charge". And he wouldn't let us speak to his co manager. Eddie than told us that we can be put back into the list but wouldn't be seated tonight. He wasted our valuable time. So we went to PHO KIM LONG with was amazing food with amazing customer service. Also the TIKI ROOM is great fun place to go when you want something new I'm Vegas.

h1XbflN038cYq4kEssD4kg.text: I don't come here for the kbbq (although I have been once and it was average). The tofu soup is amazing. Service is always fast, tables are always open, food is always good, reliable, and never varies on taste. It's also very cheap and filling.  I stick with a combination plate with tofu soup and bulgogi. It comes with mushroom tofu soup but I subsitute it with kimchi beef. I can't have spicy food so I stick with mild and it's always excellent. However my friend does get spicy soup and says the spicyness varies each time.   That being said, highly recommended and addicting!

eIcZ65WKpm6H2zsl1sJo4Q.text: It was my first time eating Korean BBQ and I decided on Tofu Hut because of the Yelp reviews. It was fun to cook your own meat at the table and they give you plenty. I was stuffed when I left.  The place looked clean and I received good service.

kMZTg-M05H6ojUwvhmDCMg.text: All you can eat for $16.99 per person. Wow, we had a lot of food! Each table is allowed to pick four items at a time. After finishing whichever item, you can pick something different to try. We weren't able to even finish the food we ordered, so we never ordered more. Everything was really tasty and our stomachs were happy! Too bad you're not able to take the leftovers home. Felt like such a waste of food. Not my first time here and won't be my last.

XJx6fM2EvHXlH9khR0mr3w.text: I love the steamed egg, beef tongue and short ribs!!! The servers here are really friendly! I  love all the side dishes as well. There are alot to ayce korean places in las vegas to eat at, this is got to be in the top five.....

NvWhC2cWJhbwPXtmlTUcng.text: This place is really good, they're open very late.. the BBQ is excellent. if you go late, it get's cheaper.. my wife always orders this tofu soup thing, not my favorite but she seems to love it..

p0NknScs7eUFIBkMbDGTsQ.text: Been going to this place since I moved to Vegas 9 years ago and the quality of food is always consistently above average and never dissapoints no matter what I get.  However, the service gets progressively worse.  Its unreal how disconnected they seem to be with the customers.  There have been times myself or my friends would wave our hand in their face as they troll by zombie like and continue to the protection of their counter.  If you can get past the lack of customer service the food is always good.

puVjoNB-XrTREFcQrh99vw.text: My favorite place to go to whenever I'm craving alot of protein. The mamasan there is really nice n helpful when the comes to cooking it yourself. The pork belly is a must, and I love that they give all those sides. I admit...i go there at least once every two weeks. I hope they never leave.

tu10_Z4TpDUOkCPcw_Cvjw.text: I came here with my fiance and another couple.  We wanted to eat at Mr. Tofu, but they are closed on Sundays.  My fiance used to come to Tofu Hut a lot before discovering Mr. Tofu.  Since I have limited experience with Korean restaurants, I will be comparing Tofu Hut with Mr. Tofu, which is directly across the street.  The parking in both places could be better.  Tofu Hut has more seating and was busier.  Some tables at Tofu Hut had grills built into the tables.  As you may know, each meal comes with some complimentary sides.  The sides at Tofu Hut are better.  I like the fish cakes.  Also, they gave us slices of bread made from rice that was pretty good.  I always order the same thing, bibimbap dolcet.  They are equally good at both places.  Tofu Hut gives you a large bottle of spicy bean paste.  Mr. Tofu provides a small portion.  The rice never got crunchy, which is my favorite part.  I guess the hot pot cooled down too much before they could add the ingredients.  Perhaps an oversight because they were so busy.  A careless mistake in my opinion.  That is the best part of the dish.  At Tofu Hut, bibimbap dolcet also comes with spicy tofu soup made with spicy bean paste.  That was the best part.  Really good and hot.  They add one raw egg.  I love dipping the fish cake in the spicy soup.  I think the price is similar.  My fiance got her usual, which is tofu soup.  It was not very good.  Our friends ordered galbi, bulgogi, and some sort of spicy chicken dish.  The galbi was very good.  The bulgogi was disappointing.  The other chicken dish was really good.  Overall, I liked Tofu Hut better, but I doubt my fiance will agree, so you will probably see me back at Mr. Tofu.  Both are good.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tofu soup
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bimbimbap dolcet

TG2qy21Hhf6WUFWjzSNOiQ.text: This place has the best bulgogi in Las Vegas hands down!! I loved the Korean food joints in L.A. ; always open late and super fast friendly service, well this is the same! and Jimmy (our regular server) is just about the most awesome server there. I recommend this place wholeheartedly.

IEKjG4wOaf4sNN_DYY5Q6w.text: This is a great late night spot.  I think they have a great chopped salad and their selection of meat and kimchi is great.  I do feel they have some items I stay away from like the Squid.  Steamed Egg Great, Miso Soup Great and it's all you can eat.  Have to try it

s8GyYCxA5g74tZLI09Wf9A.text: Tofu Hut is a cute little free-standing Korean place. I come here once in a while for a hefty late night snack. They have yakiniku and lots of topu soups.   We just went last night for some topu soup. They had a little poster on the wall advertising free karaoke from 11p to 4a above a little karaoke system and monitor.   I ordered the sashimi bibimbap ($10) from the poster next to.   I like ordering things off the wall apparently. I think I got that from Ichiza.   The server dropped all of the banchan, nothing special, but there was seven or eight different shallow banchan.   My entree came with a topu soup, the Korean version of miso. The server said my sashimi was "a white fish, yellowtail." They drop this huge bowl of salad greens, daikon, and sashimi. You're supposed to dump some rice in and this spicy, sweet, vinegary sauce and mix it all up. I've never had bibimbap because I don't eat meat too often. It was pretty good. Only the sashimi was still frozen. Meh.   It was enough to fill me up PLUS take leftovers home. Leftovers is my best friend.   When you're ready for the bill, you have to body check the waitress to get some attention. But aren't all Korean/ Chinese/ Viet restaurants like that? No? Dust? Anyone? I don't know.   I like Tofu Hut. Their prices aren't great, but the portions are huge. And they have soju. And soju puts me to bed with visions of sugar plums ...   * off the strip, non-casino

WMYhwPg-8SqEgl8R39nELg.text: The tofu soup and the korean bbq is really yummy!  When I am in Vegas visiting family I always want to make a trip here!  Reasonably priced too.  I am getting hungry thinking about it!

KLIFypAAsMdNoZJxpNJSVg.text: First time I've tried kbbq in Vegas. The sides were pretty good n they kept bringing these whenever we asked. The flavor of the meats were also good n there was hardly any fat on the brisket everytime. Now the part that really sucks...the lag on meat big time. We had to ask repeatedly and when I say repeatedly I mean at least 5 times before they brought out another plate of meat. One guy even pretended he couldn't hear me when he was walking past me as I was trying to ask for meat. For me if your not giving me my order then you're trying to rip me off. So if you like the sides at kbbq, then go but if you like a lot of meat skip this place because they're fuckin shiesty!!

OB2CnW1tfXb-P0uUzmzJOQ.text: One of the locations my bf and I take our coworkers to is Tofu Hut. We come here every now and then after work for their happy house special $13.99 for AYCE korean bbq. After reading the review from channel 13 dirty dining reports, we were hesitant to go back there. But nonetheless, they got their A grade back, which means everything should be up to health code. Owning my own restaurant, keeping up to healthcode is sooo important. We reserved a table and the same guy and girl who works there is always kind to us. The meat is good and can't complain too much about the banchan cause we only go there to eat the meat & salad. Okay for $13.99, you really cant beat the price, yes their selection is limited BUT their selection contains main meats that we usually only get. Come to happy hour with your friends to share a few laughs, drink, & eat!!! well worth it!

FFLlo6SGeJmwKsYmndC1CA.text: Go in hungry, leave unbuttoning your belt. All the meat is good , but the short ribs r ridiculous!! Add  the 15$ price and its the best deal in town !!

rYZURJn1SgBZAHfOGj94EA.text: LOVE veggie tofu soup. I always order the spicy ones. The price is reasonable.

8qQquPz8JscuBJBCvLNXdw.text: Tofu Hut is usually a place my friends and I frequent after a night of alcohol binging around town.  We usually come here for their AYCE since they're open late (4am).  We always order the rib eye, brisket, marinated pork belly and the bean paste soup (so good after all that alcohol!).  The amount of meat we consume, $13.99 is very much worth it.  Come here if you're having some late night munchies.

oqYI8zrNVd_6wPWA2BXFNA.text: This is a pretty good place to eat at and comes with tons of food!  So make sure you come hungry!  My g/f and I love this place! Everything you cook in the grill and can order anywhere from sliced rib-eye to cow's tongue :)  The appetizer is one the of best parts as it comes in 6 little different dishes to try and comes w/ a big bowl of SALAD (which is pretty good and different) It's decently priced $16.99 during the day and $13.99 after 11 p.m.  So if your craving some korean BBQ...this is a pretty good place to start off at!  Only problem is tho is they usually only have 1 server so it's kinda slow....so be patient!

YVVFPcRFm1yZfj-WvMxsdQ.text: Horrible. We ate at Tofu Hut on January 14, 2012. I have been to a lot of Korean BBQ restaurants, and I typicaly love the food and experience. but I have never had this poor of an experience. Side dishes were mediocre at best, out of date at worse, meat was rubbery, could hardly get it down. Service was THE WORSE I have EVER experienced at any restaurant, anywhere. Waitress showed up at the beginning and end of the meal to drop of the bill. Kids drop their utensil? Get up and ask for another. Need a napkin or chop-sticks? Get up and ask for it. Want something to drink besides water? Too bad, they didn't even offer- even after asking! Lots of other Korean BBQ in Las Vegas- go to any other- I have been to many- they are all better.

Ud6CC0ecC1V2_uCaU9RrxQ.text: Came here for late night munchies and ordered some Japchae.  Not only was the food overpriced (more than $10 for asian food!) but my vegetarian Japchae was excessively oily and gross.  I tasted my friend's tofu soup and it wasn't that great either.  There is probably much better Korean food elsewhere in the Vegas area.  Next time, I'll pass.

Mi-DjDqtutokL2gXtGPUHg.text: A small Korean-owned restaurant that is very well priced and offers good standard food. I ordered the beef-kimchi-tofu soup and it was definitely worth the price (9$). The service was very quick, there was Korean t.v. own to add to the authentic vibe. I am going to have to go back to try the All-you-can-eat.

EwqhON8Bz-1FBAOZj45Mlg.text: The food is decent. They have a good selection of meats to choose from. The kimchi is really good. The service is really slow and you will have to ask for refills because they don't pay enough attention to your drinks. Overall this place has gone down hill in the past couple years.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lY9nD5xOGZYyvRlo7TZEdQ.text: Sadly, They are discontinuing the late night pricing.  For the price it was excellent.  But with the price hike, I'd prefer to go to Hwaro or Biwon.    I came here twice within the last two months.  Once there was a hair UNDER the meat.  Ewwww..  And the last time I went, the service excellent, but the food was lacking flavor.    These two reasons are a deal breaker since there are so many other places worthy in this town.

BxR5nXyzBY5x4Hx7JWqvKw.text: $16.99 AYCE kbbq (or $13.99 after 1030PM)  is pretty tempting... but is it really worth the lower quality of meat, the fears of creepy crawlies walking on your silverware in the back and the constant voice in the back of your head reminding you of Tofu Hut's appearance on Dirty Dining? Hmm maybe I'll fork over the extra couple of bucks to go somewhere else.   There was a ~10 min. wait, as usual (actually, "as usual" means a 30+ minute wait, so I guess it was a short wait). By the time we got to the table the small plates, rice, salad were already there. A+ for fast service! However the rice was already a little cold so it was a nice attempt, but a fail.   Order the marinated sliced ribeye, order the marinated sliced ribeye! It was the best out of the meats we ordered. Soft and juicy! The brisket, tripe, beef tongue were a little dry.  The small plates were good- you can get extra orders of it all.  The steamed egg was dry and not the soft fluffiness you expect.

xnUCa-TkizAf6ZURlT5kDw.text: I've been coming to Tofu Hut for quite some time. For a long while it was my fave KBBQ.  The thing is, their service can be so spotty. Sometimes I'll get pretty decent service but on many multiple occasions the service hasn't been great.   If you've never been here, come earlier then you intend on eating and be prepared for an hour wait (which you're probably going to get no matter which kbbq restaurant you go to.  The food's good for the price! I just wished the service matched.

Z1zQRVvXvAFaJA7BbS0gAQ.text: Yeah, I would say "Hut" is a good word to describe this place. It is kind of small for being a Korean Barbeque joint.   Here's the deal. When you first come in, the left half of the restaurant is designated for AYCE while the right half is for a la carte. Make sure to sign in so you can have your place in line. Don't forget to include the time you signed in along with the number in your party.  I would say you got room for about 48 people total in the whole restaurant. So on really busy days, you just might be waiting a while to sit down.  The day I went, we had total of 16 for our party. Surprisingly, we were seated after waiting about 30 minutes. Not bad for a party of our size.  So here's the low down if AYCE is your option. - You need a minimum of two people to pick this option so if you are going solo, then a la carte is your only option. - $16.99 per person any time. $13.99 from 10 pm to 2 am. - No to go or take home. (Duh!) - Don't be afraid to ask for refills on any of your sides because there is no extra charge. - You must eat all the meat that you order or you will be charged extra.  As for the meats, I was pleasantly surprised, especially the marinated items like brisket, ribeye, and pork. The sides were good as well from the kimchi all the way to the salad, which is very solid. The salad itself I can eat all day.  Service was fast and furious, which would of made Paul Walker proud (may he Rest In Peace) for our party was eating like there was no tomorrow. I was impressed because not only did they keep up with our demands, but all our waters were constantly refilled.   So TH, I will definitely mention you if anybody asks about ACYE Korean Barbeque.  Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #5

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of 1/2/14.
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FOOOOOOOOOD!!!!!!!!!

RdKDl3gP_S4Bdr4zVPS6uA.text: This place is awesome! We had party of 6 and waited for about an hour, but it was worth of the wait. It's not a big place but with good quality food. Their meats are fresh and have good flavors. I love their salad, great for taking away the grease from the meat, refreshing. The waitresses were pretty fast and nice. Will definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat fresh and juicy!!

_g5sWLuGxSJ8toqTHYvs-g.text: Quick service. Came here for Sunday lunch. Generous portions and flavorful food. Their banchan (side dishes) were petty good. Ordered tofu stew and spicy beefy stew. Next time, going to try $16.99 per person A.Y.C.E. bbq.

cDQcYvy2hGlKDvI7HmXgrw.text: The good thing about Tofu Hut is that you can get a cheap meal late at night. $14 from 10pm-2am or $17 any other time.   My friends and I had dinner and drinks prior to coming here. There was no other reason for us to be here other than we were craving Korean BBQ. I can eat pretty much every hour since I'm always hungry. There were some empty tables at 1am which is why it didn't make sense to me to have to wait for a table. There were 2 guys before us waiting for a table.  We got our ban chan which were pretty tasty. But their meat selections were pretty limited. We got the marinated rib eye, pork belly and brisket. There's an AYCE Korean BBQ place that has rib eye not too far away from TH and I like theirs better. So, I was a bit disappointed with TH's rib eye...it wasn't tasty for being marinated and it's not that tender. You can't go wrong with brisket since it's super quick to cook and it's good stuff. Pork belly - we kept ordering this. They have a limit of 4 orders and at least 2 people need to do AYCE. You mean, if I sleep eat they won't serve me anything? Well, booooo!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prices
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meats, salad and ban chan
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye, pork belly and brisket...and a salad

IXMvNs4hPBQc2Tc1e7-i5w.text: I love tofu hut.  I've been here many times.  Overall it is my favorite AYCE KBBQ place.  They have my favorite kimchi and salad ban chan.  Their decor, Service, and meat is actually improving. Although they offer a late night special on AYCE the best meat isn't offered so go for the $16.99 option.  My one gripe is the service is really lacking. They don't come around much, they hardly refill drinks, they hardly bring around napkins, they don't seem to like when you request a banchan refill. That last part is most annoying. I admit it is a hit or miss. It really just depends on the time and who is working.  I first noticed this annoyance when dining at Sura. They are buffet style yet their servers come come around so much! They refill and check on you more than Tofu Hut and that is just disappointing for Tofu Hut.

jXu2C023_tQC_EJ7KttAkQ.text: This place never disappoints. As frequent diners, the MARINATED RIBEYE is superb! We usually also get BRISKET and BEEF TONGUE. We honestly shy away from the chicken thighs because it takes too long to cook & tends to be somewhat dry. The salad that comes with the meal is incredible and so are all of the sides!  The price after 10pm decreases to only 13.99$ for AYCE, which is a great price for how much you get. The only downside is they close at 3AM with a last call at 2, and there can also be a wait on busy days since seating with grills are limited. But nonetheless, extremely recommended as our favorite Korean BBQ place in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu Hut&#39;s AYCE Korean bbq!

BRVHE_QOcaxmrdoEjE1t_Q.text: No wonder my buddy Jerry Ngo goes here seemingly every night!  This place offers a great korean bbq experience at a fraction of the price that other similar places offer.  At $16.99 all day, and a few dollars cheaper after 10PM, why even bother anywhere else?! =P  The food was great and offered many selections of meat.   Off the top of my head:  Chicken, pork belly, tripe, marinated short rib,  beef tongue, brisket, and even squid.  There were a few more and I'll remember to take a picture of the selections next time.   If you paid the regular price you also can order their steamed egg dish.  It came out piping hot, with green onions mixed in with the fluffy eggs.  Very tasty, but let me warn you again, it's comes out really hot!  Prior to the arrival of all the meat, we were served many side dishes which included rice, seaweed, a chopchae noodle dish, something with chopped fish in it, and a few other things.  The standout side dish is their salad.  Im not sure what was in it, but it was very very good,  Come early!  This place is not as big as other places and fills up fast!  The wait can be long.    If the storeowners read this, I would definitely recommend considering changing their other half of the room (the ala carte section)  to add in more tables with grills.   That half of the room was pretty empty save for maybe one person, while there was a line building up in the front door.  I should have checked out this place sooner, definitely coming again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eEKc_ApJ8HzM7ptcdqQwdA.text: Loved this place.  Expect waiting (we waited about 45 min).  We also went for dinner so they had more options for meat. It was fun and delicious. It's a little pricey but definitely worth it. Lots of sides to choose from. The waitresses are pretty fast getting food/drink out. Highly recommended if you're about that Korean BBQ life

dBRnyUVk6FnFyCIyTnxb2A.text: I really hate to do this, because this once was my "Go-to" spot for KBBQ.. it has the best late night price in Vegas for $13.99, and even there regular all day price for $16.99.. I mean really you cannot beat that price!!   But why 1 star?! Why am I updating my raving review about them?! Why am I probably never going to return to my once favorite KBBQ spot?! why you ask.. lemme tell you, it's because a little critter called a COCKROACH crawled its way across our chair we were seated at, and made it's way up against the glass window.. while we were still eating!!  Had to get the attention of the servers that we had an unwelcome guest trying to join us.. and he quickly grabbed two menus to scoop up the critter to have it removed, and tossed it outside.. but I'm sorry my friend, where there is one seen.. there are always more to be found. There is NEVER just ONE COCKROACH.. and this one that was trying to join us was not full grown.. so somewhere are its mommy and daddy COCKROACH and siblings roaming around.   The server apologized.. and we could see the rest of the servers quietly talking about it among themselves at the register. To EXTREME disappointment, no management came to approach us to apologize for the incident that totally ruined our meal and appetite.. I was even about to order another round of brisket, but after that.. I could barely swallow what I was already chewing..   My bf's dad, who works in hand with the health department and the USDA, was NOT HAPPY.. he asked to speak to the manager after they gave us the check.. which nothing was compensated for the horrific experience, and the server he was speaking to was playing dumb like she didn't understand what he was asking.. so he calmly said, "Well, when you do speak to your manager, please let him know everything was really good. The food all tasted great and was good up until the COCKROACH."   To make this story even better.. is that this was my first time having dinner with my boyfriend's parents, it was their first time eating here at Tofu Hut, and it was their first time having KBBQ grill style, oh and it was me that recommended the place :/ I was SOOOOOO embarrassed because I had explained the concept of the restaurant and raved about how good it was, and the parents were even saying on the car ride there that they were excited to have AYCE meats..   My boyfriend's dad was really upset and super disappointed that no type of management came out to apologize and talk to us, there was no sense of urgency, sincerity in the apology, or showing that there would be some kind of action taken.   I originally gave this place 4 stars because I really did love eating here.. DID is key word. I had taken off 1 star for the decor being run down and old and menus being sticky, and the bathroom being nasty.. but after this experience yesterday on 10/07/15... that's something you never forget, and it really does make you sick to see COCKROACH running around while you're eating. And something needs to be done. And to physically see a cockroach run around with my own eyes, while I'm eating in a restaurant is something I would never wish on anyone to experience. I literally almost threw up right there.   So to end this review.. I'm sadden.. and disgusted to say that I will never be returning to Tofu Hut, no matter how good the meat is. It honestly saddens me to give this review and rating, but it's one thing to bitch and complain about terrible tasting food, or shitty service while dining.. but to be accompanied by a COCKROACH while eating raw meat that is being brought out to you is one a whole other kinda level. Oh, and my boyfriend's dad today did make a call to the Health Department.

jmyaCIm60sJB5fbwyxeItg.text: You can have a barbecue with your friends. You can eat it casually. I like to eat small dishes. The meat is good. But there are too many guests. Wait for half an hour each time. Sometimes it takes an hour. Although it takes a long time, I still like to come here. It's very good ,l love it.thank you so much!!!

J_5uFkD5gWhkYdwI5kKJAQ.text: tldr  I wish it was open 24 hours. Salad is bomb, sides are amazing, meat is fresh, fast service. Dislike the lack of tables and wait times. $13.99 after 10; $16.99 otherwise.  Get: -marinated ribeye -beef tongue -brisket

aCUIMXI8oDahWeoJikW-ug.text: This place is great. Always has a long line of waiting for BBQ, but there is still people waiting for it. Because it is deserve for waiting.   I love the short rib, beef tongue, and steam egg. Especially when you eat the meat with the salad, it is delicious.   We will come back soon

dGkkYnJwigKUJQ-OgQy1vw.text: Decent food, not the best korean bbq. However, if you're looking for cheap K-BBQ then go here with your family.

1F1cN4FwBZGgr62qznb0nQ.text: We don't do the korean bbq, there's always a long line.   Since everyone is always in line for korean bbq, we get seated right away for the menu side.   I always order the tofu pot, beef or sometimes the dumpling. They ask you the heat level, I get the mild cause the hot is too spicy. They serve mini dishes before your meal, like kimchi and pickled veggies.   The bulgogi and spicy chicken are really good, tender and delish.  My family and I have been going here for a long time now and it hasn't change!

fJ4SfbWYU7buC5Fmc4tBQg.text: This place isn't horrible, but you definitely get what you pay for. The chicken carried a gelatinous consistency regardless of how long it was cooked. The ribeye was awesome, great flavor every time it was cooked. There's a way better option on Maryland parkway and Algonquin across the street from a Blue Berry Hill. Much better service, environment, and food. It's a little more expensive, but well worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time at the Tofu Hut!

qd8IK5SxKnJFgE1hSTm0-g.text: I used to really like Tofu Hut. I thought the late night special was such a great deal! $13.99 after 10pm.   However, I recently got back from Korea where I had Korean bbq constantly. It was more expensive to eat Korean bbq there, but the meat quality was so much better. The last time I went to Tofu Hut, the meat was horrible. The Kalbi was tough. Most of the meat was tough and dry. I really enjoyed the steam egg and the salad, but I was not eating Korean Bbq to eat those items.   The service was decent. It was neither good or bad. Nothing worth noting about.   The meat quality was pretty horrible, and I don't know the next time that I will be returning.

VW9TQZ04v6kH41S108C1VA.text: This place has really gone downhill. Yes the price is cheap for all you can eat korean BBQ but are you willing to risk your health for a cheap meal? It's a Korean restaurant where you see no Korean customers. That saids it all.

DM7kzeWezk2u9VfjdGjh3w.text: Hooked on the short ribs. ....so tasty...and ban chan is yummy..wish they had meat jun. No need to order mandoo cause lots of ban chan. So far my second time here and the server was good.  Came after work at midnight and BBQ side was crowded.

dRPvFqsVz9LhJDrTUT52ow.text: I really like coming to Tofu Hut. Their food is always delicious and so very satisfying.  Tofu Hut is popular for their late night ayce special, but I would like to note that I am not reviewing for that, my family and I usually just sit at a regular table because there is never any wait time for the cooking tables.  My family and I ate here last night and we had a good dining experience. Normally their kim chee is lovely, but last night is was way too spicy and my water was not getting filled up fast enough. All of the other side dishes were marvelous, though. Last night, my favorite was the Jab Che. Everyone at my table ordered the Kalbi plates. Last night my Kalbi was sooo tender! I finished everything! Oh, we also ordered the Barbeque salad, and I felt that too was also a tad but spicier than usual. Other than the spice, everything tasted great, like it always does.  Tofu Hut is a great spot for having some great food! Definitely choose to sit at a regular table if you want to avoid waiting.

gSWjRbtlq-LTn9G-5TvQkw.text: I too don't like 1 star reviews. There were mentions of how rude the owner was. I too experienced this. Got under cooked chicken. Sent it back. Then she tried to charge me for the dish. The rolling of the eyes and rude behavior was too much. I had to go to counter to get a fork, and plates and drinks. Won't go back again.

El222EJE0HCGyG9dyYm8bw.text: Fact: if you have upwards of 18 tables in your dining room and 2 servers, one of whom is manning the cash register, you DO NOT need to be Asian to do the math that this is not enough people to manage the operation.   I came in right before Christmas with the fam bam because nothing says "holiday cheer" like a hot bowl of tofu. Of all the tofu premises around Vegas we usually frequent Tofu Hut for the below:  + Consistency + Flavor + Prices (& lunch specials M-F, excluding holidays)  Here are the things you will have to wait for:  - Seating - Ban chan - Water. Hot tea. Beverages in general. - Having your order taken. - Your check.   So another math lesson: 3 pros for 5 cons is muy malo. However, when your pros outweigh the cons, what can you do but come back for what is otherwise a solid tofu fixing? If you can't beat 'em, join 'em.

T-n68kyfWgDyd81euDAJPA.text: This place is ok. The main draw for me is the late night price of $13.99 for ayce BBQ after 10pm. Is it the best Korean BBQ place in Vegas? Not in my opinion. But it's good enough to get me to come back again for the late night price. I do however find the service to be spotty and sometimes a bit unfriendly.

jCMej65icZ1Zb9Lw7DitfQ.text: I love  (Korean Soft Tofu Soup) so much it's very common that sometimes I make some at home for myself. But when I go out for tofu soup, by far this is my favorite in Vegas. They have several different varieties featuring pork, beef, seafood or even vegetarian friendly mushroom tofu soup. I usually order the mix... yup, has everything :)  I'm afraid, I can't help you much on the rest of menu as I can't pull myself away from their tofu soup!!!  Service is... Korean style. They will bring your drink ans food but if you need something else, i.e. refill or more napkims you just wave or call. It is customary and they won't think you're being rude. If you wait for them to check on your table, you may wait a while.

_BNjXv_dsp_PUBU97YWl1Q.text: food: there's not much selections, but you only need a few things to make it great. the ban chan selections are decent. i liked the salad a lot. all the meat was good quality. ***4/5  service: one of the better services i have had for a korean bbq buffet. most of the time the servers try to ignore your requests, but this place is fast to the order. they probably do it too well. i asked for an half order and they gave me a full order anyways. thats the kind of people i like. it's worth the wait. we waited nearly an hour. ***4/5  value: the quality is great and the service was awesome. price is just right. i ate so much, i almost felt guilty. ***5/5

CZYg5ZfjJIO1cOgmLvXswA.text: This is my favorite Korean BBQ in town. Can't beat the price and its the only one in China Town open late.   The wait is long but that's what to expect for a place that's packed 24/7.

WRWlL9ZXcGKXINMOB66sug.text: place needs to hire people who know how to speak and listen to customers about simple things like "do you want all you can eat," or "do you want the a la carte menu," and "please wait while we seat you"  server on staff last night, the short Korean girl with long ponytail made me wait 20 mins for an a la carte table, sat us down at a barbecue table, waved us over to the a la carte table, argued that I came in saying "2 people," when I specifically made a point to let her know that I don't want all you can eat. to have the nerve to point and scream at me saying a bunch of unmentionables. bottom line high risk establishment. didn't get to eat. when I showed my dismay. I was thrown out. so I never got to try the food.          .

BB5iGi-XiZJeIopgIf5RQA.text: This place was good. It had a nice selection of meats.   We ordered the squid, tripe, Spicy pork belly, and beef tongue. When your order the squid you get the whole squid which is cool, The tripe also had beef intestines which were really good they cleaned the intestines pretty well because you don't get any of that strong flavor that you would normally get if someone didn't clean it out well. The beef tongue was very tender as for the pork belly, which i like a lot because it had a nice kick to it. Yum. I thought the side were good as well. You could as them for more without being charged extra.   Service was ok. But that is only because it was busy. i'm pretty sure if they weren't busy they service would have been a little bit better. But that's for any place.  What i really love about this place is the quality of everything was really good for the price that the offered. Well worth it!

xterzLXVlOelDRHEZXe-dw.text: Service: 0/5 Wasn't the most welcoming that's for sure. When I walked in I stood in the door way/waiting area for like 5 minutes as I waited and stared at each employee of this place idk maybe because I wasn't Korean I wasn't getting the best service at the door. Finally we got seated, I felt rushed by my waitress and trust me after she dropped off our dishes that was the last time I saw her. She never came back to refill our waters or anything. Flagging someone down just to pay the bill was also an issue no one paid attention to us.   Kim Chi Beef: 3/5  I liked their Kim Chi beef but it doesn't compare to other places I've tried. A bit mediocre it was very watery and salty. I had huge chunks of Kim Chi which I liked but I had no idea where he "beef" was. I'm guessing it had to be some sort of ground beef. The tofu was cooked perfect though not too soft not to hard  Seafood Beef: 2/5  My boyfriend got this dish because he loves sea food in this Tofu, but omg super salty it tasted to bland not even tasty. There was barely any sea food in his the only thing I could recall were scallops and they tasted like imitation scallops. The tofu was cooked perfect though not too soft not to hard  Side dishes: 2/5 I actually really liked their assortment of side dishes but our waitress was never around to refill them. I was pretty disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loving the condiments

2KL6Kz8pqIqpIS6bGElTyA.text: I don't like giving one star reviews.  I think almost everything has to go wrong in order for that to happen...  In reality, I would give this place a 1.5.  First off, if you are going to call your restaurant "Tofu Hut," understand that you need to have more than one dish that is vegetarian.  Period.  You might as well change it to "Only Meat Hut."  The rest of the place is scary down to the scary karaoke on the flatscreen.  Try to avoid the bathrooms, they wreak of a combination of vomit and heavy duty cleaning solutions.    The one frazzled woman working the lunch shift was nice enough although very confused when we asked where the tofu was when looking at the menu.  The only vegetarian dish is a cold buckwheat noodle dish with chopped lettuce on top.  Despite the claim that it is vegetarian, there is a totally suspect looking hard-boiled egg tossed on top.    The one thing that was actually enjoyable was the array of kimchi.  It was truly impressive ranging from the standard pickled Napa cabbage to seaweed to tofu varieties.  I guess I'll end this review on that positive note.  Meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

waZzzzf9ZLmTv3backA6zg.text: I've been coming to Tofu Hut for years and it's definitely had it's ups and downs but seemingly the quality is going up. My favorite part is always the salad. I won't lie, depending on which staff was working would depict the quality of the banchan and salad. Recently though the quality is good day and night and no matter which members are working.  Pros: Pretty cheap prices for AYCE. Meat thickness is always consistent and marinated beautifully if they're meant to be marinated. Meat always is fresh and delicious. Sign-in list for AYCE during busy times has helped manage the crowds much easier during dinner and late hours opposed to its early years. They offer a menu of non-AYCE meals that are reasonably priced and taste very good for when you don't feel like cooking your own food. The AC is usually running at a decent rate depending on the crowds - there was only one time in the past few years where I was too hot to eat. Unlimited everything so it's good for big groups and hungry people! The staff is often very nice but sometimes the women don't appear friendly.   Cons: Only two restrooms, one male and female, so there will be a wait time sometimes if suddenly multiple people need to use the restroom. The atmosphere is often times going to be loud due to overhead music, people chattering, and the sizzling of the grills. The waiting area is small so sometimes you'll be lining up down the hall or near the door waiting for your AYCE table. The grills may be set too hot sometimes, but if that happens just flag down a waiter and ask them to turn it down and then wait a minute before cooking again (like you would at home).  Overall it's always been a great experience for me at Tofu Hut and I eat here like 15 times a year without regret. I only give 4 stars because I'm counting all my experiences from their opening to today and it's not always been perfect each time.

DD39y8vkwqErFvf_IBYzrQ.text: I go for the delicious tofu soup.    I've never had Korean bbq here.  I stick to the late night, soul warming, boiling tofu and dumpling soup.    It is cheap and filling and comes with all the fun little side dishes; banchan.  The broth is  rapidly boiling, chile laden and filled with chunks of silky tofu and beef dumplings.  They crack an egg into the little cauldron and you stir it up and enjoy.  It is also served with a bowl of rice.  The portion is good for 1 1/2 meals. All for around $8.  Every time, I request it spicy, and every time, it is not.    They are open late so it is a good joint for late night comfort soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boiling hot tofu soup.

_E3I_F-1MClgb_RtxM04YQ.text: My girlfriend hates this place. She complained about the rude servers, HOT and un-airconditioned setting, but I actually enjoy it. It's low cost Korean BBQ. And the meats are good, but the rice and appetizers are bad.

05b17vFm5AW8FLfHhJO-9Q.text: I've been going here for over 10 years. Tofu Hut feels like home to me and my family! All you can eat is cheap and delicious. I reccomend getting the pork belly, brisket and dipping it in to the oil salt and pepper sauce they give you. At night it gets crowded but just write your name down and you should be seated in a few, it's seriously worth the wait though!

oDCdUo2qN3rTKosIQ0bOcQ.text: The service was fine for its standard of an all you can eat Korean BBQ place: if you're someone who wants the server to cook for you, then go to Magal but if you're the person who likes to grill for yourself, I'd definitely liked this place with its affordable price and efficient refills on meats and drinks. My group of friends went on a busy Friday night, so we had a bit of a wait list but that went fast and the servers quickly brought out the meats to grill. It was a fun dining experience with the service accommodating to its standard.

1oYUuFy-_pCyMzNiedCDrw.text: I'm not entirely happy with going to this place this time around. Service was awful and had to get the waitress' attention just to ask for something. The food was tasty at the time but now my stomach hurts. I wonder if they even got an A from the health department.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8kXdZUR72oh02pc2Jp0qKQ.text: How can you have a policy and not follow it?? Even though last call for the party was announced still go back and allow them to jump back to where they were?? But don't mention anything because you will get ignored when finally seated. On multiple occasions my water was not refilled and the rest of the table was. Asked for Lemmon which never came. An extra plate which I asked for 3 times never came and the list goes on. Find another Korean BBQ. This one was mediocre at best!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NbqI9MyUnxuFmsihNZ43zg.text: Tofu Hut surprisingly has the best salad compared to most salads that are served by KBBQ restaurants. There is a late night special, and if you go on a busy time, it can take a while to get seated to eat. I can recall waiting around 30-45 minutes to be seated.  I'm not sure if they switched up the meat or not, but the brisket looks a little different. Nonetheless, still a classic and really decent spot to come and get KBBQ.. just may not be the "go to" anymore for me.

LMaqcNQEtvh22yDXiFfGDw.text: Our first time here and it was really good!  Very good food and great service!  Will be back!  Btw we didn't do ayce but ordered from regular menu.

LXDZMRBUR2DKNDt3gdUmIA.text: The place is a bit small, when you go in make sure you sign in on the roster if you're dining for the ACYE.  The selection is simple and also small for the ACYE. I recommend the brisket and the short rib will be your bang for the buck. If you want to try something different there is the beef tongue, it cooks fast but you'll put in the work after since it's really chewy. The BBQ sausage is just a hotdog and a sausage with your typical BBQ sauce on it.   With only two servers and a packed house, they maintained to keep the plates coming along serving other tables. As your grill gets too char'ed up, ask for a grill change to keep the meat tasting delicious!   I'll definitely be back here since it's the most bang for your buck!

6JWQ7yGJ5qenRZLoGt88ww.text: You get what you pay for.   Late night specials had us trying it, but not too sure I would return. Quality isn't high on the scale, but with the price being so low, I wasn't expecting much.  But let's be serious for a second, CHEAP BBQ. When on a late night budget I shouldn't be complaining. Though the meat was full of fat. It smelled and sizzled the same and went through my mouth the same way, so I went for it. I'd definitely make my way over here before I went to a McDonald's. But wouldn't come just because.  10m specials. Busy on weekends.

-cpzmYr0p0RYCqFt-8kuRA.text: Great price for AYCE Korean bbq. Be prepared to wait as this place gets pretty busy in the evenings.

vYdh-FWrYMBljmzsjReLmg.text: Tofu Hut is a place to go for cheap korean. I was surprised that their meats were good and decently sized. Better than most korean bbq locations that don't really offer good cuts.

3qjUSeFyIhb-SECbWPOEow.text: Love coming here. There is always a wait but it goes pretty fast. They ignore you sometimes when you have gotten too many meat refills. The meat quality is superb and the banchans are amazing. Will keep going for sure.

_Hcy61nAGOT9H5NGWeUSYQ.text: Came here on a weekday during lunch time and it wasn't too busy. This is a AYCE Korean barbecue restaurant where you order and cook your own food.   We got the brisket, short ribs, and bulgogi. Their house salad was really good as well.   Service was quick, food was good, and the price wasn't bad.

d5OAJ6Vof5WuOWY9wYQCLA.text: Update: PRICE & MENU CHANGE!  As of March 1st, 2017, Tofu Hut no longer has the Late Night Special pricing for AYCE KBBQ. It's now a base price of $16.99 per person, which was the former All Day pricing. There's kids prices now too, based on age. They've also included a few more meat options to the menu! However, I would not get the BBQ Sausage... We got a good laugh about it, but it's literally just cheap hot dogs with a bbq sauce drizzle. Not sure what that's about, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Newest menu! As of March 1st, 2017.
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YVy2_hNfxfhveAJ8zyjOSg.text: Good service, open late, easy parking, and reasonable prices. I came in kind of late for tofu hot pot on a cold night. It did the job!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu seafood hot pot.

EMt7RiJUjwd0-lEemT0CtA.text: Loved it!!! Must try especially if your visiting. The prices were cheap and worth it. All you can eat for 16.99$. We ordered the brisket, short ribs, soysauce chicken and ribeye. Enjoyed all the little sides as well. Coming from Hawaii we were in desperate need of rice so we were definitely happy about that.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PSefPtmekhbLkPpppGqOhw.text: Ok for the price. Don't like their automatic 15% gratuity for party of 4+ (including kids).

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZdOuaeT42uWAVswD0IvwHw.text: The sliced ribey and salad are amazing. Always love eating here and always go home with a full belly. Staff is nice too.

qD1N27kvirOpum53nzwSRA.text: Cut-down pointers:  - Cheap: All-day special 16.99$ , and after 10 pm late night special 13.99$ (but doesn't include steamed egg or short ribs).  - Quality is A-okay , I'd say a 3.5/5. Ordering brisket is a must for me since I'm not a fan of their other meats (bulgogi can be inconsistent and pork belly is too fatty). I love their ban chan (the Korean pancakes are sooo good !). Of course , their house salad is a plus. It's amazing. My favorite salad of all time :D  - There is usually a wait during the evenings , especially when time gets closer to late night special. Seating is limited.  - The service can be a hit or miss , it usually starts off good with the orders + water refills then it dies down.  - They'll do split checks , no problem. No troubles there so far. The bill also adds tax and gratuity in it.  - Always a go-to to fill the Korean BBQ cravings in this area.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan

IC5cyIEDAkiopxUe2a1rzg.text: Definitely one of my new favorite All you Can eat place in town now. Great price and great short rib. Thanks for the experience. Will be back soon!

zrH9PQJoiBC8CjqfY30Ixg.text: Good place although a little small, great price, great food!  Parking is also limited & there is usually a wait.  But, we still like going here for Korean BBQ.  I recommend it!

SWm3pewyOVo23HrzJwuxjA.text: Came in on a rainy Sunday evening, long line was for the AYCE. Just wanted the regular tofu menu. You just have to tell the waitress to seat you on the other 1/2 of the restaurant.  The starter side dishes were just okay, like they were sitting around waiting for customers.  We had the #2-Mushroom tofu and #10-rare Beef tofu which were both pretty good. We would come back again.  The tables were a little sticky as well as the menus they brought to us to order our meals. We had to ask for table settings, water, hot tea and refills of our Ba chans. Maybe 3 1/2 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #2 spicy Mushroom Tofu
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef soup #10

dhPBCEKKeJunnQ2jMyZ_hQ.text: I've tried to defend this place since I like small modest establishments and even though the quality of meat they have is average at best. You really get what you pay for. But I went here for lunch by myself and they literally turned me down saying they don't serve all you can eat kbbq for one person.....

CYfcVSfOJneAAMTimO82vw.text: OH MY GOSH. This was a complete LIFE SAVER out here in Vegas!  My girlfriend and I basically woke up at around 7PM feeling.... not so hot and all we wanted was soup. Yelped the closest place and it was Tofu Hut, took an uber, put our name down for a  wait, ONLY to realize that the line/wait is only for the people who want to partake in the kbbq option. Woops, I'll remember that for next time.  After about 10 min and realizing that the other half of the restaurant which was just meant for non-kbbqers, we got seated immediately (as this side was pretty much empty).  Ordered mushroom soondubus for the both of us, which surprisingly were only $5-7 (in the bay, these dishes range from $12-16) and we were served with QUALITY ass soon dubu. I was blown away with how much product was served from the ban chan to the mushrooms to the tofu (i swear i've never received a soon dubu where the soon was literally falling off the brim of the pot). SOO much for such a little price, I was shook.   Needless to say, this meal cured us and we felt way better after getting this in our systems. Will come again whenever we're in the area, you can make that a promise.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom soft tofu soup

DmqKtszHr5tE-GWlSOVkYA.text: My experience yesterday was actually a lot more pleasant than I expected. I feel as though the service really improved since the last time I went there. Every time I flagged down a waiter or waitress, they quickly came and took my order. None of my orders were forgotten about and my requests were quickly fulfilled. They even offered my party a pitcher of water to leave at the side of the table so that we can refill our waters ourselves and not have to wait. I am adding a star for the improvement of service. I'm guessing it has to do with increased competition.  I still am bothered however by the way they seemingly cheat their customers by not telling them the parties over four people are charged automatic 15% gratuity. There still a line for gratuity when you pay for your meal. It's not until you ask them if gratuity is included that they will admit it. I don't know if it is a method to avoid paying tips to their servers since I believe it's usually based off of what is written on the gratuity line but I think it's sketchy nonetheless.

ZnHA4Qn3uLxembLPgXQscQ.text: This place is dirty. Dirt and grime every where! The staff are rude and inattentive. The meat was fatty and the condiments were mundane. After eating a few bites I went for my water... The cup was dirty with floaties. I wanted to throw up. I looked at my surroundings just to see how dirty the restaurant really was and saw small dead bugs.  the next morning I was in the bathroom with my whole life falling out of my ass. Never ever again!

rfZndSH73cBY0_Lv-y2_Dw.text: My first time here but didn't try their bbq. Apparently this is the cheapest Korean bbq place in town. However, I wasn't here for that. I was here to try the tofu soup. I ordered the beef tofu soup 3/5. Not too much depth in the flavor and spice, just average. Prolly won't try the bbq considering how cheap it is. Low cost might equal low quality. Plenty of other shops in town so I don't think I'll be coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tofu soup. 3/5

9vq83wbhF89j6eROckExpg.text: This used to be my go to for Korean food.   The last time I stopped by must have been at least a year or so. The service is not as good as it used to be. The AYCE line was long, as per usual. I walked to the front to wave someone down because I was there for the regular menu. Everyone ignored me, probably thinking I was just an impatient AYCE customer.   I ordered my usual, spicy shredded beef soup. I could hardly wait, anticipating the strong flavors and spices that made me grow to love this dish. Unfortunately my mouth tasted a watery, and strange tasting soup. Something was different....cabbage?! Tons and tons of cabbage. No no no. I was really disappointed to say the least, just ask my boyfriend lol. He ended up getting bulgogi which was very dry and overcooked. Where did the sauce go?   I don't know what changed. The management? The cooks? Either way, I didn't enjoy it.

5sm7zlbCI5sMKEhTJH2KHQ.text: How have I NOT written a review about this place yet?  I'm here at least once a week. When you pair up good food with even better prices - how am I not here even more?!  The AYCE KBBQ prices for both lunch and dinner beat the rest. I mean $13.99 between 10:00pm to closing and then $16.99 any other time. You can't compete with that.   You. Just. Can't.  Their appetizers will prepare your mouth for the glorious meat you'll eat. My favorite is the Korean pancake and tofu. Their house salad is also amazing. I have contemplated endless times to see if I could do a pick-up order on just their salad alone.  As for their meats, my favorite would be the good o'fashion pork belly. The brisket follows and then maybe the marinated pork belly. If you're extremely hungry, go ahead and order their steamed egg. It's a perfect combo with the rice.  The only reason why this place is 1 star away from a perfect 5 is their size. I really wish it was bigger! Half of the restaurant is divided so it can be a long gruesome wait if you come at the wrong time.

lzXu1OZk9k8qvA1lCJHNsg.text: I love it been there twice if you expect to be seated right away don't expect it. Love the food we always try to get one of everything. We had a point where someone came to lower or stoves kind of understood because something fell in but Iunderstood would go again.

-tsPbyarNyrDeGxP3xIffg.text: Food is great, but not worth the damn ridiculous VIP treatment the employees give it! We always had to wait at least 45 minutes to get into this place (and no reservations allowed, of course) but this time it was too much.   I came with a group of friends extremely hungry, yet able to wait for about 45 minutes without dying. And yet they had us waiting around OUTSIDE for an HOUR AND 45 MINUTES. And heres the kicker - when we checked up on them to ask what the hell was going on (line hadnt moved an inch since we got there), they rudely snapped at us "Uh-- no table for you. We close now." And told everyone that waited in line that entire time to haul their asses back home with an empty stomach! Unbelievable.   This doesnt even cover the fact that they have an ENTIRE section in the back that they sequester away from all of the "all-you-can-eat" diners(which subsequently makes their restaurant have a much lower capacity) either because they have no restaurant management skills or because they are lazy. I assume its a combination of the two.   Please update the way you manage your table service. Otherwise, you have lost at least two loyal customers.

ic9Y1S5mPHws1mj9RbMLxg.text: MMMM, I forgot how good and cheap it was here. Needed a kbbq fix and this def fulfilled that need at 2am.  The fact that I only had 20 bucks in my pocket helped choose the kbbq place, as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eusVQa2d0aNPadZk3JAEcA.text: Used to come here for years. Came here last night to learn that the pricing and menu has changed. They no longer have the AYCE special that is offered after 10:30pm and that it is a single rate of $17.99 per adult. For the menu, the only real addition is the BBQ Sauce Sausage. It is just a plain hotdog with bbq drizzled on it lol. Very odd and definitely does not justify that price increase. Wait times still seem to be very long. Why is it that only half of the restaurant is for KBBQ? Does anybody actually eat at the other side? I would imagine profits would be much more substantial if the entire place was converted to KBBQ and which would definitely cut down on the wait times. To finish up, for that new price there are much better options such as Hwaro, BiWon, or Doh. I would only return to Tofu Hut now as a last resort.

4GL_etBgaQpjEBGK8UtOWg.text: Food is good but the service is so bad especially the old lady that has a short hair.She served food without make an eyes contact.This is will be our last time here.Highly  not recommended.If you guys decide to come here make sure order whole things on the first time because they  wouldn't come to your table again.Good luck.

C0WIW__3lZ582A92CI7oag.text: Late night special:  ayce Korean BBQ $ Includes traditional Korean side dishes plus they give you this salad that is just drizzles with this light sesame vinaigrette.  The special thing is that they have steamed egg on the ayce menu too!! (love steamed egg).   If you haven't it's basically a fluffy egg that was steamed in a small clay pot =]   If you don't want to do ayce they do have a reasonable priced side menu.  The kalbi plate and bipbimbap is always my favorite.

lnmHhgGZZVfF7gsnMSzDPA.text: Love this place. Have come a few times and food is always good.  Gets 4 stars because sometimes service is a little slow.   My favorite here is the short ribs. Marinated pork is also good,  but a little spicy.

hsaQT_lI3lcpa9uHjIzRKA.text: Took my sister out for lunch and we Loved their bbq! Very yummy. Just wish that it wasn't such a long wait for the bbq table.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My sister and I were ready to grub!

DEzXMxZJvHG8F816cqi64w.text: Don't know what happened to this place. It has been a while. Food is still good but service was HORRIBLE today. Rude rude rude. And since when do they automatically charge 15 percent tip on a party of 4 ? It's like they didn't really want us there. So many other options for K Barbs. Won't be giving this business another nickel.

_e_dYtXlNQGJnJuBbOQWgQ.text: This is our favorite place to go to on a cold day! We do not do the traditional all you can eat BBQ as most people do when they go there. We always get the tofu soup and it is always so good and filling. Our favorite is the seafood beef. We love that it comes with a variety of yummy sides and the service is always on point.

-HBa4qm1wboVF276tOs55w.text: Decent price for pretty good food. If I go again, I'd stick with the marinated pork belly, short rib and rib eye. The brisket and tongue were sliced so thin it reminded me of Steak-Um. Not much for flavor in those 2 cuts.  Come with the usual assortment of sides, rice and a salad this is good but went mostly untouched as we chowed on the meat instead.  Service was fine, they don't really come up to you much asking if you need something, you'll need to flag them down, but there were enough on staff that it wasn't a problem.

e67CwRpWatv_X1SMwDoh4A.text: Really enjoyed the service today! I ordered pretty much one of everything plus extra orders of japchae and ateaned egg. I love steamed egg with my rice and BBQ for some reason. One thing I appreciate from servers is when they refill my water constantly when it's low. They did a really great job with that and checking up on me. Honestly, I ordered wayyy to much food than I could handle & asked how much it was per entree if I didn't finish my food. It's about $7 & the sever was kind of enough to tell me not to worry about it. Service was awesome and food was awesome! Thanks tofu hut for the great kbbq experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat BBQ during lunch only $16.99 and unlimited sides

WOSMijMMbm4DgJJNjpfXBw.text: I absolutely love tofu hut again lol I wanted to write a review bc it doesn't deserve an overall of 3 1/2. AYCE kbbq here is such a good deal. they have a good amount and variety of meat here and their salad is bomb af!!! good appetizers good food and they do have good customer service too. plus they're open late and even cheaper past 10pm!!!! my boyfriend and I ALWAYS go here. it's our favorite AYCE kbbq again :)

bZmmyP4CYuY0SAv1mK6c7g.text: Definitely worth your money! For the all you can eat, they serve a lot of meat for one portion. If you love Korean bbq, this place is a must!

fv-iv4VcQ4D5_K7VbwojrQ.text: I obviously made a very very poor decision here because I did not choose to go with the all you can eat menu.  We got here around 11pm on Thursday night and there was a 45-60 minute wait, since there are only a few tables available for bbq.  We saw some other people eating off the menu, so we decided to do that instead.  We opted for one of the stews and it was terrible.  Everything in it tasted like it was just quickly thrown together- from the soup base to the dumplings. The soup base tasted like one of those premade tofu soup packages that you get from Asian grocery stores mixed with some frozen dumplings that you also get from the grocery stores.  DId not like it AT ALL.  The service wasn't bad... they were pretty attentive.  If I'm ever back here, I'll try the bbq instead.

dBnlKT1f6yi2kjXAw3HIVg.text: You can order off the menu or choose an all-you-can-eat BBQ option.  If you choose the AYCE, you'll need two people ordering before they'll let you fire up the grill.  I love the Soon Du Bu when I don't want BBQ.  Ban Chan sides are fresh and unlimited, so be sure to order more!

ZTVM_PGwDaZHQXrisINsBQ.text: First time doing korean bbq so I'm not expecting too much. This place is pretty cheap for how much food you get, and the little side dishes are cool. The reason why I'm giving two stars is because when my bf and I were eating, this lady was cleaning a table across from us. I kid you not, she took a napkin from that dirty table, dipped it into someone's water cup that was already on the table as well, and wiped the frame of the grill with it. I know it's just the frame, but that's still so unsanitary! I didn't even see her clean the grill itself, our grill was kinda oily and had burnt bits around the edges. I wouldn't come back again just because there are so many other Korean bbq places in vegas.

7pdB0kdfzTnTgTeTiSVh1w.text: Melt in your mouth, thinly sliced brisket, short rib & rib eye cooked by you the way you like.  Their never ending Asian salad is perfect to go with all that meat.  Also, the little side dishes of pickled veggies are a tasty compliment.  Yummy Korean BBQ!  It gets busy with rather large parties of patrons so go early & expect a wait...but well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kim Chee &amp; the dipping oil/salt for meats
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
