k7TVwZVmUAcLpopeDYE9SA.text: We went there for AYCE.  They were very busy but we only waited not even 5min.  When we seated, there were already set everything grill was heated, rice, kimchee  :)   It got packed but very fast, excellent service  :D

Nxpw0I8EQgKi5GBDSMb4Kg.text: Because my mom is an amazing cook and restauranteur, her food has become the very high benchmark to which I compare all Korean restaurants. That being said, there are no restaurants in this valley that surpass or even meet that level. However, when I do want Korean food and my mom isn't here, Tofu Hut is very comforting.  What brings me here is their Soon Dubu Jjigae (soft tofu soup). The type of tofu that is used in this particular soup is difficult to purchase non-commercially, so soups made at home will not be able to mimic this silky offering. The flavors are so delicious and indescribable. You can also choose the type of soup you want like Kimchee or Seafood, changing the overall flavor of the dish. I always go with Pork because I think its flavor really transforms the broth to something amazing. The spice level can also be chosen (don't let the red color scare you, it's a non-spicy spice they use). The best part? It's around $10 for the meal! It comes with a bowl of rice and unlimited Pan Chan (side dishes).  When I dine with certain people, I will also do the AYCE BBQ. It's not my favorite thing, but for $17, it's pretty awesome! My favorite cuts of meat to order are Beef Tongue, Brisket, and Marinated (Spicy) Pork. They give you the traditional sesame oil/salt mixture to dip your unseasoned meat in and a refreshing salad of cabbage and romaine lettuce. It's a modern twist on the traditional Korean dining method of wrapping the meat and rice in lettuce leaves called Sang Chu Ssam. I thought it was weird at first, but I've really grown to like it! Bonus: Soon Dubu Jjigae is only $5 with your AYCE meal! Score!!  Expect a wait during busy times for AYCE since it's only available on one side of the restaurant. Fortunately, the longest I've waited was about 15-20 minutes.

n9WjEKJJxNWMntVCFI9NjA.text: Good alternative to Hwaro. Food quality was 9/10. No radish wraps, but each person can get a steamed egg (unlike other places!)   I ordered the beef tongue twice, but it never came around. :( I think the waiter forgot? Were too busy? Either way, I'll try again next time LOL. Service is kind of hit or miss here, but it's a pretty good place to eat (in terms of meat quality).

j3kUJQC1PDyRxck4-4ySMQ.text: Awesome food. Everything was great. Would have been a five if they had a better beer selection. No draft beers and the bottle choices were not so good. Cass Korean was about perfumey.

CAtplZkY-6VY2tgE__6oZQ.text: In my opinion, the food here isn't that good, sometimes even bland. But to me, this isn't that place where you come here expecting great food and service. You come here when you just finished partying and it's 12:47 at night, you come here when your friend is feeling bummed out and you want to treat him, or just to catch up with a group of friends you haven't seen in awhile. It's that type of place.   They just recently remodeled to some more modern furniture so that's pretty nice to see. The place is located on spring mountain right off the i-15 it can be really easy to miss so just keep your eye out.   If you come here on during the day you should have no problem finding a table. But coming in at night is a different story. Expect a min. of a 40 minute wait. And no you can't make reservations haha.  The service here can be very different at times. But lately they have been on top of it. Sometimes you have to raise your hand to be get some attention. Don't expect top notch service.  Waiting for food isn't a problem, when you order they usually get it out within a few minutes. Top priorities should be bulgogi, pork belly, and brisket. They don't have it on their menu but you can ask for rice! For the taste, nothing is really note worthy all just average tasting food.  PRO TIP! Call in to see how long their wait is, if it's too long for you just go to another place to eat. Instead of being surprise when you get there and saying what a waste of gas it was too come.  If I could change something about this place I wish they would just expand their place already! The waits are too dam long.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly x brisket x beef tongue
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smiles x kbbq x happy stomach

lJAH66FaDKWhFqVzqCi92Q.text: Ate here b4 food was good. They are open till 2a.m. I showed up at 1:40a.m. And they said they were closed and wouldn't serve us. I pointed to the sign that said open till 2a.m. And she just walked away and left us standing there!

fJF9dYN_og9TD9dBNsUoJQ.text: I've been here a few times now and each time I just wonder why I still go here when there are better places right down spring mountain with bigger selection.  But tonight in particular made me finally write a review.   I don't know what happened with our bill but for a party of 4, it should not have been 86 bucks when all you can eat is 13.99 from 10pm-2am and 16.99 for their regular price.

o3GtBC5psgRybKlBKD16CQ.text: There's been a proliferation of korean bbq joints in town but we keep going back to the old school places like Tofu Hut. Been going here for 5+ years. At times the service is a bit wanting but overall they have a decent KBBQ at a good price. It's no frills and no try-to-be- cool Top 40 crummy music blasting incessantly. The salad is tasty. Some of the other places have better cuts of meat but you will pay for it.

0NcvJvySwrrHBOJLQ7jX_w.text: From out of town, wanted Bulgoki. Googled it and this place had good ratings. I was not disappointed,  at all. Bulgoki was delicious! Fish cake was excellent! All sides were great too. Staff was friendly,  it was easy to place a to go order. Restaurant was clean. Most Excellent Experience..

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgoki and sides...Excellent. I will be back when in Vegas.

Nw1Im5ub-nSN8yo1cpF4YQ.text: You couldn't pay me to eat here...the meat (brisket) was dark brown when it came out and it wasn't even cooked yet; the bulgolgi once cooked was very difficult to chew! The air ventilation is also somewhat poor and the fact that it's next to a tire repair shop kind of grossed me out. I don't mean to be rude but there are so many better Korean bbq places in Las Vegas, the ONLY good thing about this place is the price and that's why I added an extra star!

SS56-DdefR-kmq5rkwrXSQ.text: This is my go to place for kbbq. I mean it's probably the cheapest in town. Also, after 10pm it's only $15. That's $3 cheaper than it normally is.   I usually get brisket, pork belly, and beef tongue. They're all so good and they go well with the free side dishes that you get with your meal! This place is usually always packed with a long wait after 10 PM so watch out!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, pork belly, and Galba along with some of the free sides

RMKCA4ExdfpebwiIIkwL5A.text: I've been here many times the past two years and I can't believe I haven't written a review yet! I think I would always attempt to write one but kanack attack (food coma) hits me & then I KO, sadly forgetting to submit a review. Therefore, here I go.. finally!  Pros: AYCE, $16.99/person (CHEAP!), good customer service, FOOD.  Cons: "Hut" in Tofu Hut is the absolute TRUTH; very small restaurant. Wait times could be very, very icky.   The meats are absolutely delicious. My favorites would have to Marinated Ribeye, Short Ribs (Kalbi) & Marinated Spicy Pork Belly. Banchans (sides) were yummy too and that Steamed Egg doe, mmmmm. Love the fish cake, bean sprouts & jap chae noodles. I always skip the big bowl of salad though; I am not a fan of that. I guess it's the carnivore in me.  I've gone there different times in the day and the most quiet time surprisingly was lunch time on a Sunday. Came around 1130 AM & it wasn't packed at all. I guess wait times are a hit or miss but it's worth the wait and they're open till after midnight so pick your time accordingly. Also, the servers are just great. After dining at Woonam Jung Lee's Korean BBQ & receiving the absolute WORST customer service (Hence, my review on them, grr), Tofu Hut surpasses them by a mile or two or maybe even more!   In all honesty though, after dining here 324987598 times, I have never gotten any bad service, eaten anything unappetizing & waited too long to dine. So yes Yelp, you are definitely correct: "Yay! I'm a fan." :)

l2GnFVSmnzHYLJY8ATD9sw.text: If you're looking for a great place to chill and eat late at night for your ratchet life, this is the place to go. They offer all you can eat Korea BBQ and the prices drop after 10pm.   Many young people hang out here, it's that hip.

Cy4rOK6ECm0aeTNoHkpIew.text: I believe I have found my new Korean BBQ place in Tofu Hut. The simplicity of this place makes this an enjoyable place for me and whoever I come to this place with.  The dinner price is about $17 bucks and includes all the items on the all you can eat menu and about $14 after 10 P.M. The extra items you get for the extra three dollars are the short ribs and the steamed eggs. The short ribs I would say is well worth it because that is my favorite meat on the menu personally. The egg is good as well, but it's not as special as the short ribs. I do really enjoy the bulgogi (marinated sliced ribeye), the brisket, and the short rib the most, but the pork belly and chicken thigh are good as well. The meats have been fresh every time I have visited and so I haven't had any problems there. The rest of the food are served with various side dishes and you can ask for that, as well as salad and rice when you run out of those things.   The service is adequate, but sometimes it feels like they see your hand, but they just ignore you just cause. They do bring you your meat and whatever else you ask for in due time. The food is good, and the only way the food sucks is if you suck at cooking, so don't suck at cooking. I recommend this place for anyone that wants to get a Korean BBQ fix in the area, especially late night.

18GOi180ZbXDwI8nRjpQVA.text: After EDC Las Vegas... what do you want to eat? can you even eat? are you hungry at all? Hell yea... after two days of practically no sleep on alcohol and red bull all I wanted to do was eat.   My cousin Judy had brought my family here as this is Vegas's "best AYCE Korean BBQ place". We had waited about 15 minutes for a table of 8 to open up, I do recommend you get there early because it gets packed quick and its a pretty small place.   The regular korean side dishes and also came with salad. AYCE was $16.99 for everything, they had pork belly, beef tongue, marinated short ribs, brisket and more. Very good price considering it is an AYCE. It also comes with a salad and a bowl of rice, you can get as much as you want.   The food was marinated perfectly and I loved the brisket with the dipping sauce.   Why only four stars? Their service sucks. The servers forget easily and are always trying to get you in and out.

VUA6jeCQHW0g8ctTdRTe7A.text: One of the best kbbq places bc of its cheap pricing (only after 10pm). I personally love the brisket, beef tongue, pork belly, squid and salad. The salad compared to other kbbq places has this amazing dressing! I'm assuming that it's a sesame oil based dressing and its delish! The brisket is more on the fatty side but fat always equals more flavor. Everything else is pretty much the same as other kbbq places.  Customer service is ok. Depending on who's the servers. I've been coming here for about a year now, I would say at least once a month. They've been improving on their customer service. Especially the guy server! He's really nice. I wish that they would check up on you a lot more and refill your water without asking.  Overall, the food and pricing makes up for their customer service. Also, be prepared to wait if you're coming from the late night special. It's totally with it though! So far tofu hut is my #1 go to for kbbq.

KTRSqVaVZdZM31y4lPxWQw.text: This was my first time trying this place. I must say we really enjoyed the marinated ribeye, very tasty and the seasoning was great. We also had the brisket was not too bad but not much flavor so had to throw hot sauce on it. The pork belly was ok, if you love all of that juicy fat then that would be your go to. The steamed egg was also very good with the rice I actually enjoyed that a lot. The service was alright not always there when you need them but maybe because they started to get a little busy. Anyways, it was a good Asian bbq spot and if you around the china town area it would be a good place to have all you can eat for only $16.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marinated Ribeye and Spicy Marinated Chicken

qEdtLdxudOOV5Bf4CTVLgw.text: This place was great, we came with 5 plus a baby on Saturday for lunch and  I would highly recommend it.  The AYCE Korean BBQ was outstanding with several meats and accompaniments available at a really cheap price.  I wouldn't say the meat was top of the line, but it wasn't poor quality either, for the price it was excellent.  The servers were prompt and friendly.  Be advised, they throw 15% tip on parties of 4 or more.  Add tip as appropriate, they work hard.

EZuZxnEADPnohn7LjZaglg.text: I used to be addicted to this place. The food is perfect for anyone who is dieting because it's 95% protein. But the meat quality has been on the decline for the past two years. They never expanded and the wait can get crazy, and that's why i decided to go elsewhere.  The service is nice and courteous. Never seen people work so hard. I hope they improve the quality of their meats, introduce new cuts and expand the menu and work the ventilation.

3M89qYfWSnL1PFjtDY4DBA.text: First time coming here for lunch on Saturday. $16.99 for all you can eat Korean BBQ. The meat selection is among the common meats for BBQ.  Meat: We ordered: Beef Tongue, Pork Belly, Short Ribs, Soy Sauce Chicken, Sliced Rib Eye. The meat was fresh and marinated very well. No complaints.  Service: The service was wonderful. Servers came around frequently to remove empty plates, made sure drinks were refilled, and always asked to see if we wanted to order more food.  Cons: Probably due to the summer heat, it was very warm inside. Air condition wasn't high enough. In addition to the grilling, it was hotter than usual. The vent for the BBQ smoke wasn't strong enough, lots of smoke remained at our table instead of being pulled upward to the vent fans.  All in all, it's not bad. I gave a 4 star and will probably come back, just not on a 115-degree day.

JeD36cQcZUcw3JSGpepE2w.text: Reasonable price, awesome food,, you need to try the kimchi soup with tofu,,even though you have to wait couple more minutes than other times,,the wait is worth it ,,try it

V7_ODQDmGrNc61zKK4ed1w.text: Located in Chinatown/Koreatown   The restaurant is divided into two sections: one side where you can order traditional korean dishes or the AYCE korean bbq on the other half.   The ayce price is about $17 per person and you have a 90min limit. The options include: brisket, marinated ribs, beef tongue, intestines, pork belly, sausages, chicken, squid etc. You also get steamed egg and bean paste soup. The quality is not the best but it's not bad either. For the price I believe it's a great spot for you to come if you're craving korean bbq but don't want to spend too much   Decent food overall 7.5/10 but terrible service at times..

4mVjvqiZrxKSdvucyPMw_g.text: Wow! What a great value! The all you can eat BBQ is the way to go here. They have a variety of meats to include chicken, pork belly, squid, short ribs, beef tongue, ect and all are delicious! The staff here is very attentive and quickly replenished our banchan, especially the superb kimchi that I could not stop eating. If you are in Vegas make your way out to this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tongue and kimchi

7fn89HWeHdHNmwTTZkhIvg.text: I was not a fan of their food and it's over priced, they also add their own tip based on the number in your party it seemed. I had a party of 6 and I ended up paying like 8$ for the tip that they add on. Over all most likely won't be going back.

cWOrqQwPVkSE29pPRFtd_A.text: service is amazing and food is like no other korean bbq. the quality is outstanding. one of our fav ayce restaurant!!

aD5pyQlMNToRpXBM6GW1Lg.text: It wasn't delicious!  I never test like this tofu soup and other side dishes is not good .  I will not come again!

QiC-vO27INJ1WamqXCUTmA.text: Tofu hut is our place to go for all you can eat Korean bbq !! Servers are nice and overall a good decent place.

iLj9yNLC6uqI8U9rJZi6dw.text: Great place to eat Korean BBQ the restaurant is kind of small but the for the price of $16.95 all-you-can-eat it is well worth it. Get there early because sometimes they have a a long waiting list

NSTdxd1wAvbBW_A-u_Fm_A.text: If I can give negative star, I would. Korean BBQ is ok but other Korean dishes - run away! Tofu soup taste like ramen soup, stone bibimbop was awful! Vegetables were fully cooked and very rough. Udon was under cooked and you pay $9.00 udon here where it can be bought for $0.59 in the market. Taste is worse! I am so surprised how this place got so much high reviews. Don't waste your money here and get sick! What's worse is the my little boy got sick and threw up all night long. Be aware! With so much MAG, you will be drinking so much water and will have tummy ache.

9fcP1e2mS2XSULgM_Tko8g.text: I've never been here and I was really excited to try it, I got off work early and was really looking forward to checking this place out. I walked in and was dining solo,l was sat immediately instead of waiting.. well turns out AYCE Isn't for solo diners.. the staff was friendly and understanding that I decided not to stay, the price for AYCE is cheap but a la carte, not so much. They should let solo diners be able to do AYCE. I'll make a new review when I can bring a friend

g16M6mcwx4mP4gqd6_nnBw.text: I like this place. Sometimes you must wait to be seated. I feel that certain people may be taking cuts. Really good price

e966-bi70sgQIJEOuh9uCg.text: This Tofu Hut serves Korean food. It is located next to the Meet Fresh and across from the Lee's Sandwiches. Getting seated was confusing since there were both barbecue grills and ordinary tables. As someone else arranged eating here, we had no idea what to do, so we just took an ordinary seat.  They serve tofu soup so I got one, although the combo came with a set flavor of tofu soup (I wanted something else, but the party member that paid made me order it). It came out at a medium pace.  As far as the food's taste was concerned, it tasted more or less like any other Korean tofu place, so it's good enough.  The restrooms were fine.

cQvJ8n-IW4wcoJ4nx5EtGw.text: The good ol' classic Tofu Hut. One of the most known places to get KBBQ... however, there are now more spots with better quality. But, it's hard to beat Tofu Hut's price of $17-$18 AYCE.  One thing that is unmatched is their salad. Tofu Hut probably has one of the best salads out of all AYCE KBBQ places in Vegas. They seem to have changed their brisket... It kind of fell off. Maybe I just went on a bad day or something.  I'm not sure if I've observed wrong, but quality of food tastes better in the day time. It could be because they get super busy at night.  Service was good, as waters were refilled promptly. You can ask for a grill change, and they won't do it unless you ask most of the time. Newer KBBQ places will offer to do it, which is nice.

qA2H29M84Mi53LvouIcqCw.text: Great service, got seated right away. Food was great, very reasonable price ($9.58 for tofu soup) and overall, great service. My tofu soup wasn't spicy enough so I ask for spicy sauce and the waitress brought me the Korean spicy paste and it worked out perfect! Will definitely recommend this over their competitors across the street!

hCj23bdL9z-ih8lrrMBnVQ.text: UPDATE REVIEW***      I've been here probably about 50 times now.. I adore this place and it's the ONLY KBBQ in Las Vegas that I continue going to. The staff are EXTREMELY nice and so caring. It has amazing side dishes that no other kbbq in Vegas offers. It has super rich and amazing flavors in all the meat dishes. Their is $16.99 per person for AYCE. They are no longer doing the late night special but I mean... it's still SUPER cheap. I honestly still don't know how they make profit for selling the meat for such an incredible low price. Please go here if you've never been because you won't regret it. I've been to so many other Kbbq in LV but none compared to this place. All I wish is that they offer cheese and corn but that's about it lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, Marinated Pork Belly, &amp; Short ribs :)

mMNpVoPcc670Rx_a6XmUAA.text: I'm very impressed how the Tofu Hut management handled my situation. To make the long story short they charge my card twice which I do understand because some credit cards keep the payment pending for a week or so, however they charge my card twice and I just want to be very grateful for Lynn and Eddy. I know 36 dollars is not a lot of money but they made me feel important and they assure that they will fix the issue. I will make sure that all my friends and family go to Tofuhut!

Dz7gKIoUB2ejn6NgxOjKHA.text: Good food easy parking good service kbbq and set dinner/lunch on one side.  Tofu already dinner on the other side all-you-can-eat BBQ good price lots of people doing dinner or busy lunch time.

mggxkPfEHa7DpKJDNr3qNQ.text: The food used to be pretty descent here.  However, quality declined, and prices got higher.  Service is always friendly when I go there.  There isn't much banchan (side dishes), and I probably wouldn't get anything other than SoonTofu soups.  Still, for a place that's supposed to specialize in  Tofu Soup, it isn't as great as it should be.  There are plenty of better places to go.

r5T3sMof1N8FcfeayNcq9Q.text: Great stuff at Tofu Hut! I really love their Bim bim bap. The kimchi jig-gae is really good as well, especially with the cracked egg. Yum! The service is quick. This a great place to go for a reasonably price, simple, quick Korean meal. I recommend this to any Korean food lover in Vegas.

swo8ObmKj_PaooMGFknxXA.text: I've been coming to Tofu Hut for years, and it's gotten better over the years, specifically the service. I don't think it's simply the fact that since I go there usually 2-3 times a month that I'm recognized as a regular customer, but I observe other tables getting good service as well.  Food is pretty good, whether you decide to do the All You Can Eat or from their regular menu. The AYCE is soo good and a great value - my favorite meat is the brisket. I also love the salad greens and soups (bean paste & an egg) that come along with the meal. The banchan are some of the best I've tasted in any Korean restaurant.   Overall, good service, decent value, above-average option for lunch, dinner, or late night feasting. I'm a loyal customer and will continue to come here, as long as nothing changes.  Tip: When you're done with your meal and are waiting for the check, but can't seem to flag down a server, you can just go up to the front counter and pay your bill there.

boCaA8PK0d0nPl-aAnrqjQ.text: service was decent and the food came out quick. my sister and i shared an order of spicy chicken and korean bbq short ribs - both were really good!  the spicy chicken wasn't that spicy but the sauce was tasty.  kinda pricey but it was a lot of food and good of course.

n3Vgd9umKyYCE6NwHRf__w.text: Wow, such bad reviews for this place?  I ate here a few times with my gf and everything seemed fine.  Their tap water was actually palatable considering it's Vegas.  They must filter it or something.  I guess I won't be back if those health violations posted by BK are True.

-SkdHzfDk0tHlM6GrJKhaw.text: $12 for All You Can Eat Korean BBQ from 11pm-5am. What more can i say, what more can you ask for?! Great service even at 4am in the morning when I went, the sides were fresh and the meats were tasty. -1 star for no Galbee, but at this price, who can complain?!

m29OrCuanMac5yfgf1mIyA.text: I think I went there at the wrong time.  They didn't take our order until 15 minutes later when we asked for it, the lady who served us seemed so nervous and careless.  She didn't know where to sit us, she dropped a cup of water and put the rolling trash can right in front on my face.  She might be a hostess and forced to wait because they seemed very busy even though there were not that many people in the restaurant.  Side orders were good but the bulgogi and galbi were not that great.  Price is good though, cheap.

JtlIfxRtoV-mBodG2k8nOQ.text: This beats Sura Korean buffet- price wise and taste wise! Even the side dishes are delicious! The look of the place totally needs to be redone.

YTBPUo1TV7r94dB-Cm35Pw.text: I have only 2 words... Absolutely Delicious!! I have had really good Korean BBQ, but this by far was the best I have ever had!! Great quality meat, very flavorful and the service was great!! Definitely worth every penny!!!

zi4T5Ni3qJ7HHFZLzc47-g.text: surly attitude, inept service of decent food, but all is spoiled by the incompetence of staff. our second order of hot saki came out as something totally different from initial serving, turned out to be sweet saki which would gag a maggot. no checking back during meal, which would have been nice, since rice was forgotten! final straw was when bill was obviously wrong, as individual items did not add to total. excuse was that a service charge had been added - without notice of any kind, of course. an ultimate rip-off joint! avoid like the plague as there are so many other venues in the area which appreciate their customers and are gracious.

PPJ6NZAbs7bXkje00-e9qA.text: love this place. it depends on the waittresses tho. we always get all you can eat korean bbq. sometimes we oder bibibap which is rice dish. it is good too.

ScrRI1LktScjZS8LdhTY6A.text: I love their soups espcially the beef, and for $8.00 with a lot of sides that comes with it you can't beat it....I go at least 1 a month.

Awmja4ggLbHZOpy5BpGBEA.text: This place bites...we got seated...and then it took 10 mins before we even got offered a menu and then 20 mins later we didn't even get checked up on...it's just I felt so ignored when we were over there and they weren't even busy...what made me real angry was the fact that the people who were seated after us 20 mins later got served before we did. My friends and I didn't wanna take it anymore and we walked out and yet no one said anything (that place gave THE worst customer service EVER) I will never ever think of going there.

gtRNMxNfRDw1zlP27ZflXA.text: One of the best Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas. The place is always busy so I recommend that you a lot a good amount of time if you decide to eat here. The price is reasonable for what you get. I always say that is a meat lover's paradise. My most favorite is the Marinated beef, it is so good. I also love the steamed egg. The servers can be good or bad depends on who you got that time. They try to be fast to serve what you ordered from them but at times they can be slow. But overall I would recommend to try this place.

6rYrZixsdghCpghr7mTi8A.text: Why is this place still open? It is disgusting, unsanitary, and just plain G-R-O-S-S! Not only did they close down a few weeks ago because the Health Department gave them 52 DEMERITS.. 52!?!?! WOW. I'm baffled that this place is STILL open after that short restaurant closure to "clean up" after their mess.  Okay.. surprisingly this place USED to be good back in the day when there was a different owner around 2009? After that.. this place should just call it quits.  The last time I went here was back in 2012. I was excited because I have not been to Tofu Hut since then. When I walked in with my friend, we didn't have anyone to greet us. We stood there for a few minutes before someone came out. Whoever the lady was, was just so rude! She came out and pointed at us and said to sit anywhere. We sat at a table near the front area so they can see where we sat. After another 5 minutes, no one came by to greet us and give us a menu. I had to walk up to ask for the menu. The lady again just pointed to the corner of the table where the menus were for me to grab myself. HORRIBLE SERVICE ALREADY! At this point, I was getting really upset. When someone came by to take our orders, I did not want to get the "AYCE" k-bbq. I was in a time crunch and all I wanted was to eat bulgogi (shredded beef) and the house salad. I guess it was my mistake.. I should have cooked my own meat. When the meat came out.. it looked pale already. I didn't think of it then because I thought the food would taste as good as it did when I ate there last. I ate the beef.. and it tasted a little funky. I wasn't sure if it was supposed to taste like that. The beef tasted like it was soaked in beer.. literally.. it tasted like old beer and that it was soaked in it for hours. I thought thats how it was supposed to taste like.. I gave some to my friend to taste and she spit it right out! She said it was old and spoiled meat. Wow... was I too late or what?! I tried hiding the taste with the bland and OLD house salad. After I realized that it wasn't supposed to taste like that, I decided to just leave and get my check. I was so unhappy and STILL hungry that I just wanted to leave and not waste my time at all.  Later on that day... I started throwing up and my ass sat on my toilet for hours... I had FOOD POISONING from Tofu Hut!!!!! I was so upset and felt so disgusted. Ugh! I have NEVER been back since and when I ask a few of my friends, they all have experienced bad quality of food and bad service.  I know.. you may think that it has been 2 years since.. and that I should give it another try. Well.. after they re-opened a few weeks ago since their 52 demerits.... one of my really close friends went to eat there with her boyfriend and she found a BUG in her dish! Not just a small bug... but a big bug and she didn't even know what it was! EEEEEEWWWW! After she told me that.. I then knew that I will NEVER go back to this place.  If you want bad food service, then go here. If you want nasty, bad quality food, then go here. If you want bugs in your food, go here. If you want to get sick, then this is the place to be. This place doesn't even DESERVE a star. NO STARS FOR TOFU HUT!

QhejwKav5eegqlf0EIfEqw.text: I actually like it here despite the sometimes unfriendly staff, long waits and questionable cleanliness lol. I mean c'mon, you get what you pay for and so far this is the cheapest ayce Korean bbq I've been to that's open late. I think they have a lot of potential to be a really good restaurant but it doesn't seem to stop people from coming!  I love the salad here! Wish I knew the recipe so I could just make it myself. I also love the beef tongue and brisket. The ban chan is good too.   It's a cheap choice for kbbq and an even better choice after a drunken night at the club-so win win.

uOwPh21jVi5_FCf8e-LGiA.text: I honestly love love Korean Barbecue. It is my absolute favorite thing to do! Tofu hut is a great place to get KBBQ. I love this place. The meat is great, the marination is a little sweet but Americans would love them. The meat that they give you is frozen. Like they had a frozen block of meat and cut them right before they give it to you so the meat is frozen when they bring it to you.  The salad is great, a little salty but still good. A long with the kimchi, salty but good. Their other sides are pretty good as well. I love love the pickled cucumber. And I don't know if it's an Asian thing or it's just them but they're very "not attentive" if that makes sense. Like they could careless about their customers. Every time we asked for something, they always give us this "ugh, again?" face. I'm Asian myself and I've worked with a lot of customers but I would never do that. They're stingy and doesn't want to give you the food. I had to order brisket and beef tongue like 3 times before I got them. If they were busy I would understand but no one was there. They just seemed very careless.  Food quality wise, it's very good and delicious.  Customer service wise, it was pretty bad.  They charged us the 18% gratuity and there was only 4 of us in our party so that's another thing. I don't mind tipping at all, I really don't. I do it according to the service that was provided but the service was pretty bad.  Usually I give more then 18% but since they want just 18% I just let them.  If you're looking for good food and don't care about service, I say go for it!  If you want service and don't want to cook your own food, I say pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love love love beef tongue!!

lMIPd48NCdGKBmp6BQ4waA.text: I like to think of this place as your average KBBQ places. want Korean BBQ but don't really feel like spending that much and have some time to kill? tofu hut is your place!   it's really affordable compared to other Korean BBQ places in Vegas. but because of that, expect a long wait. sometimes you'll get lucky and get seated right away. but if it's the weekend, lunch or dinner time, or if you have a big party...expect about 45mins to an hour long wait. I don't know if the food is worth the wait, but the price definitely is!   but if you don't want Korean BBQ and you just want some Korean food, there's the other side of the restaurant for that. there's never any wait on that side, so you can seat yourself and eat pretty much right away! I really like their tofu soup there! my favorite kinds are the kimchee beef and dumpling. it's just really good and comforting!   I only gave this place 3 stars because I think of this place as just average. they're not horrible, but they're also not breathtakingly awesome, you know what I mean? but to just satisfy your Korean food craving? it'll do.

WQ82DW8xdS3_qED9FGEcuw.text: This is probably My go to AYCE Korean BBQ place here in Vegas. I've been here many times already with friends and so far there's nothing that much bad to say about the place so let's focus on the good.   First of all their dry meats are the best ones to go for. The marinated items just don't cut it for me. The steamed egg is always perfect and the Salad is always appetizing. $16.99 is pretty good for their prices, not too much out of the range of other AYCE places.   The only gripe I have with this place is the space and waiting times. They need to move somewhere larger. As good as their food is people come here because they want to binge and are hungry right at the moment they step in the door. To wait for another 30 minutes just to get seated kinda ruins it for some people. Parking is also an issue since there's more people coming in individually with their own cars versus people who carpool. Most times I park in the junkyard right behind the garage in front of the resto(not that I care though since the Tire shop in front of it is pretty well lit).   Overall the place is an institution with foodies and Tofu Hut has already grabbed their fair share of regulars including Me and My crew. The place just needs enlarging both in resto space and parking space. Will be coming back here expecting for more Korean BBQ awesomeness.

6IYECi3RQx5Ua3gSdkpDmw.text: I am going to defer to the review of Melissa Y, who says it all:  What is the big fuss? And Why is this place still open?  As many who have read my reviews know, my wife is Korean, and we are picky about our Korean BBQ. This place is not worth the time and trouble to cross the street and park here.  The quality is really poor, the place is dirty, and they seem to have an attitude.  I could say more negetive things, but it would be pointless.  Drive further down Spring Mountain, and give Korean Garden BBQ a try. Much better quality, better service, and oh, it's very clean.

vvMmJQgAuIRYnBsi2Q5MkA.text: If you want AYCE Korean BBQ on the cheap this is the spot. Expect to wait for a table but its worth it, I LOVE the salad.

doW4wovfi3wOhhw_2Opkww.text: If it wasn't for bf's and I indecisiveness about what to eat for dinner,  I wouldn't have had the opportunity to say this now..haha  We were trying to decide whether we should do sushi or italian? Then the next thing we thought is the prices were too high for a roll of sushi! which then brings us to think about all-you-can-eat, since he'd rather pay more to get more! theeen it came to a decision for Tofu Hut because he's been here many times and loooves this place! And its my first time!   The highlight: ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT BBQ!!! (nom nom nom!) The price: $16.99 per person (not bad) The list of meats we picked:  - Short Ribs (my fave..so juicy and mouthwatering) - Brisket (my 2nd fave! Thin sliced and flavorful) - Boneless chicken thigh (good, a lil spicy) - Short Ribeye (good, tender, but kinda salty) - Pork Belly (taste like bacon) The Sides included: - Cucumber - Tofu  - Kimchee - (korean radishes) - a big bowl of salad   This place is "COOK YOUR OWN SHIT!" Lol.  So definitely it would be a cool place to eat at with friends, family, and especially A DATE! haha. that way everyone can all help out together cooking, crackn laughs, and just having a good time!   FYI*** *sniffs*  the smell from the food will be stuck to your clothes. blah!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. short ribeyes
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RAW brisket, pork belly, and short ribeye!

LBh2iaKhq0NeTl-Hp6seOA.text: Food is great & grill your own is fun esp my kids enjoyed it.  However they add automatic gratuity on a party of 4 & yet when u pay, careful bc there's a line for a tip.  It's kinda' tricky, don't b deceived!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lKVl9oai-tpsRtSP-C1FDA.text: This is my second time here at Tofu Hut. This is also the second time we have wait 3X the wait that they quoted to us. This is my biggest issue with them. Other than that their all you can eat deal is pretty good, if you can eat everything and chill within the 90 minute time limit you have. There's a limited selection on what you can get, it's not as nice as other Korean BBQs however. The one thing I will say that is outstanding is their salad! The most amazing salad you will ever eat I promise you.

xZe8XjzCPM2M-o5nVcxlOQ.text: Meat quality isn't that great if you're looking for a cheap Korean BBQ. Only half the restaurant is dedicated to KBBQ while the other half is nearly empty for most of the day (I don't see why they should add grills to the other half of the place since it will drastically cut the wait time in half since people like to go there).  If you're looking for authentic KBBQ, go somewhere else.

a2S2lNRQSIiTzF-HyVEWZA.text: I don't understand how this place is rated the best in Vegas. It's completely mediocre. The place is incredibly small and the wait is horrendously long.    I saw the Yelp reviews and the AYCE prices are similar to that of the ones in Los Angeles - why the hell not?  Boy and I got there around 7pm and weren't seated till a little after 8pm.   A side note, it's annoying when people show up and give X amount of people but then change the amount of people at the last minute causing everyone else to wait even more or the workers to readjust the waiting list.   The food - mediocre at best.  My steamed egg tasted like it had egg shells in it. It happened twice! I had to spit it out. Ugh, this is one of my favorite dishes too, not cool.  The marinated ribeye was the best, followed by the spicy pork belly.   I wouldn't be back.

250bjvTHg2FCxOlHGRFxIQ.text: Wow, worst service ever.  Friend recommended this place because of how good the food is. Turns out, he's right. The food is pretty good. They had marinated ribeye slices to pork belly.   When the service came around, no one greeted us and we had to "sign in" basically. Got seated in 20 minutes, server came around and got her notepad and started to wait for us, well nice to meet you too?  After that, she never came back, a different server had to get our orders, refill drinks, and give us our check which was all due in us asking for it.  Food is great, service needs a lot of improvement...

IfRJKcO1cDoclfpXasGetA.text: HORRIBLE customer service!! Door says open till 2 am, they REFUSED us service at 12:40 am. When I questioned their choice of service, they said they had a wait and threatened to call the police, despite the fact that I was requesting nicely for a table. Normally would eat here, but this horrible, harassment level customer service shows that this company doesn't care about their guests. I've worked over ten years in the customer service industry and I've never been treated so cruelly before. I warn anyone who wants to eat here, please stay away.

GsI8eFBGQle17L_z85gtIQ.text: I usually come here to get my KBBQ fix and there's no doubt about it! It truly hits the spot. Service is okay, it isn't too clean.. If you ever sit by the windows or the walls in the middle they are slightly grimey. I'd give them more stars if they cleaned up a little better. Other than that, food is good so it ain't stopping me! LOL!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kind of grimey :(

60VkFdhLdM0jIGPzXt-3-Q.text: Finally got to actually eat! The meat tasted good, was pretty tender, and it smelled great. Customer service wasn't bad either. Pretty pleasant experience overall.

3HctPSxp9ClqjDVo26U0Ag.text: If you are hungry or very hungry, I recommend you to go elsewhere. However, if you are NOT hungry or does not mind waiting for A LONG LONG TIME to get service, then go right ahead, this just might be the restaurant for you.  Service overall is absolutely terrible. The restaurant is so stingy that they don't give you the appetizer dishes until your main course is completely finished cooking, all other Korean restaurants give out appetizers first thing right after you've ordered food. Also, if you are just to dine there and not going there for bbq, you will wait longer because they will serve the people who goes for bbq first, and then maybe come to you.   Food is so-so. I would go to another Korean restaurant if I were you, there are so many of them on Spring Mountain Road/China Town, why come here and receive such bad service?!

1Vd0509k-7uOfyGsa0x5iQ.text: Love this place. Unlimited Korean BBQ. Nuf said. I always come here when I have time in Vegas because there's not any places around me that have unlimited korean BBQ. Last time I've been here was a few years ago and I'm happy it's still here :)  Uhhh but beware- they use other peoples old meats so double check UR meat plates lol

gg0s6HgjrIso-bQHv5kw-Q.text: So I've been back here a few times since my initial review and I've decidedly like it better now than before. The service isn't perfect all the time, but I've been pretty satisfied recently. Of course, their salad is a plus. I ADORE THAT SALAD. I still need to get an order of it to-go. It's amazing. My favorite salad of all time :D.  I don't usually come here unless it's for the late night $13.99 special. I'm not much of a bulgogi person so I always get just pork belly and tripe. Tripe isn't everyone's thing but it's definitely MY thing. I'll eat brisket if ordered but I don't really care for it. It's not like I can eat that much in one sitting so just pork belly & tripe will do for me.  Come with a few friends so that you get a variety if you wanna try everything (in case you're not a big eater).  They'll do split checks, no problem. No troubles there so far. The bill also adds tax in it so it's a nice surprise.   This is definitely one of my to-go place for KBBQ. And their side dishes aren't too bad. Love the pancake one. :0D

denrwyxfyr-iqmvF6f_t5Q.text: I'm not a fan of giving out single stars but unfortunately this is a must.  It used to be that I was a regular here before they opened up better quality Korean bbq restaurants in town and provided better service, wayyyy better service.  The simple appeal of tofu hut is their late night price of 14 dollars for ayce but you also get what you pay for, McDonald's is also cheap, again you get what you pay for. Poor quality food.  The last time I came here I was actually extremely humiliated. It was for a goodbye dinner with my family. One of us who spoke Korean fluently asked about the menu to the owner, at which she said you can only order 3 items on the ayce at a time.   Okay no big deal, she could of said it a little more politely but whatever, it's packed, they're stressed we understand.  So we ordered the brisket, bulgogi, and the beef tong-"THATS IT NO MORE."  And just like that the owner cut us off and turned her back and walked away. WOW completely rude. Did we really just wait an hour to be treated like this?? Water cups were practically never filled, I think we had to ask 3 times whenever we needed a grill changed since I was breathing in more second hand smoke than at a cigar shop..  The food was low quality compared to the other Korean bbq places like gen djk and hwaro. There's always about an hour wait for their late night prices, and so far from the last 3 times I went, service was nonexistent..the last experience I just wrote being the worst.  And FYI, it's always the same Korean owner lady who treats us poorly. I guess that's how you treat your regulars? Okay that's cool, there's better Korean bbq places just down the road anyways. *Cough cough* ones that haven't been shut down for too many demerits due to health code violations *cough cough* And with more ample parking, less of a wait, better quality, and manners maketh restaurant..Ehem, better service!  I bid thee adieu, adieu, parting is such sweet sorr.."NOPE! ITS SUCH SWEET BLISS!"

JHHm5c_jZKkRnDAwwuWyDg.text: I always pass this place on Spring Mountain and see that it is always packed. I went in one time with my family when I found out that it wasn't only a Tofu house but also a All you can eat Korean Bbq place. Unfortunately there are only a few tables for the BBQ (the other half of the restaurant is the tofu restaurant) that they told us the wait would be over an hour and a half. Because we did not want to wait, we left. I was able to try this restaurant without having to wait on a Thursday night and I am happy that I was able to try it out.  All you can eat Korean BBQ for $16.99 (Anytime/90 minute limit) or $13.99 (Late Night Special 10PM- 2AM/ 90 minute limit). There is a minimum of 2 persons for a BBQ table so if you are planning on eating here on a date with yourself you're out of luck. The choice of meats are as follows:  *Marinated Sliced Ribeye- One of my top favorites. It was tender and marinated well. Not to much "fat" on the meat which to me is a plus. *Brisket- Another one of my top favorites. It is also one of the quickest to cook since it is thinly sliced. It was good to snack on while waiting for the other meats to cook. *Pork Belly- Another one of my top favorites. Was of good quality and was extremely tasty. *Beef Tongue *Tripe, Honeycomb *Squid *Marinated Sliced Pork Belly *Boneless Chicken Thigh- One of my top favorites. Note: this takes a lot longer to cook. I recommend putting this on the grill first! *Bean paste soup *Short Ribs *Steam Egg- YUM!!!  I absolutely loved the sides. The bean sprouts and fish paste were amazing!  The only thing that I disliked about this place was now it was designed. Like i said, half of the restaurant is for the Tofu House/Restaurant and the other half was for the Korean Bbq. The Bbq tables are close to each other so when i was seated and eating, my chair was touching the guys behind me the whole time and I would have to stand up when anyone from their table had to get up to use the restroom or go outside. It was pretty annoying.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed Egg

0ol93aYlqs8U2u9XdbEUSw.text: We came here about midnight. I think you can expect a wait around this time daily. It was about a half hour wait for the 3 of us. Seems like it always gets packed and I can see why!  Their late night all you can eat special is only 13.99 and that's a hard price to beat. It's a small clean restaurant. We had ordered a lot of different cuts of meats and they brought out the food pretty quick. It tasted very fresh so no complaints there!  It was very busy but I really wish our waiter had checked up on us more. You have to flag them down to get a new clean grill. Other than that no issues here. For 13.99, all you can eat bbq is a great deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly. Ribeye. Spicy pork. Etc
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Various sides come with the all you can eat option

LYzeQJogsTs8oXXxIigQ4w.text: Tried this Korean BBQ AYCE in Las Vegas Chinatown  for the first time,  we had a party of three and arrived at 1:30pm on a Tuesday.  We did not have to wait at all for a table.  The service was prompt and "asian" friendly.  What I mean by that is that asian servers don't usually engage with the patron as like other types of restaurants/cultures.  That said, our server was fine, and gave service with a sort of smile. She was by no means rude or testy.  This was only my 2nd time at a cook-your-own spot.  We ordered the marinated sliced ribeye, beef tongue, short ribs , and brisket. We also had the steamed egg. The meat items were all very tasty and tender, except for the tongue, which is on the chewy side, but that's probably how it is.  The ribs was especially melt-in-your-mouth tender.  The steamed egg was a nice counter to all that meat.  The meats were preceded by the usual pickled vegetables, kimchi, and a nice vegetable tossed salad. The rice was very good also.  All-in-all, this was a tasty and fun experience.  And it's such a great bargain!  Thumbs up all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed egg.
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yzN_ZG-xj6H0VDkyGn9HlQ.text: This place has good food! I love their meats, well marinated and not hard to chew. They have a small place and alot of customers so you should be prepared to wait or come early if you're going there dinner time. Overall, I love it! Oh, also their salad is good!

T87FTC44TTMfExFGjpFo2A.text: I've been going to this kbbq place for a while now & I think now is a great time to finally type up a review.  The meat selection is small compared to all the other kbbq places Chinatown has to offer, but it comes with a great price. I only get two items (maybe three) which consists of beef tongue, brisket, & steamed egg & every visit, their meat & steamed egg never disappoints!  From my past visits to this place, customer service is always a 50/50. Some days they'll be on point & get you what you need asap & some days they'll just hang out at the cash register (even on a busy night).

YUEdwYy-xP11tUHnah9BEA.text: Fast & courteous service, delicious food. All you can eat Korean BBQ and excellent price. My fam loved it.

5UW3p8OPxsciRxDdNRlyrA.text: Love coming here for Korean BBQ!  Delicious food and affordable price for AYCE.   Price drops a few dollars in the evening and gets pretty crowded. It would be great if they expanded so there's more grills for people coming in for Korean BBQ.   Other than that, customer service is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs!
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t7fCJ96Jrs0jfzHClC5iKg.text: Last call is 12:45am not 2am   So don't waste your time coming here..  Or   Else you have some guy yelling at you tell you that there close...  If my girlfriend wasn't with me I would have change the open and closing time on the door.. ohh well maybe next

0GGfGRCBKbooft0bmPpLSg.text: I love Tofu Hut for their late night special. They have both AYCE Korean BBQ and regular entree items. However, the number of tables for Korean BBQ is limited, so there's usually a 15min-1 hour wait. The meat selection is good, but limited, and there is a 100% chance that you will smell like it afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soy sauce chicken
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean paste soup
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side dishes

_k7Ga3zboA8FhtIRgJHIUQ.text: Service was quick and the food was okay. The soup tasted like it was bad. Not going back.

fxocVWoHVPOaaH2ostpJMA.text: This was my first time trying Korean BBQ and it was amazing. The food was delicious and the service was good. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o5nh1-tjqBeCFnSHg-CYiA.text: Love this place. We have been coming here since it first opened, Tofu Hut was one of the first Korean restaurants in town!   I have tried their AYCE which is very good, under $20 for dinner and even cheaper for lunch. The meat is good, fewer side dishes than other places, but you can order bean paste soup and steamed eggs with your AYCE, which not every place has.   The best deal is their combinations, listed under "Lunch Specials" but we have ordered this for dinner too. For 4 people, we usually order a Chicken Combo and a Rib combo, which comes with the two meats, and two soups. Order 2 extra rice and everyone is happy, satisfied and stuffed! Comes out to under $40 for 4 people for very good food!   Have been coming here for years and will continue to come back. Service is good, we come so often the waitress there remembers us and usually asks if we are doing the same as we always do :)

zJ6OrkJFVGETfP3qV50Rug.text: Had the Lunch AYCE $16.99 and it was good.  For the 2 of us we ordered the spicy pork belly, beef short ribs, rib eye, and brisket.  The meats came with sides of veggies, rice, and a large bowl of salad that the 2 of us barely made a dent in.  All of the meat was delicious, except for the brisket...it was thinly sliced, fatty, and not a lot of flavor.  2 of us could barely finish all the meat we ordered, it was really good portions and my favorite was the short ribs...so good! Service was good, but it wasnt that busy when we were there, but we did take the last bbq table at 1p on a Monday afternoon.  I'll definitely return, but with more people so we dont waste food.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PnygZ2fr5QbGZa3wXo8QKQ.text: The owner takes good care of us every single time we come in! Service is quick and staff is on top of everything when we come in.

t7WqYSKGiicsGOxvWJGZDw.text: The best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. I've been coming here consistently for years. I recommend this place to my co-workers, family, and friends.   The price is low and selection is tasty. The atmosphere is lively and service wonderful. They won't come around and cook for you unless you really need it. Which I prefer.   The restaurant is small, half is dedicated to BBQ and the other half to normal dining. The wait is long. Make no mistake about it you'll have to wait. Do yourself a favor and grab a seat in the sparsely populated normal dining area, get a few bottles of soju and cass, and pour each other Somaek as you wait. The food will taste much better anyway when you're all drunk and having fun.

nF4qIeI34aqJotQbfUz7BA.text: I miss this place so much. I only lived in LV for one semester, before I moved back home to Reno. I am so thankful that I was introduced to this place, the place where I lost my KBBQ-ginity. Since leaving Vegas, I have been to many Korean bbq restaurants, but none compare to Tofu Hut.  I wish there was a tofu hut convenient everywhere I go! I miss it so much; the delicious sides, sauces, salad, THE MEATS. Everything about this place is perfect. The price? AMAZING.  I have heard a lot of rumors about this place being unclean, but I don't even care their food is to die for. Some of my friends hate tofu hut, so Im assuming its a hit or miss for everyone.  But for me its a hit straight to my heart. I miss this place so much and I plan on going every time I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tofu hut!!! me and my line sisters, we love tofu hut (most of us).

Nz65wYPiCuOmnQ7tO-AXQg.text: Since the minute I walked in I felt uncomfortable. The service was terrible. The waiter hardly ever came over so every time I needed to ask for more meat I had to hunt them down. I felt a bit discriminated because I see them taking care of everyone else so well. Never coming again. For the price of all you can eat you can go to any other restaurant for better quality of service and food.

_5BWRrOxlPzYrXayR_88_w.text: Tofu hut has always been my go-to spot for AYCE KBBQ!! There's always a wait if you plan to eat late night but I find it worth the wait! The price has changed to $16.99 for all day ayce which is still not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooking pork belly and brisket

cD7J1i1SMW7kWNzVwSEwRg.text: I don't really care much for KBBQ, but when my friends and I go, it's usually here. Their price is not bad at all and there's a lot to pick from. Every time I go, the wait time usually exceeds 30 minutes but it's understandable since  I go in the evening and the place is always packed. Customer service here isn't bad either, they're usually pretty friendly and efficient when getting the orders out. I love their pork belly, brisket is hit or miss because sometimes they cut it too thick and sometimes it's just perfect.

u8zS4cq65_okl5vqpzr0Uw.text: Waitress/hostess is horrible.  I asked her in Korean how long the wait was and she COMPLETELY ignored me.  I am used to bad service in Korean restaurants but this is first time a waitress did not even make eye contact.  Food is average.   Wait was long but only because they only have 6 tables with grills.  It definitely is not because of their food.

ihbYGGimyrycdRLPhoWm5w.text: This review is SOLELY for the late night special: After 10PM AYCE is $13.99 -everyday  1) Expect to wait anytime after 10pm especially if you are in a large group.  2) Brisket and beef tongue are bomb. my two favorites.  3) Make your own dipping sauce of half vinegar and half soy sauce-mix with the sesame oil they give you also. YUM!  4) Ask for the salad.   Usually there is one main asian guy running the joint, and man, is he FAST. I've gone when he wasn't there and was replaced with 3 different workers. They were so slow I left still kind of hungry.

AMRjqahv1IuhJ6yk-pROkw.text: As a vegetarian, I have to tell you that I was pretty excited to see a place called "Tofu Hut" -- open 24 hours a day, even!  When I finally made my way over there with a fellow vegetarian (the only person who could possibly be as excited as I was about a restaurant called "Tofu Hut"), I have to say we VERY disappointed.  As far as I could tell, there were only two tofu dishes on the entire menu.  And they both had meat in them, too.  This was apparently more of a Korean BBQ place than a vegetarian haven.  Not only was its name misleading, I found the inside to be very unclean... When I ate there the first time, I didn't touch my food.  Needless to say, I wouldn't eat there again.  Ever.

rQQC2IJirTLMtrF7Fao0TA.text: Absolutely loved my meal here. We came in on a Thursday night with a group of 12 and we were lucky that they had a table open for us or else we would've waited for awhile. This place was packed! I think that for $16.99 a person it was a steal! We ordered so much food and ate so much it was ridiculous. The service was fast and the meat was fresh and very flavorful. I loved their salad that came with the bbq and the banchan was pretty good too. The service wasn't all that great and the place was a little cramped but the good food made up for it. I'm an out of towner and to see a lot of locals at this restaurant shows that this place has to be good, and it was! 2 thumbs up.

7xN_4bfFlP-ExM_MjFEiBA.text: This place is pretty good, a pretty good value of what you get from a joint off of the strip.   Since it is called "tofu hut" please note that their specialties is just that. Tofu! Specifically the Korean, "Soon Tofu" dishes. Keeping that in mind, I went ahead and ordered the "kim chee and beef" soon tofu. The dish itself was not too bad, I think it may have needed a little more salt, but then again the decent ban chan took care of that.   I would go back to try some of their other dishes. Like other Vegas spots, they are open late!   Good Eats.

Dh4geTT3G3mgFmsPMl_uCg.text: So I didn't try the pork belly which is what I hear is the bomb... so i guess that's why i'm not the biggest fan.    we did try the all you can eat which pricing wise.. is great. we ordered the short ribs, chicken, and rib-eye..  they start you off with a bowl of salad which was very good..  [i actually make the salad at home everyday!]  then they bring out little dishes that included kim chee [i've had better.. wasn't the best kim chee i've had...] pickled radishes, cucumbers... and my favorite side dish:  tofu!    the short ribs.. i've definitely had better... and have MADE better as far as marinade.  it's not even short ribs but beef cuts.  the spicy chicken i kinda liked.. [a little bit]  but it was a little dry and not  juicy at all.  i did like the sliced rib-eye which is on the salty sweet side.   other than that... i've had better all you can eat korean bbq, but the price was good.    as far as service.. there's like 1 guy waiting on the entire restaurant., [which isn't that big... but still..]  i don't know how it is on other days since this was my first time here.. but he was friendly and accommodating.  i had no issues with dude.. but he definitely needed some help that day.    next time i'm coming with the friends that recommended the place.  i guess i ordered wrong!  but.... eh, as far as coming back because i want to come back.. i'll pass.

hbr602RanvHomB4eHBoOuA.text: I like this place. I like the atmosphere, food and the price. It's perfect late night hangout. The meat is not the best quality but when you are little drunk it does not matter. everything tastes good. I would recommend this place if you are on a tight budget like me and want to eat up! plus they are opened till 6AM. Thank you Tofu Hut.

xOLr-LLwzgmKi4F9bFDhyQ.text: I'm not sure what all the negative reviews are about.  My crew and I stormed in here and carried out and loved every bite of our food.  It was spicy, hearty and decently priced.  Just what we needed to tie us over in our alcohol drenched evening.  I guess the name is a bit of a misnomer.  I don't really think you're supposed to come here and enjoy their "tofu mastery" (isn't there another "tofu" place right across the street?).  From what was relayed to me by a local, this is the place to come for Korean "street" food like ddukbokki (spicy rice cakes) and odeng (fish cake soup).  This place loves jalapenos like Ricky loves Lucy.  We found traces of it on the ddukbokki, the marinated pork and the chicken wings.  We even expected to find some in the fish cake soup but no such luck.  No one is perfect, after all.  +1 for being relatively close to the strip.  The crew and I will definitely mark this for another go the next time we're in town.

KVk46W5yqYisw-vj1SevCw.text: Good Korean bbq restaurant. The service there is great. Although there are not many choices to choose from, the price there makes up for the small amount meat there.

grhAweE3odKge5BAHKre_A.text: Place is pretty good for AYCE  kbbq. Service is ok. Take a them awhile when you ask for one thing. Though, an automatic 15% gratitude for party of 4 or more shouldn't be there. Yes by Nevada law it is parties of 6 or more with 18% gratitude. I hope the owners of tofu hut know what their doing is wrong. Just saying.

iHgsm1X9eG--FQ_CI1GDDQ.text: First time here...as a vegetarian I didn't find a whole lot on the menu for me but ordered the bi bim bap meat & egg-less. it was 'ok'. The tofu soup in medium heat however was AWESOME.

8t7sjpW2rdMB5PfFPl299g.text: We have been here couple times already but never got around to writing a review until now. Anyhoo, my husband & my son loves this place.  Cheap AYCE korean bbq with quality meat. The flavor is great. We specially like the ribeye, short ribs and the brisket. My son loves the steamed egg. I did not like the squid and the chicken. The sides are good as well specially the long noodles. One thing I did not like is the long wait. It gets really crowded on their bbq area. I wish they turn the other dining area into bbq area as well.  Also, when they get busy...you will wait for your meat to come. Couple times the servers forgot about our meat coz they were too busy and not enough servers. It is still one of our fave korean bbq! Love this place!

2Y3CGwQkqh_n-s_xh18q8A.text: AYCE Korean BBQ, and it's open til 4AM? Sign my hungry face up.   This review is summarized in 10 tips.  1. If you are making a post-club visit, be smart like me, and leave your club clothes in the car. Come in with just a t-shirt and pants. Your clothes will smell like Seoul when you are done. 2. Bring your hunger. Drunk. Sober. High. Low. Whatever.  3. Order the salad with your banchan (side dishes for you amateurs). 4. This place is the epitome of an ethnic restaurant. It's not fancy, it's not pretty. Leave your pretentious bitchy friends outside. In the cold, winter weather. Or in the hot, hot heat. Make them more miserable. :D 5. Marinated pork belly, beef tongue, brisket are excellent choices. 6. Get rice. 7. It makes sense to order some Hite (Korean Beer) 8. It's all you can eat, so don't be shy. Have no shame in your food game (I stole that from my friend Kurdy S.) 9. The grill is at your table, so you grill it yourself. You run the show! 10. Don't plan on doing anything after this meal because you will be so full!  I love this place!

Ics08pK0ZXvQaIQ1nazkwg.text: I like this place. It's definitely a lot cheaper than the other Korean restaurants in the area. They were sooo overpriced. $30-50 bucks for Bulgogi? No freaking way. Me and my friends each ordered the all you can eat buffets, and each paid about $20 with tax and tip included. And we also got plenty of side dishes! I love Korean side dishes, and expect them to be at every Korean restaurant I go to. The kimchee wasn't that good, but the tofu, cucumber, sprouts, and noodles were some of my favorites. Ooh and the salad was good too. I was not that thrilled about cooking some of the meats myself, but after awhile of seeing my friends go at it, I ended up doing it, and it wasn't bad. I definitely liked the short ribs, the squid, and the the spicy pork belly. I was in a lot of pain afterwards, but sometimes food coma and that bloated feeling is worth it. I guess.

8SvKUhos84-0tTPfcUG3LQ.text: I usually come here once every month. Service is hit or miss. Food is good, we always get the ayce (pork belly, squid, beef tongue) their side dishes are ok, i've have better kimchee. The only thing that keeps me coming back is the price.

GCaIL0yp6hhX4DrgfbrLFg.text: $17 all day for all you can eat Korean BBQ. What a great price. The menu has about 10 items on it, typical Korean fare - except for the amazing rib eye. It is absolutely utterly a work of art. It's rare to get a meat that is so tender and soft it just melts in your mouth. The marinades and sweet tangy flavors will tickle your tastebuds. I am positive I could have ordered 3 or 4 plates of this and a half cup of rice and been in food heaven.  As for the rest: korean appetizers - very good peanut salt & pepper dip and fish cakes rib eye - a bit dry, like pho well done flank, nothing special steamed egg - a fluffy egg similar to that in soups except in one piece. it works really well with meat and rice, I recommend it marinated short ribs - very good, but if you've had korean bbq you've had it 200 times marinated pork belly - fatty and a korean bacon clone, tasty but too much fat boneless chicken breast - took forever to cook and was pretty bland, nothing special here  This place is open til 5am for the drunks in Vegas and has a special cheaper price after 11pm I believe.  Definitely worth coming to again for the rib eye.

kZNfx_b4EqFd7-f2Iqsryw.text: Korean BBQ... yum yum yum   I visited this place for lunch today expecting to be sleepy from food coma afterwards. It let me down....  Service: it was OK   Quality: could be a lot better  -Sliced ribeye: good flavor but didnt tatse like ribeye  -Brisket: cut too thick so still a little chewy at times and didn't look that fresh.  -Marinated pork belly: dont try it...  -Short Ribs: way too much fat in the cuts, not trimmed properly, the chewy lining was not taken off.  -steamed egg: that was the only thing I think was really good.   Once is enough, rather just wait till I visit LA to scratch the Korean BBQ itch next time.

qoUUX_eMZYWHihzgclRU_Q.text: I really enjoy this place :-) Their tofu porriage has become my comfort food. I love their little side dishes that come with the meals too. I take my toddler here and the servers take such good care of us. Good food and good prices well worth it :-) it's a keeper

6IIyGWAk2KQrOpTQ1OGY1g.text: ALL YOU CAN EAT KOREAN BBQ. yum!  The cheapest all you can eat korean bbq that I've been too (13.99) and preeeeetty good. Although they did raise the price (use to be 11.99) Starts after 11 PM so its perfect for a late night snack. They let you pick from a variety of meat (except for kalbi that cost 16.99) and they give plenty of side dishes. I looooooove coming here.. pork belly and brisket... mmmmmmmm...

ZYlf1csburls7ebHGqE8MA.text: So you have to go early for dinner, but it's a great and cheap ($17) all you can eat Korean BBQ place. Try the marinated pork belly or ribeye. Oh, it can get hot in there during the summer.

9xD-2YkWQcmXzcNpKfcnYg.text: Honestly this place was shit. Waiters barely ever came to our table. And the biggest thing. Who charges 15% gratuity for only 4 people. Outrageous. It would've been ok if they told us before hand. But they only told us at the end leaving us dazed and confused.

P4NWYuIsfYbjsSi4XUXOUg.text: My boys now love Korean BBQ.  Since one is a teenager, AYCE is the only way to go.    This visit was better.  Same time, 4pmish on a weekday, but only one other table was occupied.  We had the rib eye, brisket, pork belly, beef tongue, and two orders of kalbi.    The servers were a little more attentive, and were great at bringing out refills and clearing plates.  They also refilled the banchan when we asked.

JnZYrFdmE7o3AgIQ3KJU5Q.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! I had the best time with my friends ! We were soo stuffed !!! I say the ribs is good

4keijC5_WCjWwIs0JXDomA.text: Although the wait was long, the food was definitely worth it. It is open until 2AM for those who would love to indulge their need for some good Korean BBQ. I would highly recommend ribeye and brisket. Its always fun grilling up fresh, delicious meat at your table. . While also enjoying the side dishes provided !

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye!

yNc6ZnZ59nUFmnvDn-XXlQ.text: Tofu hut is my favorite restaurant in the entire world!!!! I'm a huge foodie and I know there are so many varieties of cuisines but there is nothing like their marinated ribeye , short ribs , pork belly, yummy lil potAto pancakes mmm!! I have literally been there over 50 times over the last 3 years and have spent many hours with people I love around those little table grills ! In fact my husband and I had our first date there ! sadly we have parted ways with Las Vegas so I will be craving tofu hut until we go back and visit home in May !! Mmmmmm tofu hut ...

leQfdD6dqtx_ehLEkE0z3A.text: Everyweek my co workers and i always eat here sometimes twice a week or once. $15 All you can eat KBBQ where else can you find this?   No need to ask for refills our server does it automatically! GOODJOB!

EDYasaIkMaQg6AF2F61LAA.text: I always come here during lunch because they have good specials on the tofu soup! It's cheap, delicious & comes with a lot of food! And usually the service is quick- not too long of a wait.  However, I ate here for dinner the other night and the wait was ridiculously long! It was just a party of 2 but we waited over an hour. What made me angry was the fact that there were seats open!! There were at least 4 tables open but they didn't fill those up. They made us wait an hour and they finally sat us- at the table that was open this entire time!!!  We did the all you can eat and it was only $16.99. Lots of food & it was good~ love their short ribs!! It's good, cheap food but you just have to wait a looooong time!

QEvfy8XBDnAWlzsM_u0AYw.text: This is probably the most disgusting food I have ever had in my life and I am a big fan of McDonald's and street food so please don't think I am rich, snobby, and only dine where the rich and famous do, lol.  The wait was horrible. About 45 minutes. When we were seated, the server did not explain ANYTHING to us. This is one of those places where you cook your own food. We had to GOOGLE instructions for how long to cook certain things. I have been to other places where you cook your own food and they explain the minutes to cook certain foods for and are generally available with any questions. We never saw our server again.  You guessed it...it came out awful. But it wasn't just our awful cooking skills (which I do take partial blame for) but the meat was incredibly disgusting. Dry, room temperature, grey, sometimes brown, just looked like it had been sitting out for a long time. Also the sides were equally disgusting so I know it wasn't all because we cooked it badly. It just tasted like they left yesterday's food out on the counter and brought us that to eat.  I didn't get sick from it but it just left a disgusting taste in my mouth and my stomach. I actually found myself purposely vomiting as my own vomit tasted better than their garbage food. I wanted it out of my system immediately. The thought of it makes me want to hurl again.  I don't see what the hype is about this place: bad service, bad food. Will never return. I don't have other Korean BBQ spot recommendations but don't come here.

WMb61yI1wZseT2nzNGpD8w.text: This is my favorite korean bbq ayce! They're a bit snobby but the food is really good. We come here every week and it is a must for us to have tofu hut once a week. Thats how much we love to eat here. I love their brisket and bulgogi and steamed egg. Their pork belly is good too, being thin and easy to cook. And the best part here is their oil! Omg. Its really good with their meat. Highly recommend this place to those visiting vegas! :)

whg_DucBxtR3OIDW_99C8g.text: Looking for a late night spot to fill your craving for some kbbq? Look no further than Tofu hut. This is the go to place for kbbq for my group of friends and I.  16.99 from opening till 10pm 13.99 from 10pm to 3am   The food here is not bad, the meat, depending on which one you choose, is usually frozen unless it is marinated. The marinade they use is good but like any marinated kbbq causes the grill to toast over. The meat is fresh and is yummy when it's really late. Finally, the sides that come with the food are good.   The service is there is hit or miss. Some days it is really good and others it was a bit lackluster. This is understandable, people have their good days and their bad days. They are very quick in taking your order and brining your order out.  Overall not a bad place to grab some late night kbbq, I know you can find me there after my work for some late night munchies.

Iwg2GLQbHSNSZZm1XLqc1w.text: Best Korean BBQ in Vegas. Love their marinated pork belly and squid. Their salad is addicting. Staff is friendly. Can be a long wait on weekend nights, but that's to be expected. My go to Korean BBQ spot!

VhgCGBosef3x-bawjDpoNQ.text: Tofu Hut... we have a love hate relationship.  Service is AWESOME most of the time but sometimes i feel like they forgot i was there.  Meat quality isnt the best but for its price you cant really ask more.  We always get the AYCE. Just brisket and pork belly. because everything else is meh...  and dont even talk about the squid...i thought i was going to be seasoned...its not...they throw it on a plate and just give it to you...really?.... wow.. lol  idk how or why i alway6s end up here but like i said.. its a love hate realtinshui[ lol

xrlcq9jI5H87h0jz6WhJuw.text: Because many known yelpers liked Mr. Tofu, we try to go there tonight. Sadly, it wad closed. We decided to try out Tofu Hut since we have never had their food before.  Seeing that it has 3.5 stars, I thought it should be ok.   The furniture was old and raggety looking, especially the torn up cushion on the chairs, but nevertheless, I should try the food.  The menu needed some wiping done since it was covered with sauce.  Ewww.  Anyways, we decided on the beef seafood sundubu and a plate of kalbi.  When the older lady waitress came back to take our order, she was so impatient and short.  We wanted to understand their spicy level so we asked if the spicy level is Korean spicy, she said it's not that spicy.  So we continue to ask her at what level she would order it and she said she don't know since she doesn't eat spicy.  WTF!?!  Her ill-mannerism and major bad attitude continued and I wanted to leave right there and then but my friend wanted to try out the food at least.  Ahhhhh!!!  When we paid the bill, she walked by and hurriedly grab the receipt.  I was pissed that my friend tipped her because truthfully, she did not deserve a penny for the crappy service she gave.  Food was sub-par, nothing special.  I will never ever come back to this crappy place with this crappy ajumma waitress.

poz-wKNLUGquMRtgcDne3g.text: So I know a lot of people complain about Tofu Hut's service, and especially with it being slow (which I completely agree) .. but the food here in my opinion is delicious and one of the better Korean restaurant in China Town.   I've been going to Tofu Hut since before they started having their all you can eat bbq special.. and that was when I noticed the place had picked up a lot more than before. The workers here are all the same workers from the beginning, which is why I think they should really hire more so that 2 women (the normal amount of servers even at 3 AM) don't try to cater to half a side of all you can eat parties and half a side of regular dine ins. It's just too much plates to serve and demands for them to keep up. Every time I go there, I can tell the waitresses are flustered and there's not a time I don't see them run around like crazy. The all you can eat large groups is just too much for them to handle with a small staff.  The food on the other hand is very good, especially their bulgogi, and tofu soups. Their kimchi beef soup is my favorite because it has the perfect blend of sour and spice. This is the one place where I think their spice levels are accurate, and if you order very spicy.. it will come out very spicy!
