The only thing that I noticed with their broth is that it is very deep in color (like a deep orange red). Even if you order it not spicy, the color will still be as red which I'm unsure of the cause.. Perhaps its food coloring or the oil they use... But the color almost looks artificial sometimes. (Someone needs to do research on that. I haven't died yet from eating it lol)  Their bulgogi combo is my favorite. It comes with tofu soup and bulgogi. Bulgogi is their thinly sliced beef, marinated with scallions, onions and korean spices, served on a sizzling iron pan. The meat contains a perfect amount of fat to make it taste extra special when you eat it with rice. Their bulgogi is slightly on the sweeter side.. but not too sweet or salty. It almost taste like Korean kalbi ribs, with the texture of extremely thin sliced beef so it melts in your mouth.. I really think it taste wonderful and something worth trying!   Lastly, their sides are also very good. They sometimes serve glass noodles and potato salad, which is my favorite.. They are the only place in town that are gracious with their side dishes and will give you a decent amount even if it is for one person.  If you ignore the service, and concentrate on the food quality, I'd definitely pick Tofu Hut any day.

kCNO8_5v1PdqN9anNyCGHA.text: Came here with my Family for the first time a few weeks ago. I was definitely not impressed. We sat in the section where you get to grill your own food, ordered just about every type of meat on the menu as it was four of us, we were hungry, and we wanted to try everything. I honestly cant remember one thing that I thought was good. The meat was so bland and tasteless! The sides were not very good either.   It could be that I am just not used to this type of food but in my opinion it was not very good at all. Mind you I was HUNGRY when I went here.  My family did not care for it either and we all agreed we would most likely never return.

mrRcmm_s_nV0ufqCXfJIuA.text: Korean BBQ in Vegas isn't anywhere close to Korean BBQ in SoCal. For real. But you get what you can get and Tofu Hut is the place to get your Korean BBQ fix for a decent price.  During their regular hours AYCE is $16.99, while late night (10 PM - 3 AM) is priced at $13.99. Not too shabby, considering you can get as much meat as you want. They offer a good variety - brisket, bulgogi (marinated beef), thick pork belly slices, tripe, squid, beef tongue and a few others. I'm a fan of the brisket, personally. You can't go wrong with ultra thin slices of beef dipped in their sesame oil/pepper sauce! The marinade on the bulgogi is decent, nothing to rave about. The pork belly is pretty fatty, just a warning.   Side dishes are just as important to a Korean BBQ meal as the meat itself. There wasn't a lot of side dishes - kimchi, spicy cucumbers, japchae (stir-fried vermicelli noodles), fishcakes, steamed egg and a pre-dressed salad (essential for any Korean BBQ meal). This may sound like a lot, but really good BBQ places offer a lot more, probably twice as much. I was longing for some bean paste, maybe some garlic and jalapenos. Perhaps I'm asking for too much. After all, you get what you pay for.   So why the name 'Tofu Hut' when this place is popular for their Korean BBQ? Before the BBQ times, they once strictly sold a variety of soondubu (soft tofu stew). You can get this from not-so-spicy at all to ultra spicy, all depends on your taste buds. They still have this here and are decently priced. But why spend a near ten bucks on a mediocre soondubu dish if you can pay a few dollars more and eat like a king?

ZH8Uat5EX2PsNIk7_Z5OJw.text: Ok for the price. The galbi had very little flavor. Beef tongue was good, but could had been better. The squid was ok. The sides were decent though. But let's be honest we don't go there for the sides. For the price I would try it for the first time, but I probably will not be going back.

ppA9mX3VMNBqh6BpSVUPpg.text: The food is usually well worth it for AYCE BBQ. If you come between 10pm-2am everything is $13.99 their usual price is $16.99. We also get short ribs and steam egg and with those items no matter what time you come it's $16.99   If you never had Korean BBQ before this is a great place to start. I recommend the salad, pancakes, brisket, steam egg.   Watch out for the long wait cause it can take over a hour to be seated sometimes. The place is small, the service is BAD but hey your doing the cooking so their BAD service I've learned to brush off. It has been a hit or miss for us. There are days when the salad and meat is on point then there are days where everything just doesn't taste right. For the most part we leave FULL and satisfied another one of our many once a month spots.

o-s7vl5QXPiEO2jV-q6Imw.text: Had a random k-bbq craving the other day and decided to try tofu hut. It's been my go to place for Korean food, but my first time w their $16.99 ayce.   Started out rocky - it was half empty but we stood waiting to be seated for what felt like forever, while the frazzled server and busser both ignored us. There were a few other service issues to follow but sadly, authentic Asian places aren't known for great service. It is what it is.   Anyway, food was great - decent selection of banchan (the sides), a surprisingly delish salad of romaine and cabbage mixed w a light dressing and I think kochujung sauce. We ordered bulgogi, kalbi short ribs, spicy chicken and spicy pork. The meat quality and marinade was really good, but I'm not a fan the marinade on pork and chicken. Both lacked flavor and the pork had really excessive fat and gristle.   Although not included in ayce we got an order of the fried mandoo, which seemed to be homemade and a pretty generous portion. Also got the spicy tofu soup, which arrived boiling hot and yummy. Tried the steamed egg, which was incorrectly described as kind of a custard. It was more like a really fluffy omelette - seemed like a scrambled raw egg poured onto a little bit of boiling broth w green onion. Surprisingly good, must try.  Service was mediocre with just 1 poor guy running around and the busser girl who spoke no English - she just stared at us although I'm pretty sure coke is still coke in Spanish too. Things got better once one of the cooks came out to help wait tables, he was actually an awesome server. I'd suggest ordering everything at once while you have their attention, and you have to be pretty aggressive about flagging them down.   Sounds like a pretty bad experience, but it is probably my fav of the ayce k-bbq places over sura and woo che. Quality seemed better and a good selection of ban chan. The main negative compared to others is that they're not good about changing out the grill as the charred bits get stuck, but they probably would if you ask. And like with all k-bbq places, just be prepared to smell like Korean food the rest of the night.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade fried mandoo
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ayce grill - spicy pork, kalbi and bulgogi

OTHcysRM04MvhJEvGLGKuQ.text: Horrible customer service.  Not only did they bring us someone else's order, but after we let them know of their error they ignored our table until our correct food arrived 20 mins later. They didn't apologize for their mistake. The waitress never spoke one word to us or make eye contact.   While ignoring our table several of the waitresses were sitting down eating behind the counter because they would get up still chewing their food. Horrible. Not coming back.

2GxDAKJDcfqi36IOOxEdPQ.text: They didn't even charge us for our young boy , he ate very little .. Good quality large portions fast service and yum !!

-oZQruwpnfl51yKd0-zG6Q.text: Very good. Friend recommended and said to get the ribs. It's ayce so we ordered a bunch of things. Wish I listened to my friend. Ribs were awesome. Appetizers and salad were also really good. The other meats were fine but not great like the ribs. If I could go back in time I'd have just ordered tons of ribs. Place is great little hole in the wall. You will smell like BBQ afterwards.

KOETBCGiyfQhr5KIglqmUA.text: The bbq was moderate, however, the service is horrible. Our server was definitely either having a bad day or Hayes his job. :\

3po4ywKWYHjF-bQB488KxA.text: Needing some food to sop up the bacchanalia, I immediately thought of meat + rice comfort.   The BF and I came here for the $13.99 AYCE. This is different from some of the daytime known AYCE KBBQ since it's all table service and not a buffet line.   For banchan we had- fish cakes, korean pancake, bean sprouts, napa kimchee, cucumber kimchee, chap chae. They serve you a bowl of rice and a large bowl of salad. I wasn't feeling the chap chae seasoning, but the rest of the banchan was good. I liked the lightly sweet and tangy dressing on the salad which went well with all the meats.   For meat choices you can get- brisket, thin sliced ribeye, pork belly, marinated pork belly, squid, tripe, tongue, chicken thigh. Also ayce bean paste soup. You can upgrade your ayce to include short rib and steamed egg for $16.99.   We got the ribeye, marinated pork belly, and tongue for our meats. Ribeye had a nice marinade to it which a lot of places lack flavor. Pork belly was with a spicy marinate with onions and pretty good once you let the fat get crispy since they slice it very thin. Tongue is always my favorite- cooks fast and great with salad. Since they plate the meat for you, they sometimes serve a bit more than I want of one of the meats so if you want to taste a lot, ask maybe for small serving.   I was worried about the service after reading reviews, but the service was good. Our water was refilled and refills on food came out quickly. It wasn't very busy, but the guy watching our tables cared to check on people which makes a big difference.   Good late night eats and good value. Definitely will be back.

cQpx1IvJesyXtevgZtX9Bg.text: My favorite Korean BBQ place in vegas!! Only problem is the amount of tables for cooking!!..other than that ..food is excellent...hense the 4 stars!!

p4MSaK3qfi1Q6_eo9UTRng.text: I've been here three times. The strange thing is I've never had tofu here. I always get the AYCE Korean BBQ.  Let me tell you, it's really really good!! You get to pick and choose what meat you want to cook up.  Their side dishes are great. I love the salad they offer.    For $17, this is an awesome deal for AYCE. After 11, it's even cheaper!

B6aEh_uX0rjLY_bujKVhuA.text: This restaurant is alright. I wish their customer service was better. Their severs/host barely talk to you and every time my girlfriend and I go there they never give us straws with our cups. We would have to ask for them every time. Their food is overall great if you can cook them to your satisfactory level. Other then that, the business there is booming and expect to see lines before coming here. I don't know what happened to their salad, but it WAS good.

W--U_2zNCa9gLyMCet6_xg.text: Soon dubu was pretty good here.  Small place so if you don't do the all you can eat bbq, you get seated faster at the regular tables.  I also really liked the bibimbap here.  The pot was perfectly hot so that I got a lot of the crispy rice.  However, we didn't like the ojingo bokum which was too spicy and salty.   Also, the kkakdugi was a little old tasting.

ofGW4N_Cd5_nBZTOrHcNDQ.text: Yep, 'nother vegetarian duped into thinking there would be more veggie options. I ordered one of two non-meat soups, the mushroom one, and it was very good, though.    Wish they would have explained what was what when they brought the extras, as I ended up eating some fishcake thinking it was seitan (silly me for thinking they'd bring us vegetarian stuff after telling them we were vegetarian). Other than that, I barely felt disdain from the service staff.  I got a laugh that they have a Spice level lower than mild (it's called "white" - hah!). Kudos for telling it like it is. I had the mild and probably could have had the medium without worry ( I is not good with spice). One of our party got "Spicy" and he said it wasn't.   Unlike other yelpers, none of us had a bad return once we got home. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. inlaid &#34;Tofu&#34; design in entryway

Zy9BrJrBrFnVYh02eyD5IA.text: Great Korean BBQ for the price. We stuffed ourselves. The staff was friendly and helpful. They were busy and we had to wait, but it was well worth it. Lots of friendly folks come here to dine. Short ribs were awesome. I met the owner at Busy Buggy while he was getting his tire fixed. He was really nice and told me about his restaurant and I told him I would check it out. I am really glad I stumbled upon this place. Will come again. He also owns an all you can eat sushi place across the street I am looking forward to eating at.

CodBfeaalTABucA7X2cWsQ.text: Went to Tofu Hut for the first time with some friends and we absolutely loved it! Food was great and price  of $16.99 is good for AYCE. However, im only giving 4 stars because it seems like since they include the gratuity on your check ($4.05) they don't pay much attention on customer service. We did have to ask a few times for refills which included my friend getting out of his seat to find the server.

-tUvMFR2RtSepTgVnC7Q_w.text: First of, the food is delicious. I recommend the bulgogi. I can eat and bbq at my leisure with the all you can eat. Despite that it's busy anytime, it's understaffed with two waiters running around like crazy, taking care of 7 BBQ tables and another (maybe) 7 tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid &amp; brisket
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat ;)

lSVCEhN0geQF9d7QLRpnfA.text: Went here last night with my BF despite the bad reviews that were posted over two years ago... and I must say it was a lot better than I expected.    First, we sat down and the waitress served us two bowls of salad, I'm not sure if the salad dressing is store bought or homemade, but it was pretty tasty and the salad was fresh and crisp.   Then came the side dishes/appetizers and we got quite a few, 9 dishes. most were really yummy except for the potato salad (?) it looked like a scoop of ice cream, ha.   Finally our main dishes came, Kimchi Beef Tofu + Bulgogi and the BF and I really enjoyed it, it was perfect for the chilly weather outside. The tofu soup was flavorful and they didn't skimp on the beef, unlike other places. The bulgogi was really well marinated and yummy too.   Also, the prices are very reasonable. $30.00 for two tofu soups + bulgogi + side dishes and drinks.   We will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. our tofu soups, bulgogi and 9 side dishes

puNhZn9E-BYZpZszZC1UtA.text: I stopped in on Sunday for some Sundubu, so I can't comment on the BBQ.   The Banchan was good, and the service was quick.  I especially like the egg being cracked into my scalding hot soup by the server, it was dinner and a show.   My qualm is that I noticed something gritty in my Beef and Kimchi Sundubu.  It tasted fine, but the crunch was an unwelcomed surprise.    I would come back to try the BBQ, but there's better tofu soup in the area.

p5Ri2Sp8x9nSLEYcX1ARaQ.text: I love the food at this place but the service definitely sucks! We got here before a large group came in. We got seated, but the server took orders from the larger group first. Come on, we got here first. We waited for another 10 mins but still nobody came to us. We don't even have anything on our table. The other server didn't even care, he started to clean the other table. We got pissed because we are so hungry and we didn't even got serve at all. We finally left. Now, I don't know if I will come back at this place. But If I do, I want better service.

m2yUf7IOjmgpmZELcLS5RQ.text: So my mission for an AYCE Korean barbecue restaurant in Las Vegas has finally come to an end! Last night I started feeling a grumble in my tummy and I knew that I was hungry. I wanted to try a new restaurant but wasn't too sure where I could go at 10 pm on a Thursday night. I needed both a place  that could fill my food standards and my hunger. I had heard a lot about Tofu Hut so decided to give it a try.  Once arriving at the restaurant, the server was very prompt in seating us and taking our order. The Banchan came out just a few moments after. Most were different from the other Korean Barbecue restaurants I have been to, but they were all very tasty. My favorite of the dishes was the Oi Sobeagi, also known as cucumber kimchi. It had the right amount of spicy and wasn't too overwhelming like others I have had before.   The meat was all very flavorful and delicious. We ate the brisket and marinated beef mostly. For all you Samgyeopsal (pork belly) lovers out there, I recommend ordering it marinated. It adds a little more flavor to the pork belly making it even more delicious.   My only complaint is that they did not have the usual dipping sauce that is served at most Korean Barbeque places. The sauce the did have was unique, but not my favorite.  Recommendation: They have a special there from 10 pm - 2 am where you can get AYCE for $13.99, instead of the usual $16.99! I recommend going around that time to save a few dollars.

54MCWoyf6FtdGRSGgZ8DIQ.text: Not all that great but it's just so cheap. Of the stuff we ordered, my least favorite would have to be the marinated rib-eye. The marinade was pretty bad. I also would not reorder the marinated pork belly, as that's cut into strand like pieces, not large thick slices like the regular pork belly. Speaking of the pork belly, not as thick as I like that other places do. The first round of brisket we ordered was good. The second round however was cut so thin that it just kept flaking apart as we tried cooking it. Picking up shreds of meat is not a fun way to eat. This was probably related to the service.  So speaking of the service, it wasn't that bad if you consider they were seriously understaffed. Every BBQ-able table was filled up, which is a little more than half the restaurant. As far as I could tell, there was one server and one person working the kitchen.  The orders of meat usually come out in pretty small quantities on a small plate too. Don't know why they did that while being understaffed. The salad mix they give you on the side is delicious, probably my favorite Korean BBQ salad anywhere.  Eventually we stopped eating because: 1. it took so long to get our next order of meat and more salad (I think they ran out and kept having to make more) and 2. the grill was so small that it was hard for everyone to keep eating at a good pace.  Even with all the negative comments, I'd still give it 3 stars because it's decent and so affordable.

lQs5ABslrV4sfz6mgeGm_A.text: All you can eat BBQ! The steamed egg was the best dish. The marinated foods were really sweet.

zVuGIRAhcA3YqTSyDyieuQ.text: Great place if your on a budget. If you go after 10pm it's AYCE for $13.99. Except for short ribs which you can get for $16.99.  Also, has to be a minimum of 2 people for this price. Kim chi soup had no flavor and very bland.The meats are very good except for the pork belly. Looooong wait. Overall, if you come on a weekday it's not so bad.  Pros: Price, Service, Meat Cons: Kim chi soup, Wait

mVCAV9HQXNzAa5HyF8_kZg.text: This place is great. It's always busy but they  don't have a reservation system and very few tables for the AYCE so you will have to wait for a while, but it's definitely worth it. They have the best marinated pork belly I've found so far. It's also very reasonably priced. Grill your hearts out.

asmfKpKyYQ7BNEdKR_NvvA.text: We gave Tofu Hut a try today after being recommended. This is the absolute worst AYCE KBBQ ever. Place is dirty, servers are rude, the entrance hallway smells like piss. their sides were weak, no ponzu sauce. I researched and found out Tofu Hut was shut down by SNDH inspection a few years ago, with 52 demerits. Among the violations, employees not properly washing their hands, spoiled food, food unprotected from potential contamination, ineffective pest control measures and more. Just google 'tofu hut dirty' and you'll see. Can't believe this place is still open. I will report them to SNDH and hopefully this place won't stay open for long. God this place is trash!!!

BnSXx_a3wkh4OQJFqjE-uw.text: Our go to whenever we have a basic craving for yakiniku meats!  If you've been to a restaurant on Spring Mountain during peak dinner hours, you'll know that parking is scarce and lines to wait can be cumbersome because of seating and because Asians love to eat in large groups for some reason. I know this, because I am Asian and I love eating with the entire fam bam.  Tofu hut is perfect if you want your basic yakiniku meats. It's also awesome if you and your party arrive right before 6pm because they can usually seat you right away. Otherwise, there is a list you sign in on and a small bench you can sit on to wait. Oh and I highly advise that you listen very carefully because there was one time that my party was waiting for 45 minutes till we noticed other parties were being seated before us because we were bypassed. The hostess said she called our name and no one responded. I'm sure one of the five of us who were waiting on the bench would've heard it.  The women's restroom in this establishment isn't that bad, usually well stocked and clean. I always wash my hands before we get our meats so I've visited the restroom over 7 times already.  We've never had any alcohol here before, but there is a small list of available beers and soju available on the back of the menu. The sides are mediocre, I only really eat the kimchi and the salad...I love the salad. The only meat I don't really enjoy cooking and eating is the ribeye, it's not like a steak or something...expect shredded meat instead. Everything else is great, even the squid which I enjoy. My kids love brisket, tongue, and pork belly. We don't ever get chicken so I'm not sure if they even have chicken available and what it would look like. They could use some soy sauce and hot sauce on the table but if you need it they're happy to provide it when asked. They have kids rates. So kids aren't free depending on age but it's not that bad because some places will charge you half the adult rate for a 3yr old which is kind of ridiculous given that the average 3yr old doesn't eat everything you feed them and is way to fascinated with all the cooking action that's going on to even think of eating.  Five stars because I've always had a great experience here with my family even after that whole wait list mix up.

IUGQ-12mK_Z0T7VnabfKig.text: All you can eat lunch buffet was great. The salad was amazing, I think we refilled 3 times on the salad. They are also very attentive to refill the banchan sides when you run out. Beer selection was few but it didn't matter to me because I was there to eat. We will definitely be back next time we visit Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly my ultimate fave

fxAevbTbWkWmddLK_5B-Yg.text: Came here to TRY it because my friend really wanted me to, keep in mind, I'm very picky with food and Korean food never looked interesting to me.  BUT for a first experience, it wasn't that good but wasn't bad either. I didn't like any of the food, the chicken spicy thigh was the alright one of them all. But my rating won't be based on the food since I didn't really eat anything.   The service there was friendly but then they stop after being there for a couple minutes, eventually they did bring out the things we asked for, but it took a while to do so. They seemed to take better care of everyone else.   I don't like the fact that if we "over order" the food we will be charged for it.  Also, I think HAVING to be basically forced to leave a tip is ridiculous. I think you should earn the tip; you shouldn't be forced to have to leave one, they just make it part of the bill. Cause then they don't even need to be nice cause they're getting a tip regardless.   Also, if we are spending $16.99 PER PERSON already, for an ALL YOU CAN EAT I think drinks should be included rather than being overpriced. The total was not worth it in my opinion. Never coming back, because of the service and cause I just don't like Korean food.. sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n9cAfEYpJmayYb2XEsYBfw.text: After a long day of driving and site seeing my niece suggested Tofu Hut.  Decent. Always busy. Decent price.

2GB8S06xxucr2OPJGNQc-g.text: I've been to tofu hut quite a few times now.   I'm not going to tell you that it is the best kbbq in town.  But what I will tell you is that it is a great value.    Maybe they don't have the best cuts of meat, maybe the selection is small, maybe the banchan isn't that great but for under $17 for all you can eat this place certainly satisfies the craving for Korean barbeque.     I would suggest their kalbi and and their steamed egg.  Almost always delicious even if sometimes it's a miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tongue, spicy pork, kalbi
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan

8hvqcXWIQoTly65bfFJw-A.text: Took family this time and it's a different experience when it's not busy. Definitely worth the price and their salad is always so fresh and tasty. Customer service is great and my sister was so glad she came

B75kTuCmH06WaNpH7NLN-A.text: One of my favorite Korean restaurant. It offers AYCE Korean bbq for only $16.99 or you can sit down on the regular dine in side if you're craving some yummy tofu soup. Sometimes I just want protein, so I like coming here for the AYCE bbq. I don't care about all the fancy appetizers and side items, except for the steamed egg, gotta have my steamed egg. Tofu Hut has the best beef tongue! I've had some chewy and gamey beef tongue before but it's always perfect at Tofu Hut.

j9vuhajgPp0yLt8L_T4OTQ.text: Cheap , a small place but affordable Korean BBQ ... I've been here couple of times with my kids and hubby always at late nights

8YyKy5DAliepJ6_Z_Sc-Mw.text: Yo. Amazing.   I can see where it would be busy. I can see where it gets hot. I can see where the servers would be spread thin at times.   Bottom line, this place is phenomenal. The Korean BBQ was too 5 best meals of my life.   We stuck to the beef mostly, the short rib was unreal. Loved all the side dishes to try, pancake is amazing and I adore the kimchi. We will be back when we are in town.   Just prepare to be hot and wait a little and you'll be fine

6ZVPQu5qWxLYPEl4E_80iA.text: Clean little dive. I didn't do the Korean BBQ and that side was super busy. I'm probably not a great judge because Tofu is not my first pick. It was an experience but I wouldn't return.

V6RRG65MOFMVctV4cT9sWQ.text: Man, I can't remember having soondubu this bad in quite a long time. I've been spoiled with really good soondubu in LA (Ktown) and Orange County, but this place is just a disgrace to Korean cuisine. My wife and I ordered the exact same mixed soondubu spicy, and yet, hers tasted burnt and mine was just straight up terrible. It was bland and tasted like tap water. Wtf. The banchan, especially the japchae, looked like it was saved since the Josean era. It was as bad as it looked, dry as a MF. Rice didn't come in a stone pot, and when we asked the server why it didn't, she said because we didn't ask. Lol smfh.   For a place that's called tofu hut, I ought to kick the tofu out of this hut. Never comin back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One more shot of the nasty soondubu
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The combination soondubu, sad to say, was just terrible.

1jpnPwejQnaiT6P6U7dygA.text: A lot of people really like this place but it really didn't do anything for me. The short ribs are good and the salad is good. I guess it's good for the price you pay but I still prefer to pay a little more to have the things I do like. We did the all you can eat yakiniku (they have the other side which has more options but not ayce style). We came with a party of 11 no reservations so it was a semi long wait. The wait did seem forever because we were starving. We all wanted to sit at 1 table as well instead of being separated (4 of the 11 were children) so we figured we could fit but boy was it a super tight squeeze! I say 9 people is comfortable on their big table, if you go with a party bigger than that be prepared to sit separately. The waiter was pretty attentive and I'm glad he left the pitcher of water close enough for me to grab because I'm one of those people who drink a lot of water and if I wait a long time for it to be filled I start to get annoyed. Parking isn't the greatest. Luckily we went at night when the other businesses are closed but I can image that it's hard to find parking during the day. I'm not positive that I would come to this place again just because of my personal preferences. But if you are hungry and want something that's cheaper/reasonably priced this place is good for you. It wasn't horrible it just wasn't what I was expecting or hoping.

CbfTsXCTLHa3Ko7rkewV5w.text: Great fresh food to cook on a grill  and lots of it. Service is fast. Fun enjoyably place to go with family or friends

09E9gF0xMmGGnsSHGDs56A.text: This place was a bit odd for me. It's a cozy little building off of spring mountain where you cook various meats over the grill your party is seated around. I really like the atmosphere this setup creates, promoting camaraderie and making a fun dining experience. For AYCE you have a selection of chicken/beef/pork/squid to go along with a salad mix and several condiments scattered around the table. Our first batch of meats were actually quite tasty and the salad and condiments were enough of a change of pace to keep things interesting. Unfortunately the second round seemed to drop in quality and became unwanted. The others in my group also noticed the taste and it was a struggle to finish. The steamed egg was a highlight and the price was definitely reasonable. Too bad the second round of meat was underwhelming.

W3rANV_NPosFeR95JTOn8Q.text: Still the best. The wait is long but worth it. Simple Korean bbq that's cheap and open late. There's a lot of Korean bbq that has popped up but we still go to this one or their sister one DoH in the SW.

PAFP2xZ0_eSuatLpCgSR1Q.text: I can't believe I took me so long to write this review. Even though there are more kbbq places now, Tofu hut will always have a special place in my heart. 5 years ago, Tofu hut was my first Korean BBQ experience in Las Vegas.   It does get busy and there can be a long wait. Especially if you are a big party. The service is ok. It depends on how busy they are but they try to get the meat out quick. I remember there was a gentleman that worked there and every time we came in he remembered our order. He doesn't work there anymore though. After 10pm their price is amazing and affordable. But it gets super busy around this time as well.   The meats are ok. We normally get the beef tongue, brisket, short ribs, pork belly, and squid. You do get a lot, which is nice because we don't have to keep ordering. Their salad is AMAZING! It is my favorite out of all the kbbq places I have ate at! It is really the best one. They also offer Korean pancake as a side. I recommend warming it up a little bit on the grill to make it a little firmer. They can also give everyone a steam egg and bean paste soup, unlike other places. Which is nice because I don't have to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tk1rT3_IxjGKju4Wxh0ScA.text: Let me preface this by saying I've been to practically every KBBQ spot in town, so I'm aware of the alternatives. With that said, there's something about Tofu Hut that keeps me coming back (sometimes twice in the same week)!  I've done both sides: AYCE and a la carte, more often recently the latter. We've been coming so frequently that they know my order before they can get me a glass of water. Their bean paste stew with a side of steamed egg is my go-to, especially on cold winter days like today. Funny enough, both of these can be ordered on the AYCE side as well. I prefer their bean paste soup over others' for two reasons: 1) it's always boiling hot when it gets to my table and stays hot, and 2) it's at a preferable spice level. I also swear by their water. There is a magical quality about it that just quenches thirst in a way no other does. The staff is generally on it about refilling your water as well, I swear it's almost as if they've spiked it and are trying to get you to a state of ecstasy. On the AYCE side, the meat isn't exactly premium quality and there isn't a wide selection but you definitely get what you pay for. I normally opt for the brisket and pork belly, and their salad is also my #1 amongst KBBQ salads. This place is also the only KBBQ where I enjoy each and every one of the small side dishes they serve (also refillable and on both sides); most places will have 2 or 3 I won't touch. Overall, Tofu Hut comes in clutch when I'm looking for a relatively cheap KBBQ meal.   There really isn't much I can complain about. The size of the restaurant is small, so wait times can get pretty long for AYCE. But on the other side, seating is almost always instant. I know people complain about certain staff members being cold or rude, but I give them the benefit of the doubt and attribute that to a common Asian feature known as RBF (resting b**** face, which I too suffer from, so I can relate). Another common complaint is that the restaurant could be a little cleaner, but that doesn't stop me from coming back time and again.   All in all, Tofu Hut isn't top notch KBBQ, but it checks all my boxes and I'm perfectly happy with that.

g5TQzjWVly2EzUAAIIyJew.text: Came 20 miles from my house and excited to eat here.  Soon as im ready to check in, the server told me they are close due running out of rice and meat.  And this is only 11:30pm.  They close at 2am.  This is the 2nd time that happened to us when they close early.  Ridiculous!  They need to better their service if they wanna get more customers coz they hve a lot of competition now

6bSVYztgiwGlrUhmNB9XBg.text: So I just broke up today. Driving along the Spring Mountain Rd, feeling sad and seeking some comfort food to make me feel a little better. I stopped by the Tofu Hut and wanted to have some Korean BBQ. I told the waiter I wanted the BBQ. He seated me on a table with no grill on and brought over a menu. I told him I am here for the BBQ and he gave me a very contempt look and told me that they don't ALLOW one person to have all you can eat BBQ. Seriously? Is that even legal to refuse service based on headcount? What if someone just feels like to have some damn Korean BBQ and nobody at the moment can join him? What makes it even better is that after I told him that is what I want to eat he told me to go somewhere else. Are you fXXing serious? Common decency would at least say I am sorry we can't accommodate one person.(even though it is ridiculous). Anyhow, Thank you Tofu Hut, for making my difficult day even harder. I am glad that I did go somewhere else. Way better service and food. I sincerely hope you guys go out of business. Thank you! Tofu Hut!

Uy9nliXGhtW7JFB6yizu8g.text: Fun Korean BBQ place. Not many vegetarian options but you can make it work in a pinch. The steamed egg is awesome.

mvSgclJY8njkw7zzMPWcLQ.text: Tofu hut was the first Korean BBQ place I have been to, so I was excited to try it out! The restaurant is really small and very packed. It's too bad that the restaurant wasn't a little bit bigger, because they could really use it. I am not one to like the ATCE style, as I usually don't eat that much... But this place didn't disappoint.   They brought out banchan and I practically got full off of dipping the fishcakes in the salt & pepper sesame oil. These appetizers are so good! I also really like their steamed egg. Then they brought out the meats and, woah, I thought I was already full. My favorite was the brisket and rib eye. I didn't really care for the chicken.   The only reason I give this place a four star is because of the size of the restaurant and the insane wait times to eat.

D5K8DToIrfYDGHw-uS0AZw.text: My friends and I love this place! We eat here like once a week right after we get off work. Lol. The hours are convenient since it's open until 2 am. You can't beat the AYCE meat and the delicious sides it comes with. The brisket is my fave. The salad is amazing and the steamed egg is phenomenal. Only problem is I wish the place were bigger and had the grills throughout the whole restaurant as opposed to only on one side.  When you're hangry, you tend to be impatient and the wait to be seated takes forever! They should really think about expanding the place or remodeling. They're almost always busy and probably would have even more business.

EkkiWNXbjBk_tX0B-kGJ9A.text: Fridgin awesome Yakiniku type spot with a $17 all you can eat deal on select days/times. Short line and the Banchan was waiting for us right when we got to the table and orders were brought out promptly. Ordered the Shortrib, Sliced Ribeye, Tongue, and Brisket. Yes I know, got beef? Food was solid and satisfying. Five stars all around.

_0a-lSOHK79LGVskMm7w5Q.text: I give Tofu Hut 5/5 because it is my favorite AYCE Korean BBQ in Las Vegas.  The prices are fantastic, $16.99 anytime and $13.99 for late night (10p-2a). I would recommend just ordering the $16.99 whenever you go because you'll be able to get the garan-jjim (steamed egg) which comes out sizzling hot and the kalbi (marinated short ribs).   It's a pretty popular AYCE KBBQ as I don't recall a time I haven't had to wait for a table. There's two sides to the restaurant, one where you can order all you can eat and the other for those who prefer to order off of the menu. I've tried both and am a fan of both, however, I prefer Tofu Hut for the Korean BBQ.   The service is good; they bring you out waters, banchan (Korean side dishes), salad, and take your order shortly after being seated. They give you salt and pepper in sesame oil for dipping sauce but you can also request for the soybean paste or soy sauce and vinegar if you like. There's always plenty of banchan provided, which are very tasty, and the servers happily refill them when requested. I love the salad they give you here... The dressing is amazing and the salad pairs perfectly with the BBQ.   Tofu Hut does not compare to the Korean BBQs in LA, but for Vegas... It is definitely the place to go for AYCE KBBQ. 5 stars for me and highly recommended!

mcmY6WJ4g_VABw47NWjMPg.text: Great place for all you can eat Korean BBQ. Just wish they serve plain lettuce for wraps. Their salad is delicious and flavorful meats!

Mroy8FNxJBJhO1AiH4hxvQ.text: My cousin and I decided to mark our calendars for an afternoon brunch at a Korean BBQ. This place was recommended - and what a great recommendation.  The place was small but had a nice quaint decor. The place was very clean as well.  I'm a huge fan of Yakiniku places and I think I'm a fan of Tofu Hut.  From the array of small Kim Chee dishes to the nicely cute and marinated meats, even the simple salad with the very addiction asian vinaigrette gave the complete that final touch.  The waiter was always checking on our table to replenish at the appropriate times - never imposing or to often to be a bother.  The price was just right for a place like this.  Unlike most Korean BBQ buffets, the food is brought to the table in portions and to as much as your liking, wherein in other buffets, the food and meats are often exposed at the mercy of the dining patrons.  #IsThatSanitary?  Stop by for lunch, bring a friend or two, and enjoy some good food & good conversation.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi :)
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This salad has an amazing dressing - I think this was our third helping!
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Job Chae :)

qf25ws75JaPDtG2WKXFKAg.text: Yay!  I'm a fan!  Looking for an AYCE BBQ joint in Vegas (Have not been going to my usual favorite "Sura Buffet" due to it's price)  Decided to give Tofu Hut a try...    Overall experience:  For $16.99, you pretty much get all the necessary meats available ranging from brisket thru short ribs...  Many places in LA offers different price points for different cuts of meat, but in the end, don't we all just get the same meat every single time?  This place serve it just right!  Oh yeah, they also have steamed egg as well... need I say more?  Pros:   Parking Meat selection No Hassle Efficient staff  Cons: Small restaurant Limited servers Limited seating area for AYCE KBBQ Potentially a long wait  Will I go back here? You betcha!  Great food, awesome Steamed Egg, easy parking, and decent pricing make this place my new go-to KBBQ joints in Vegas!

hgLi7vhdCusFEGd7OsoUvA.text: Still one of my favorites grill your own Korean barbecue spot. Always expect to have a little bit of wait time as this venue isn't that large. For under $20 (even cheaper after 10pm), it is all you can eat. It comes with the Korean side dishes, Salad, and of course rice. Their meat selection isn't that big but for the price, it's not bad at all. I love their briskets because it is probably one of the fastest to cook. Their squid is also really good, just takes a little long to cook. Marinated chicken is really good but I think it's a bit too salty. They're pen until 2am and the last seating is supposed to be at 12:50 but I've seen them turn away customers before 12:50. I highly recommend this place if you don't mind grilling your own food. Under the tables, the grill can get very hot. I didn't know this but I learned it the hard way last night. so be very careful. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs and pork belly
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bancha
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bancha

xMit9Aap4fzJwAZOWntxsQ.text: I love this place. Cheap, good service. They have a very limited menu but all the core selections for a Korean BBQ are available. Only downside is the wait is typically very long.

0KttynpePGMBP567OQ6tZQ.text: If you are look for a good place to eat at Vegas and it is after 10:00PM this is the place to go. You would want to come with an empty stomach since this place is a All You Can Eat Korean BBQ. I dare you to come out of this place not smelling like Korean BBQ. So if you plan to go to a party after you might wanna bring a change of clothes. If this is your first time trying Korean BBQ let me tell you that the smell will linger on your clothes and hair.   This is an AYCE location starting at 10:00pm-2:00am and it only cost $18-20 depending on the tipping amount. This is a great deal since NYC prices are outrageous of this type of food. Along with the Korean BBQ meat that you order it comes with Banchan. Banchan are small tradition Korean side dishes such as kimchee, bean sprout, fish cake, pancake etc. If these dishes run out you can always ask for more. I am used to my basket of fresh lettuce but instead they served chop lettuce with some dressing. This is a complete shock to me, maybe the basket of fresh lettuce is a NYC thing. The basket of fresh lettuce here is served like a salad with a fresh sesame dressing.   I will recommend  this brisket, marinated pork belly and sliced sliced rib-eye. I will stay away from the squid because it comes really elastic when it is cooked. The marinated pork belly was my favorite because it comes with so much favor. Keep in mind that this place does not change the Korean BBQ grill. Since the pork belly is marinated the grill turns black quicker and they will not replace it until you finish the dinner.   The restaurant is split into two parts. When you walk in the left side is for Korean BBQ quest. They have 6 tables that can seat 4 people each and 3 long table that can hold at least 8 individuals. The right side are for guest who do not want to eat Korean BBQ but just want Korean food.   The only reason this place lost a star is because of service and the wait. I came at 10:03pm and had to wait for an hour to get seated. The service is slow and they seem like zombies. When the table before us finish eating it took 10 minutes to clean the table and when the table was clean the waitress did not call us until another 10 minutes has passed. So the turn around rate for the table is around 20 minutes because they lack the help. Since only two people are working it takes a lot longer for wait and the meat to come out. If they hired more help this place would have earn five stars.   Hint: When you walk in place your name, time you came in and number in your party on that sheet of paper near the door. This place get pack after 10:15pm!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the sides
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Grill

2SY7TqCPFKILQ8UEZKhlQQ.text: i will definitely come back and will recommend this place. price is right for all you can eat korean bbq... i can't wait to come back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good times!

0GWHd1zkGvNPsKdLsvTruQ.text: Once in, we got seated at the non-BBQ section and then they changed their minds and decided to seat us at the BBQ side, which we had to wait 10 min to get seated. Once seated on the BBQ side, our waitress then move us back to the Non-BBQ side. Huh??  We got seated, and the waitress brought is 3 glasses of water and disappeared. I had to go to the front desk to ask for menus... Then she took our order and another 20 min later, we were waving our hands to get the waitress's attention, but they walked past us at least 5 times. We finally got our ban chan after the 20 minute mission of trying to get her attention. 10 minutes after that, our food came.  I ordered the mushroom soondubu, which was basically all tofu. I counted exactly three mushrooms... I had to take half of the tofu out of the soup but it was still just tofu. Don't get me wrong, I am a big fan of tofu, but I thought I ordered tofu SOUP.. Not just tofu.  My friend ordered kimchi jjigae, which was ok.. You can't really go wrong with the simplest Korean dish. She also ordered chadol (beef brisket), which was over-cooked and chewy, so we sent it back.   My other friend ordered dwenjang jjigae, which was alright, but didn't really taste like dwenjang jjigae.   Next we asked our server for some napkins, and he brings us one napkin... Lol is this some kind of joke?!  I didn't expect to eat amazing Korean food in Vegas, but I didn't expect the food to be so foul. Horrible food. Horrible service. I vow to never step foot in Tofu Hut.. More like unappetizing tofu cardboard box.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Is this dwenjang jjigae?!
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi jjigae
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom soondubu.. Way too much tofu.. 3 mushrooms.. Barely any soup

gzcCLQ3X0DZmfRfGjNckmQ.text: I do like this place. Been hitting it up for months during the happy hour. It's open late, the all-you-can eat price is very reasonable. The staff seem tired and sad a lot of the time, but they are friendly and attentive.  I recommend the marinated beef. It's the best thing on the menu, imo. Cooking right at the table is a really nice way to keep the conversation flowing with friends. There are only a few things I would change. And if Mr Tofu is reading this review, I hope he'll consider these points constructive criticism.   First, the televisions are kind of weird. Always playing some tacky Korean music videos with the sound off... I think televisions generally give the place a tacky feel, but if you're going to have them then let us hear what we're watching. Better imo to take them out and just have some music at a low volume going.  Second, the lighting and atmosphere doesn't feel warm. It feels too bright... too much like a cafeteria and not really some place that feels warm and inviting. I think the place could really benefit from spending some money on an interior designer.   Finally, I think they should color code the tongs for placing and removing the meat on your grill. Maybe I'm being too much of a clean freak, but it seems to me you shouldn't be using the same tongs to remove the cooked food that just came into contact with raw pork. It would be nice if they had like a color-coded system that they explained to you when you sat down. Red tongs for placing on the grill, green tongs for picking it up and putting on your plate. Something like that... you can take precautions on your own and try to keep one set of tongs for the raw meat and another for the cooked meat. But it's way too easy to mix them up... and I fear that someone is going to get sick.  Overall... this place is a real hidden gem and I'm happy to have it here in Vegas. I'll be coming back over and over for the next several years and will be sharing the experience with a lot of my friends.

Jyr4wH0VznbcKsHG7FMrTQ.text: There was a line so I knew this place was going to be amazing!  My GUT instinct proved me right. The wait was very minimal we had a group of 7. Got seated and it was straight to business the sides, meats and service flowed.. If you have friends or want to broaden your international cuisine palate I suggest this place. Authentic, satiating and enjoyable is what you can expect at tofu hut. ***Get the beef tongue for your adventurous eater it's Amazing****

Txf9nA5c7naMNN_XanACtQ.text: This place is bomb, i always get the all you can eat and it is worth it every time. Great food, great service, and i love cooking ny own meet at my table

RTz_MOmmuS9_sJKowPM4kw.text: I just ate here yesterday and I enjoyed it! I read the reviews on here and decided to go around 3pm to avoid rush time, we were the only ones besides another table in the restaurant so there was no problem with service; however, our server seemed a little spacy and forgot to re-light our grill after we asked a couple times when the flame went out.  We ordered short ribs which were tender and tasty, I also ordered squid which was okay but hey it's just plain squid so it's okay.  The ribeye was tender and I enjoyed the texture. You get to cook the food yourself so it's up to you how long you want to cook it so no waiting and waiting and waiting for it to come out. The sides went great with the meat as we had white rice, kimchi, salad, and some kind of clear sauce to dip the meat in which actually improved the taste, I should have asked what it is but I didn't bother. I would recommend coming early to avoid rush time as I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs

y9czI23d6aJVnOgtELHNpw.text: This is a great korean BBQ ! The only downside is that only half of the restaurant is korean BBQ, the other is just normal table service. Great flavor and the staff is super attentive. Try the marinaded beef!

Z-5LI8Po6T8HCmXo4teq5Q.text: A La Carte menu: I've been to Tofu Hut plenty of times before and no other Korean place I've went to had tofu soup comparable to this place. Sometimes salty, but nonetheless distinctive. I usually order the Bulgogi combination and Short Rib combination which are about $13-14 each including soups and sides. For the price, the food is quite a bit and enough to get a group of three to four full which is great. I tend to finish up the sides too. Rice cake, noodles, spiced cucumbers, kimchi, beans sprouts-yummy.  Downsides?: Bulgogi was overcooked this time I went... not too much of a biggie because the short ribs were perfect. The biggie was customer service. When I asked one of the employees politely for a refill of a side, she walked right past me without acknowledging me, then returned later just taking the dish without saying anything or looking at me. She quickly came back with a refill but I found it rather rude not being acknowledged at all...as if I wasn't there. Not cool. Overall, service is inconsistent every time I head here. Depends on server of course, but everyone on Yelp knows I love friendly people and tip generously for it. For Tofu hut, I realized not to expect much from staff anymore.  I like eating here for quick fix Korean. If it wasn't for my affinity towards the soup here, I'd prefer the ambiance and experience at Soyo (located Rainbow Blvd/Warm Springs)

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch bulgogi combo and short ribs combo

WsC81FeSI9uAK5BdCrUgCw.text: This is my favorite KBQ place here in LV . The price is amazing for AYCE and not only that the staff gives the nicest service I've ever had . My boyfriend and I go here probably 2-3 times a month !

beAd_VJxjC2mvXfLYy2CmA.text: I always comes here for Korean Bbq. Price is good, and food is good especially the beef  tongue.. Not much choices but meet are good enough.....I get more than i paid for. Its $12.99 after 10:00 pm...and  $16.99 for before 10:00 pm.... This place is a lot cheaper and the best compare to any other Korean BBQ place..

6Uzzl7U4ZLnCIgBMr2SKmA.text: Great food, it's nice to go out and have varieties and cook it to your liking. The servers are nice as well and brings out the food quickly. It's a great place to take all your friends and family. I recommend tofu hut to everyone.

TN9kvCk7BZ7mCkO8xj4a5w.text: OK, I gotta confess that the best tasting and best priced KBBQs are probably out in LA and southern California (I love BBQ Night in Hawaiian Gardens, CA).  But, for Vegas, this one might be the best!  I like Sura BBQ Buffet too, but too pricey...especially their dinner price.  Other places like Korea Garden BBQ House in Chinatown are just downright horrible.  My brother and I used to come often for the tofu soups years ago, and I always thought Tofu Hut was "good".  But now with their AYCE Korean BBQ for $16.99, it is really, really good...probably an "A-" in my book! (Heck the late night special price of $13.99 is even better!)  I love their meats especially the beef brisket and bulgogi!  My wife (She's Korean and I'm half Korean) likes the pork belly too.  The banchan side dishes...oh and I can't forget their delicious salad...are all pretty good too. But heck, I really want to eat mostly the meats along with a little rice and a little banchan...but definitely the meats are the MAIN focus!  The service is good too and I find the servers definitely more friendly than some other Asian restaurants.  Bottom line...check it out...you won't regret it and you can't beat it for the price and quality for a Las Vegas KBBQ.

1OXat3wjptJUeCz9bguT0w.text: I don't usually write reviews but  what I just saw is beyond nasty! I am not rating the food. I am rating how this place is infested by roaches. I was waiting in the parking at 10:45am to try this place for lunch and saw two Terminx trucks parked in the parking lot. I thought they were waiting to eat there and was waiting for the restaurant to open at 11. But two guys came out with two canister of insecticides and went in the Tofu Hut.  This is so nasty and unhealthy. How can you spray a restaurant a few minutes before people start eating in there. I am grateful that I saw this before I made the mistake of eating in this nasty place. I feel sick after seeing what I saw. I am posting this so other people will know what I saw  before eating there.

EgEagG6bI_Y1_jKtcys4Wg.text: I believe I come here mostly for Korean BBQ, at least out of all the other places, I've been pretty frequent here. The staff are very friendly, I like the one guy (I need to find out his name) who always tells jokes, he's the friendliest of them all.   The prices here are pretty decent, which is probably why they're pretty popular for AYCE KBBQ. $16.99 normally with a late night special of $13.99, but the late night special price doesn't include steamed egg or kalbi, if you want either of those you'll have to pay the regular price.   They bring out the meats as you order and you can only order a max of 3 items per table. Which they have a limited selection of meats, brisket, beef tongue, tripe, pork belly, kalbi, bulgogi, spicy chicken, and a few others. They pick and cut the meats how they want to and bring it out, sometimes I've noticed as I order the same dish, usually brisket and beef tongue, the sizes either get smaller and smaller or the quality of the meat decreases as well.   Rice and salad are included, but I usually wouldn't recommend the rice unless you're getting marinated meat, because you'll fill up on it and eat less meat. =]   They have an al la carte menu which is decent, I usually get it if I'm going in for lunch or late night and just want some tofu soup. They have a variety of tofu soup all at the same priced, slightly more than $8 each. It's a good deal, you also get rice with it. Just don't dump all the rice in at once, otherwise the soup will disappear very quickly!  Oh also, they put the egg in right when they bring it to the table.   I've gotten the spicy chicken and bulgogi from the al la carte menu, don't really remember the pricing, but it wasn't too bad. A friend liked the al la carte menu better because it's cooked on a stove top so the meats retain more of their juices and she found it more flavorful.   Everything you order comes with some side dishes, which include kimchi, seaweed, this type of fish thing (sorry I forgot the name), korean panakes, jap che, and a few others.

anZcfROdxJN_ic2FyxEjrQ.text: This ayce bbq place is average. Good price for good food, nothing great. The bulgolgi could have had more flavor. Service was ok but since it was busy it was hard to flag down the two servers when we needed things.   The AYCE is $18.30 per person with tax   I did see that they did have a special AYCE  price after 10pm for $13something

WhVH0cxH8no6_BN4RrJbwA.text: There is only one Korean BBQ place I go to here in Las Vegas that I really enjoy and it is Tofu Hut. The dumb question I asked, because this is a meat meat meat place, is why is it called Tofu Hut? Well, go in to the non-BBQ portion of the place and you will find out. The average price for AYCE during normal hours is $16.00 and  while late at night, the happy hour (10 PM - 3 AM) is priced at $13.99 which is fantastic.  I always come here with friends and the food is always so delicious. We usually get the beef brisket, beef short ribs and the beef tongue. They are very generous with their portions of meat and they always help you change out the grill when they can see smoke polluting our smiles of indulgence. Not only is the meat delicious, but they provide you with the pleasant company of numerous side dishes and this AMAZING salad that I could practically eat myself, allll by myyyyselllf.   Reviewing a place like this is somewhat tough, because you basically cook your own food. So no complaints on the meat being over or under cooked, that would be my fault if that were the case. I like the judge the place based on the quality of the meat and the cleanliness and this place, as far as I know, has always been really good with that. I've never looked at the meat and thought it wasn't fresh, because the meat is always fresh and marinated to perfection.  The one thing that does prevent this place from the all mighty five stars is the service. Sometimes, I feel as if I'm an inconvenience to the people there. I'm not very needy, but if my grill is full of char, I'm going to request a new grill. You can often see the groans and the impatience, sometimes I'm almost forced out of there because the place is small. But in all honesty, I won't stop coming back to this place. It stays with you... as in you smell of Korean BBQ for the rest of the day until your next shower; which for some us, isn't soon enough.

KJzgUClSnhEDK9OlCI5OjQ.text: Always love coming to this place. Finally did the AYCE and it was pretty good for the price during lunch time. I love the salad that they bring out as well.  Will definitely come back again. This place gets packed though so when it does you cant go wrong with the kimchi soup!!!

E_H6qZh_4NqOvhJAhoNW0g.text: First time having KBBQ in Las Vegas (I'm from LA) and I was very impressed. Everything was so good so deliberation on what to get shouldn't be too hard. Only drawback I have about the place was the long wait, but granted, it was a Friday night so that's expected. Also the lobby, sitting area is very small, resulting in a lot of standing. Wish they would expand the place, but overall it's pretty good.

0EzGe6W7v-Zmzl_iK6IIGA.text: We went there last night around 12:30am. Tofu Hut was open for another hour and a half. Two families of 6 were seated and immediately after the lady working there told us we were not welcome to eat there after we've already waited 15 minutes to eat.  I'm not sure why exactly we were profiled and there were several open tables.

j426ZJHQ2Z02ZWolmxDN-Q.text: Went here with married friends.  We sat at a table with four other people in a separate party, but it didn't feel crowded. It was loud, and we had a 30 minute wait on a Monday night. Before the meat escapade, we had kimchi, rice, fish cakes, bean sprouts, etc. We had to turn our grill up when we noticed the meat was cooking slowly. We had brisket, ribeye, squid, beef tongue, and pork belly.  You can put the entire slab of meat on the grill, or cut it with meat shears and cook more of a variety.  I will say the pork belly was very easy to cook  that great sear to carmelize it, and was favorite.  We also had the bean soup which was good. The salad was the best part in my opinion, considering I'm not much of a meat eater.  The price was great for how much food you can eat (endless meats).  Servers were responsive, though you do have to engage them for the most part, though not unfriendly, as others have said--just don't expect to be catered to.  What you should expect, however, is to leave smelling like BBQ.

KryMVxns3_KJd9hk9uxxfA.text: Contrary to the name... This place offers limited tofu/Veg options.  The service was mediocre and bland. We were never acknowledged when we entered, no one checked to see how the food was....  We left feeling empty....  Both in service and quality

tT4CYHWYdRZ4_HXY5PFNJw.text: This is my go to AYCE Korean BBQ. Their meat is nicely marinated, their steamed egg is just delicious. We usually get the brisket and pork belly because the others are kind of ehh.   I have a love/hate relationship with the service though. They're super nice, but sometimes they completely forget that we're there even when it isn't busy.  Overall the price you pay for the AYCE is pretty good.

p8pfYWKcL5OtMZ7Oj8Q0PA.text: Great food. Just can't get behind the idea of paying that much to cook my own dinner.

cGbABOl314MCskG25fJBCg.text: Went here once on a lunch with my co-workers, one of whom was Korean, and admittedly, his rapid, off-menu orders in korean probably helped make this lunch extra delicious. But I mean, it was already delicious.   We totally went for the Korean Barbeque, and I can in no way speak to the quality of the tofu.  The restaurant was clean, smelled wonderful from the moment you walked in, and the staff was all courteous, prompt without being lingery, and polite, even to those of us at the table that had a fairly difficult time pronouncing some of the korean dishes.  Four of us had the all you can eat, beef shortribs, of which I ate an entire plate all on my fat little lonesome, beef tongue, and beef brisket. Because cows sliced as thinly as loose-leaf paper and then cooked on fire are delicious. I think we went through about 3 orders of each. We also had 2 steamed egg thingies, which were wonderful, and some sort of spicy-savory red bean condiment paste thing I didn't catch the name of.  Pros:  - The classic bite of salad-bite of rice- chunk of meat combo is just so salty-savory-umami wonderful, It's absolutely cravable. I've never had a preparation of the salad the way tofu hut does it, and it was awesome. - Beef tongue. - Clean restaurant, awesome wait staff - Really reasonable prices - I, the whitest person alive, was not offered a fork, since it was clear I had the chopstick thang down.   Cons: - The atmosphere came off a little bit on the cafeteria side, which is not my favorite, but...eh, also the least important thing to me.  - The proximity of tofu.  Verdict: I will totally be back, though probably not ever for anything related to tofu.

6K7Ix6YkWSpThx7trLKMdQ.text: Good Korean BBQ place. A bit less expensive than others... I like their sreamed egg, bigger serving. My family enjoys good eats, and they surely enjoyed this place...

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double date with my 2 Precious... :)

W7esIX5d9msQ7_SUjVjCkQ.text: Yes, they had their tv turned to some show on surgery that had blood and guts everywhere, but I thought it was pretty funny.   I really liked this place a lot and having 14.99 ayce kbbq was a definite plus.   The salad was delicious, we had about 4 or 5 refills on it. The meat was tasty, especially the rib eye. The sides went together perfectly. We hardly had to ask for refills cuz they were totally on it. They even gave us our own water pitcher so we'd never run out.   I liked that this place wasn't so packed when we went. There were just a couple groups of very wasted people that made for fun entertainment.  I definitely want to come back here. Next time I know not to sit in the direction of all smoke though!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kihDjrEbyMJPPKRcJ6DJxA.text: BLEH!!!!!! This place ain't what it used to be.  I'm sure no actual Korean people come and eat here. At least for sundubu that is. It tasted bland, there were no good flavors, the banchan was horrible. What a lifeless drab of a meal. On top of that, the bill wasn't even that affordable.  I think they're just kept busy because of tradition. This is one of the oldest Korean tofu houses in Las Vegas, and people have come to recognize it. PEOPLE --- I implore you to expand your horizons and venture to new places. Try Mr. Tofu literally across the street. That'll be a step in the right direction.

J9oR_DiskCbaYmDhMHa6Gg.text: I forgot that Mr. Tofu was closed on Sundays and my sundubu craving had to be pacified so we made our way across the street to Tofu Hut.  Half of the restaurant have stovetop tables reserved for patrons having the AYCE korean barbecue, while the other half of the restaurant has tables for the tofu eating patrons.  Although the bbq smelled enticing, I was there for one reason and one reason only: sundubu.   I ordered my go-to: the mushroom sundubu.  The menu described it as having 3 different kinds of mushrooms, but I can guarantee that I only saw 1 type in there.  The enoki and the oyster mushrooms were no where to be seen.  And on top of that I ordered "medium" spice level, and there was no heat at all.  Nor was there any flavor.  I poured the entire kimchee side dish and some bulgogi into the soup in order to create an edible bowl.  Only after those measures, did I start to enjoy my sundubu.  However, it wasn't my original order.    My husband seemed to enjoy his kimchi sundubu, but the "spicy" level, tasted more "medium".  So be warned, that you may have to order a higher spice level just to get some heat.  The bulgogi was very flavorful, and the banchan was not my favorite. My kids, however, devoured the korean pancakes, although they are a lot thicker than I am used to.    And I don't understand why almost every korean restaurant that we dine at, there is only one server.  Poor guy is running around like a chicken with his head cut off.  He was trying his best to meet everyone's needs, but we had to wait a while for extra napkins, extra chopsticks after my son threw them on the floor, and water refills. And then we waited a while to pay our bill.

-Bn7bDE9N-wwo5nQObaRFQ.text: This place gets my vote for the worst KBBQ experience ever. The meats were awful and poor quality. Also worth mentioning is their horrible banchan. It was not fresh nor did it taste good. I usually ask for seconds or thirds when it comes to banchan too. It made me really miss the L.A. KBBQ joints. The soon tofu was extremely, uncomfortable spicy! It gave me really bad heartburn. I can handle spicy food too.

h01g5mTuEMpvxrhkbe2xnQ.text: I come here for the AYCE KBBQ. The meat here is better than most KBBQ place in Vegas for almost half the price.  They don't have much of a side order selection but the salad and the sides that come with the meal is good.  The only problem is that half the restaurant is for KBBQ so seating is very limited and it can take very long to get a table when it's busy.  The service is decent.  A server will come around now and then and ask if you want to order more but its hard to get their attention when they are  running around.

17saZQdDqxn4AMbFmCyxKg.text: I like this restaurant.  The Spicy Tofu soup is amazing, I haven't been able to find better in town.  I always go for lunch as I think it is a little pricey, and the service isnt the best.

ZlTh9os0o8d2G5kxW5MSkg.text: Hello Tofu Hut, it was so nice to meet you!   Checked out this place and became a fan because hello all you can eat Korean BBQ. Heck yes! Tried it out and became it was love at first bite!  My bf, coworker and I ate here and whoa we were satisfied after. So we got the all you can eat BBQ which was $16.99 per person for dinner. They do have lunch too for only $14.99! There were about 10 different meats that you can choose from. We ordered sliced ribeye, beef tongue (totally not a fan of it), brisket (oh so tasty), and tripe (it was weird). We totally killed it!   The service was okay, kind of forgot our rice until we mentioned it again but then again 3 people working on a Friday night umm yea that should explain it. But they checked up on us a few times so yay!   If your not an all you can eat person and don't like to cook your own meat then they do offer another menu, but it is totally worth doing the all you can eat.

ejoVQo0XfNYoHD5FCoiP1Q.text: We came here on a Sunday. AYCE dinner is $16.99. All the marinated meat was on the salty side. No dipping sauces other than salt and sesame oil. I miss my ponzu sauce! The brisket was very fatty and the squid not marinated at all. Over all experience wasn't that great. We had to drink a ton of water after dinner due to the saltiness of the meat. Sura Buffet which is located a block away beats this place for sure!

MDJ2CaX4ZXNF-QokjcCBKg.text: My family and I have always wanted to try Tofu Hut, and most of the time we stop by they are always busy with a long waiting list. Sounds like a pretty good place to have AYCE Korean BBQ right!?. We came for lunch and tried the AYCE BBQ. My first impression of the sided dishes were just ok, nothing to rave about. We ordered the brisket, chicken, marinated ribeye, and the marinated pork belly. The brisket and chicken were not marinated so it tasted like brisket and regular chicken. The marinated ribeye was very sweet and the marinated pork belly a little salty with a small kick of heat. The dipping sauce was generally oil/salt/pepper yet nothing to brag about. The service was ok and the restaurant seemed clean. I went to pay the bill and we were charged $18.95/ adult and $9.50 for our 5 year old. The menu stated $16.99/ adult so I was a little disappointed.The salad was the best part of our meal, but I would not return for just the salad. I would recommend Korean Garden a block down the street. They have a less meat selections, but the cost is $15.99 for the "Vegas" and you can get extra selections for $19.99.

1ezpH-EBCZqVYpoAC0Q-mA.text: When I want a delicious, fulfilling and cheap meal, I alway come here. The only thing I always get is the seafood tofu soup. It cost 8.95 for hearty portion along with 7-8 other side dishes. They even refill it when you're done with one of the dish.   Now do I call that a deal or what? :)

rX5q1Tb6m0es3q-gHOSJDA.text: Steamed Egg Goodness!!!  Any way we arrived at 11:30PM for AYCE BBQ it's $13.99 from 11PM -5AM or you can pay full-price $16.99 (10AM-11PM) if you want the short ribs and steamed egg after 11.   We started with the short ribs, ribeye and marinated pork belly.  Right after we placed our order the sides came out.  The tofu, noddles dish and pancakes were my favorite, everything was great.  When the meat arrived the waiter helped us out by piling the ribeye all together because it cooks juicier and laid out a short rib and the pork belly.   We've never really worked the BBQ before and it must of looked like our first time because they kept coming back to us and moved around the stuff.  Basically its hotter on one side of the grill than the other.    The short ribs were very tasty however I was trying to keep some manners and not rip the meat off the bone lol!  Rib eye and marinated pork belly were also very good but since we didn't really move it around it kinda burned.  For our second order we ordered brisket and pork belly.  The waitress suggested the steamed egg since we were paying full price anyways.  I really thought ... ok I'll try its probably just going to be like an egg topping like with some Thai food.  The brisket came out and was a huge serving and fresh not frozen! the pork belly was equally good and by this time I actually kinda got the hang of cooking.    Now for the gold medal, the steamed egg came and she warned us it was going to be really hot.  I probably waited 2 min. when I took my first bite... OMG I've never had an egg like this before.  I mean I have a whole new outlook on eggs.  We have come to a theory that its an egg steamed with chicken stock with green onions.  Seriously my taste buds were dancing and singing!  The waitress  came back to make sure everything was good and told us to try the beef tongue and squid but we were sooo full.  After about an hour and a half we finished all the meat and some of the sides.  She came back with this Korean drink dessert that was very very sweet! As we paid she told us its only $4 for a pack for 50 at the Asian markets.  Our bill came to $36.60. Totally worth it.  Since we don't have a lot of experience with cooking Korean BBQ,  they get 5 stars from us because they were extremely  helpful and courteous.  The service really could not have been any better! I think we were humoring them while we were trying to cook but it was all in good fun. Our water was always full and all the sides were refilled when asked.  This is probably a place we'll be back during our late night eating binges.

NhaDQmjdVRxok8z3VkPRMw.text: The food is really good and the price is pretty good for all you can eat! However its kinda dirty and small so you would have to wait in a long line if it gets busy.

nzJwU08pltuuTZHA1M8R5Q.text: There is so many amazing things I could say! This is one of my favorite places to eat with friends and family. I love the food and the service is really nice! It takes a long time to get a table, but totally worth it.

vdJeLWljpfmvbQNcFmk9sQ.text: I was a regular here years ago.  Went back a couple times recently...I still like the tofu soup here.  Everything is not too overly priced like most Korean restaurants, but I do find the galbi to be a little too fatty at times.  where's the meat? =) I do like the side dishes her so overall not a bad place to eat.

d9R5JdOMreIALzvVCMN8bw.text: I usually go to the other tofu place across the street, they were closed so i went to tofu hut to check it out. Its a fairly small place with a home like feel to it. My wife and i ordered the beef soondubu spicy and chilled soba  noodles. Lets start off with the banchan.  The banchan was extremely meh....nothing special what so ever. The tofu soup came out first....first of all it wasnt spicy at all, and the soup lacked flavor, pretty bland. About 10 minutes later we received our chilled sona noodle dish. The dish was covered in lettuce, and was overpowered with vinegar.  The dish wasn't very good at all. All in all a very mediocre meal. I was alittle disappointed that the name tofu hut suggests that they specialize in tofu. Yet their tofu soup was absolutely forgettable. I for one wont be returning

bZrW9gHG4Nh8fLMFJlSQ8w.text: This place's best deal would have to be their all you can eat buffet. They have one for dinner after 11 pm, and one for lunch. $16.99 or $13.99 is way cheaper price than some other korean places. I wouldn't recommend the squid because it came as a whole piece and not flavored. You should get the beef flank or marinated beef - those are pretty good. comes with salad bowl. I got the seafood beef tofu soup - not that great. I had it extra-spciy. Basically mean they add more red pepper, but not spicy. And the soup had like clam shell pieces, so I get this random "crunch" sound when I bite. Their appetizers are probably one of the best, if not the best I have in vegas. seaweed, fish/tofu strip, soybean sprouts, kimchi, cucumber, onion pancake (best), clear noodle.

oM0aDturMpyvcoYZmUdXmA.text: horrible service, the line was 20minutes long even though there were open tables. they made us switch seats just because we can't just get one order of meat. they said you're not allowed to order just one plate of meat which makes no sense.

NokrEjPuvWZ-jBaK9mPVqA.text: hmm its been a while since i've been back.  ordered the spicy chicken since i remembered i enjoyed it so much last time. also got the beef tofu soup medium spicy. i ate so much of the spicy chicken and rice among the sides that i didnt get half way through my soup.   i love dark meat when it comes to chicken.. and the spicy chicken is made with dark meat so that explains why i like it so much. i like to put the fish cake in the spicy sauce and let it sit.. soak up the spicy goodness.. yum!  the soup is goooood. and i think it was around $8 .. which is cheap compared to other places back home that can go up to $11 or $12. the soup doesnt get too thick with the egg and had  alot of flavor. the mild version may not be as flavorful.. and the medium spicy isnt overbearing so dont be afraid to order it that spicy!  it was slow this afternoon.. service was very friendly and prompt. waters were refilled and i love the little yogurt drink at the end :)

qaIqhRJEQ_9vAQZixw0dkQ.text: Consistent and open very late. You can choose from the AYCE menu, where you cook on a grill atop your table or you can opt to sit on the other side of the restaurant and choose something from the menu. They're bulgogi is good as are their short ribs, but I always go with one of the tofu soups, usually the kimchi beef. That's my favorite.

sn3qkiAODn5aAUXIT535Kw.text: I am a frequent customer of this place.  My favorite dish is one of the free complementary dishes; chapchae or however you spell it.  The tofu bowl size is a bit small bit but still fills me up.  The spicy BBQ chicken is my other favorite, a bit sweet but so good..
