The price tag is about $10+ per person, or you can order a lunch combo and share with a friend for $14.  The service can be good, depends on who your waitress or waiter is. Overall, I give it two thumbs up.

nLgd_05jgxCRC-mTQKjlhg.text: I had seafood tofu soup n my bf had kalbi...over all food wasn't fresh! I always order medium spicy n it was more like mild to me I thought kalbi was little pricey compare to the portion...I've been to this place before many times n i've noticed since they started making mexicans cooking i didn't really taste that korean food i was craving today :( no wonder this place is empty...don't be lazy n cook it urself n try to keep ur customers with same taste everytime they come!!!

eJam1Rhi3ylIPR2LXMpp5Q.text: In the Bay Area, I noticed a surge of Korean Tofu restaurants popping up.  And those that had been around for awhile, it appeared that they were getting a new surge of customers.  I was damn curious to see what the hype was all about and with a restaurant named "Tofu Hut", I figure it would satisfy my curiosity.  We actually passed another Korean restaurant first, a new one complete with the "Grand Opening" sign up.  I figure we'd try out "Tofu Hut" since it had been in Vegas for awhile and has lasted.  Usually, it's a sign that the business must be doing alright, right?  Wrong.  So, my first mistake was assuming that because it had been in Vegas for awhile, it would be decent.  The second mistake I made was not checking Yelp first to see if anyone had anything about this restaurant.  If I had done this first, I would have seen TWO 1 star reviews with no other good reviews to counteract the two.  If I had done this research first, you would not have seen me eating here.  Walking in for an early Sunday evening dinner, our party of four chose the cooking table with the plan to cook some serious meat.  Instead, we ordered the Kimchee Beef Tofu Soup ($8.36), two orders of Short Ribs BBQ ($12.59 each), and a Kimchee Pot Stew ($8.95).  If you do want to do the table barbecue, it's a minimum two orders to do that.  They brought out a side salad for each person to start and then five banchan (side dishes) to share.  And yes, I said five.  I thought this was a joke - April Fools' Day, haha kind of joke.  No.  I know at some Korean restaurants they give out more banchan to the Koreans, so we even asked for more and they said that's all they had. I thought we were being gypped and looked over at the neighboring table of six Koreans to see if they got more than we did.  No, they did not.  Tofu Hut only gives out five banchan!  Blah!  They were this coleslaw concoction that I have never seen before, cabbage kimchee, fishcake, bean sprouts, and cucumbers.  I'm used to getting 5-10 banchans, you can imagine my shock and disappointment!  When the tofu soup and pot stew arrived, the waitress asked if she wanted her to crack a fresh egg in there.  Sure!  As she passed over my hot tofu soup, she knocked over the BF's water glass.  No big deal, she apologized and cleaned it up.  (I was just glad she didn't drop the hot soup too!)  I had my tofu "spicy" and it was more mild.  There wasn't much taste going on here and I was less than impressed.  I did like the hot stone burnt rice that comes out with my tofu soup though.  My friend's pot stew was more soup-like than she cared for as well.  The only thing really good was the Short Ribs.  We ended up ordering another plate because it was pretty good.  Everything else fell below par.    To close out our meal, the check came.  We asked if they had shikhye, which is a this cold beverage that is usually served at the end of the meal.  It's refreshing after a greasy meal and I'm used to getting this automatically after our meal concludes at Korean restaurants.  They told us they did not have this.  Oh my goodness.  Five banchans and no shikhye?!    Final bill: $70 including tip and tax.  This restaurant is sparse.  Lots of Koreans eating here, but perhaps I just have higher expectations and Tofu Hut doesn't cut it.

SxL3a9sccav5xJCEkLSMxw.text: I was introduced to this place by a friend of mine and it is an all you can eat dine in restaurant but only on the left side. The prices range between $15-18 for the all you can eat. They do not have a menu on this side, they basically just have a list of the meats you can choose from and it is unlimited including the sides. I give the food four-stars, as the food is delicious. I love Korean food and sides! However, I need to give the service three-stars.   The first time I went there it was around 5pm, there was no line and we were seated fairly quickly. We had a lady serving us and she was nice but very hard to flag down. I enjoyed the food there especially the brisket and the sides. I was just not impressed by the service.   The second time we went there, we decided to go to dinner and we brought our friend with us. I made sure to arrive early to get us seats. The all you can eat side was pretty full so I stood by the sign that says, "wait to be seated". No one was behind me at the time so I did not mind waiting. However, another person arrived and spoke to one of the servers. He decided to seat them first which I'm sure would upset a few people. I spoke to him before he seated them and explained that I was clearly standing there first and he should not have sat them before me as I was waiting and was not with their party. My friends arrived soon after he seated that party of three I was not too happy about that. I had a good time otherwise, but I just feel that in order to get more people into the place, the service has to be just as good as the food. If you don't mind good food, but lousy service, you should try this place.

B0KoLvUof5mjV3x2qTu6Ug.text: this is my favorite korean bbq place. sides are good and meat is very tasty compared to the other AYCE korean bbq restaurants. love their brisket, pork belly, and most especially their tripe. we actually eat there for their tripe. love how the tripes are pre-sliced and it cooks to perfection . their salad is also good, very tasty. servers are also not that bad. they also have their late night specials and i like how they're open late until 2am. the only reason i didnt give 5 stars is because of the wait time. the place is pretty small and it gets crowded especially wen there are several people waiting to be seated. i dont get why they dont convert the other half of the restaurant to have bbq grills on the tables as well. i think it's a waste of space since most people go there for their bbq. i think management should consider opening up the other half of the store.

BgNl6h4S2f5J7tgKW0Ep9A.text: My recommendation: The ribs and coffee  I would love to work at tofu hut. The chefs have it so easy here. They leave it up to you to cook your own food. I think that's a cool concept that allows you to cook your meat as rare or well done as you want.   The brisket was so fatty. I felt like I was chewing bubble gum, but the ribs were delicious. They also had this vending machine that gave you about 4 oz. of coffee for 50 cents. I don't even like coffee but I make it a priority to get the milk coffee everytime I come here.  The sides were pretty good. They gave us a large variety to choose from. I liked the tofu dish they served the best.   The customer service was at a bare minumum. The lady came around every once in awhile to refill our water cups but that was about it. She didn't even talk (or smile) while she did it. It was very robotic-like.  The food was very good but I've had better, so that's why I feel the three star rating is appropriate.

n1IBWSbtovEjX4_ap0TAxg.text: Come here with an empty stomach because seriously.... you're going to need all that room for all that damn protein! Oh, and make sure to wear a shirt that you don't mind getting scented on with "pork" and various other meaty aromas.  AYCE Korean BBQ. You know the drill, they bring out plates of raw meat and you cook it at your very own grill. Get the thin cut meats, they cook much faster!   The salad was pretty good and I helped myself to many seconds.   The service was mediocre. They seemed to be a bit short on the wait staff so we practically had to jump up and down to get more meat!   Overall, a nice experience.

P-cKmIoeI7K2v6qf1CetQg.text: It's a cozy family restaurant . Food is better compared to the da Chang Jim nearby .the price is good too.

V1zb5pXMMrdkwaFeNorjMg.text: **Summary**        - Korean BBQ - This review is on the Korean BBQ part of Tofu Hut where you get to cook your own meats and eat them.        - Minimum 2 - To get the AYCE, you have to have at least 2 people getting it.        - Quality - The quality fluctuates. When it's good, it's great. When it's not, it's not you get small pieces that look less than fresh. However, I've never gotten sick yet (cross fingers).        - Price - They're quite a bit cheaper than your average Korean BBQ place. **Price**        - $13.99 AYCE Lunch (Short ribs & Steamed Egg excluded)        - $16.99 AYCE Dinner **Ordered**        - Marinated Sliced Rib eye        - Brisket        - Beef Tongue        - Short Ribs        - Steamed Egg **Notes**        - Korean salad and side dishes are provided at the beginning of the meal.        - The rib eye and short ribs come marinated. They're quite flavorful, but I like to eat them alongside un-marinated meat.        - The brisket and beef tongue are un-marinated and you usually dip them in this sesame oil/salt concoction. If it tastes too plain and they didn't put enough salt, you can ask for more.        - The steamed egg, Korean salad, and side dishes make a nice non-meat compliment to the rest of the food.        - Sometimes the heat from the grill leans to one side of the table. If you're with one other person, then both of you can move to one side. If you have more, than someone's just screwed. **Recommendations**        - I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a cheap Korean BBQ place or feel like rolling the dice. Their quality fluctuates so it's a gamble. At their best, it's better than the other Korean BBQ places.

thGgnXM5h_XLEp9L2NskQw.text: Service is meh-- the server was zoned out, grumpy, and unprofessional. The kimchi and radish side dish are MEH. I liked their side dish of jap chae (clear noodles marinated in soy sauce and oil) tho.  I ordered dumpling soft tofu soup (medium spice). It was okay, not the best I had.  The rice is cooked in a stone bowl, scooped out in a stainless steel bowl and served.  water is poured into the stone bowl (some remains of the flaked rice is left) and is served. It appeared BROWN... like diarrhea the rice was okay but not spectacular. As for the stone bowl, DON'T even taste the contents. It left a bad burnt taste on my tongue. Gross. Totally ruined my meal.

-zPxVGHCUu0JDnZHQR7ZIQ.text: I went and had there all you can eat late night bbq the other night, and let me tell you.. this place was sooo good. I brought my friend visiting from Houston & we we're both amazed with the quality and pricing of the food.. Definitely will be returning !

oylzBDY24-4KjFmr2epVCA.text: The short rib was so greaaaat! Try the spicy chicken as well. The tofu was so-so. I came around 7 pm for dinner and just had to wait for 5 mins to seat. Overall, it's highly recommended!

b9a57LPYj5Zg7wOHRHg8AA.text: Really good.  A little loud. Service was fast and efficient.  Meat was yummy yummy yummy. We got pork belly, chicken, short ribs and prime rib I think.  Salad they give you with the order is delish and the price $16.99 all you can eat is awesome.  We got four meats and we were stuffed and satisfied.  I recommend this place. :)

N6BuSR477skuuoOAI8GQcA.text: There are plenty of choices to be had in this part of LV for good Korean food. Back when I lived here (pre-2009), TH was a regular lunch spot for a bunch of co-workers. Somehow, we managed to make the drive under the Desert Inn underpass from the east side....but it was so worth it - even with that blazing summer sun. In the winter, it was a real treat where you could come here after a long hike in the mountains or Red Rock to enjoy a nice warm bowl of their spicy tofu soup (sundubu). They have a limited bottled beer selection (i.e., Hite and the standard Bud, Miller types, etc), but it's there and makes a tasty compliment for your post outdoor excursions... ;-)  Ambience is bare bones. You might even miss this place b/c it's right across from the main drag of LV's "Chinatown" and right next to a tire store and just before Play It Again Sam. However, this place has been here for awhile and locals know it. Occasionally you might even see the owner from Ichiza's eating here as we did one time.  They have a setup for BBQ (grill, hood, etc) at select tables, but I never tried their other menu items, b/c...well, it just seemed like their specialty was the sundubu. And for that, I've never been disappointed. You basically have your pick of whatever you could possibly imagine to put into that piping hot stone bowl - vegetables, seafood, mushroom, beef, etc. They have it all - even for the vegetarians. They don't skimp on the pickled dishes either - we've gotten refills when asked and they always seem to give us something on the order of 6 choices. The soup comes out with a nice raw egg which is the way I prefer it. I'm not sure, but depending on the time you go, I've had my meal end with the nice cool barley tea. it's a bit inconsistent tho...so I'm not sure.  Either way, good quick service, an affordable lunch price (all under $10 per person for the sundubu) and great consistent food quality makes this an easy 4 star review. If you're feeling adventurous after your hot meal, head over to Play It Again Sam for a True "local" experience. :-P

8kRQW-OI9d5T7TLMCsxHeg.text: You can't beat the 13.99 price! The japchai is godly. Bean paste soup is delicious. The marinated rib eye, beef tongue, and pork belly is to die for. You will not regret coming to this meat paradise.

wkZK6vu_5D3gnvDvIt_9KQ.text: *sigh* I really don't like the service here.  I've been here twice and both times were horrible.  They usually take a long time, and you can just feel the unfriendliness.    The food is ok.  They gave our brisket frozen once.  And one time, they gave the wrong meat.  We ate it anyway though.  Usually, I'll give a place slack for having good food.  This time, the food didn't make up for the service.  it was just ok to me.  If you're looking for a good AYCE KBBQ place, I suggest WooChe.  I'll only come back here if I'm having a late night craving.  They open late and the price is pretty good after 11.  Other than those reasons, I'd rather go elsewhere.  Lol.. ^_^

zZVBTK7KQ0Y4kfraapyhaA.text: Here are my gripes with Tofu Hut:   -The side dishes look and taste as if they were made weeks in advance. -The meats have that brown/gooey look to them, as meats tend to do when they're old.  -The customer service is lacking, although this is expected from an Asian establishment. -The restaurant is filthy, which probably indicates the cleanliness of the food you're consuming.   The positives are that its well priced for a buffet and the selection of meats are diverse. You can order cow tongue if your heart so desires.  Overall, I'd rather pay $5 more to eat at a nicer/cleaner/fresher spot. My friends do enjoy eating here due to the price, so I'm sure I'll be suckered into coming back, but not because I want to.   Korean Garden and DJK are better options, although more expensive.

j8G6ggfOzgK2qmyEiIM08w.text: AYCE specials after 10pm.  Service  bringing the meat and salad is quick. We had a large party and we only waited a few minutes to be seated.  Small restaurant, not greatest for decor, it is a yakaniku.  If you want tea or coffee you have to have coins to buy it from the dispenser machine! I will be back, after 10... Lol

SLJam9IzDpz9kx7XyIiQlw.text: This place satisfies my appetite every time I eat there with my friends. The brisket.... AMAAAAAAAZING! Their salad is AMAAAAZING as well.   Some of their staff needs some better customer service training. I understand it gets hectic and busy, but that doesn't mean treat your customers like nothing.  Anyway, one night, me and my friends decided to go eat some tofu hut. The guy that was seating people told us,"Sorry there are no seats".. alright.. cool.. we dont mind waiting.. so we asked the guy how long the wait is. He responds in a tone where it sounded like he didnt want us eating there at all. He replied with, "I dont knowwww.. uhhhh.. could be 2 hours .. i dont know i dont know"...  Yeah, we were pretty pissed off, but ended up eating anyways. And guess what? It WASN'T a 2 hour wait. Other than that, I enjoyed my meal.  Overall, food is great.. and service could be a bit more friendlier. Minus one star for the customer service....

GLbMGSCx8PMfS_nfioj7Qg.text: Good AYCE Korean BBQ for a great price.  For only $16.99, it is a good deal compared to Sura.  I have never had a steamed egg before, but I loved it.  The only problem was the service.  There was only one other table of guests there, so I guess it was dinner time for the employees.  They were busy eating and we were neglected.  The server was nice, but she needed to be around a few more times.  I will try again and hope the service is better next time.  If not, I'll really rip them a new ass on my next review...

yWvTieRUzKkxkOYAPdJBvQ.text: This place is ok. not that big of a fan like the other korean restaurant. service is ok as well. i was just entertained how they serve the soup in a boiling pot, i recommend eatin the calbi there.. I would go back if my friends invited me but If i was to go on my own i woudl rather go else where.

icSMsf20c_p_lsshl6sbww.text: I specifically made a yelp account to write a review for this restaurant. I used to be frequent at tofu hut before they got shut down. I finally went back today after they reopened. I will RECOMMEND EVERYONE to stay away from here so they can straighten out their defects. Horrifyingly found a BUG in one of my side dish. A Rolly Polly to be exact. I should've learned my lesson when they closed the first time.

7Gh02q3F6oq7PjTNBSXoxg.text: First visit was p,easing. Especially enjoyed the chicken and spare ribs.

cKmBrf7ekMISfO7l0TDCew.text: My friend told me if I want eat good tasty  Koran BBQ,Tofu Hut will be a good option.Finally  we went to try last week.Well, I have to say,it is a good deal for AYCE.

-srkKOoLv7kEevjTIXBhBA.text: My first time going there n it was amazing defiantly going twice a week!! Yum !!

NFT8gNPFsnYscUfvgp8Bqw.text: Fantastic! So good we went twice during our one week stay in Vegas. It was an added bonus that this was also our cheapest dinner out while we were here as well. We tried the marinated ribeye, short ribs, marinated pork belly, regular pork belly, and chicken thighs. Everything was excellent, but the marinated pork belly was a little salty for our taste. The banchan were not as plentiful as other Korean restaurants we've eaten at, but the ones we did receive were delicious. I've read complaints about the service, but we found our servers to be attentive and quick.

Uj8PCNdLPVdFQ_cf8U4F7Q.text: It was ok. Food was ok service was kinda slow and table was sticky. I had kalbi ribs and the seasoning wasn't what I experienced in Korea or other restaurants serving Korean dishes but it was good and I ate it. Overall I'd call this place average.

L9wwxaC3MYcGNiwHw3Ti0A.text: I used to be a big fan of this place even before they went AYCE. The spark that used to burn bright in this restaurant must be going out.   Me and the woman decide for lunch at The Hut. Usually when leaving an AYCE Korean BBQ, satisfaction is usually the attitude that I feel in my gut. I think Tofu Hut needs to up their game.    The sides were up to par. The salad came pretty late.  Brisket was on point. The pork belly, which I am a big fan of, was looking pretty slim. Usually the pork belly is in thick crazy cuts. This time around, not so thick. We didn't get the usual seconds on the belly. So we stuck to the brisket.    There is some tough competition out there in AYCE Korean BBQ. Maybe this was an off day for The Hut. I haven't given up on them. Will try again just to make sure.  I really want to lika chu peoples...

gHcJCUS2iIUuoNWf5c5IBQ.text: Came in on a Friday afternoon. Surprisingly quiet and empty, immediately greeted and sat. Tofu Hut does not have a special interior design. It's located next to a car shop garage and some other smaller businesses across from the Chinatown strip mall, but it is nothing that is run down or hole in the wall. I am not aware of the peak hours at Tofu Hut, but I will tell you the restaurant is quite small in space and seating.  I am actually not too much into meat in general (sounds crazy for me even coming here, right?) but they have a wonderful vegetable buckwheat cold noodle dish that's extremely big and extremely filling. My friends ordered the awesome all you can eat Korean BBQ. This place has probably one of the best all you can eats near Chinatown: refillable salad bowls, tasty cuts of ribeye, beef, and chicken, and amongst other side dishes of kimchi and noodle you can order.  Giving this place a four because it's such a deal breaker for finding a good all you can eat with quality food to a cultural level other than the redundant buffets found in Vegas. I would just recommend getting to know the times that are the least busiest so you won't have to wait for the already limited seating they have.

84tXHWtVMCIeL5aXvmF4wQ.text: Hi,  Las Vegas city of buffets and mass consumption why KBB AYCE here? I guess for a change in monotonous.  The place is no frills KBB, but I found that their slices of meat seemed to be of better quality then the average KBB. Tongue and brisket staples were good and more surprising the short ribs were tender and cooked very well. The grills themselves were very seasoned so that the meats did not stick. Ban Chan was good but not over abundant.

cwkzqzyLaSiKbX43I--FNg.text: This my go-to place to get my korean BBQ fix! The only thing is you can expect to wait at least 45 mins. but I think it is worth it. Love this place. The kalbi is greatly marinated and is so tender. The salad is my absolute favorite. I dont eat rice because I eat so much salad. yum yum yum.

mjDlXiWTEj53Trta2X0eSA.text: Pretty meh.  The tofu soup was good, but the banchan and rice was barely passable. Nothing tasted right except for the kimchee in the banchan. The rice tasted extremely chewy and watery. Towards the end I stopped eating my rice altogether and just finished the soup. Thankfully, the soup is tasty; I had the combination tofu dish that has slices of meat as well as seafood. I wish there was a little more seafood in the soup but it's not too bad.  Not a huge fan but willing to give it another shot in the future.

rDiMD3cL6i-GwanM9eEQjg.text: Such a horrible experience today. I always come in here wanting specific items and was told "we never" do that! My family and I walked in during opening. First things first, tripe and honeycomb are the same thing... Tripe can come in book tripe or honeycomb tripe. And intestines are a whole different thing. I dont expect much and I am really easy. I have come here many times and have just soley ordered the tripe. Today I came in was told they can not give me only tripe "we do not do that" i ordered my brisket specific, thin and fatty. They served me the complete opposite lean and thick. however they did replace the brisket. sometimes I come here and I dont even check in. Ive been coming here way before Yelp app became popular. Before I explain things, I have shutdown like a child. I felt disrespected but then again I come here for the food and not for the service. But if the food and the service are not even up to par what is there to do? I hope that management addresses this. Unfortunately, I wish I had taken a photo of the meats given.

NvLfQbKFVxbIpQxmu_1sMA.text: Okies.. an hour wait...not bad on a Sunday night around 8.  The meat is okay not bad at all.  We ordered Beef tongue, squid, short ribs, steamed eggs, Marinated short ribs, Bulgogi.  Service was excellent! ! Its a good place to grub AYCE if your in Vegas! !  Definitely K-Town in LA has better quality of Kbbq..

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh so good!!

4CDHZOb6opPUUOeQHQTT_Q.text: Drinking all day and all night really calls for something that isn't buffet food.  Don't get me wrong, I love my AYCE, however, a tummy full of alcohol doesn't sit well with a tummy full of food that is mass produced such as buffet food usually is.  Our cravings led us to tofu soup, and a Yelp search led us to Tofu Hut (in all honesty, we wanted to go to another place close by, but it's closed on Sundays).  Not going to lie, we were a bit weary of this place.  Knowing this place was an AYCE BBQ, we were a bit worried we'd come out smelling like BBQ, which would require more preparation for that night's festivities (a quick shower to wash away the BBQ smell).  Thankfully, they actually separate their BBQ side from the tofu side.  We were able to stay well away from the wafts of BBQ smells floating in the air.  The tofu soup was good, although, I should have probably not been so chicken and actually gotten at least medium instead of being a wuss and getting mild.  The spiciness would have definitely added more flavor and kick to the soup.  Not to say it wasn't good, it was.  I had the Beef and Seafood Soup, which made for a great blend of flavors.  It was also good know they didn't skimp on the fillings.  Had plenty of beef and seafood, as well as, of course, tofu.  Four stars, because it was a hot day in Vegas that day, and I was downing my glass of water like a beast.  After I flagged them down the first time for a refill, they definitely kept my glass full the rest of the meal.  Major plus points!!

sqCJPyrgIaAIibZ7zfC4vg.text: The all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ is amazingly good and cheap.  Seating is limited and they only have a few tables with grills, which is a must with the BBQ.  The best thing about the BBQs is the additional Korean side dishes that come with it.  Doesn't look like much from the outside (or inside as well), but the food is authentic.

IB3YslY-cRmoLkex6XmuUQ.text: $13.99 after 10pm & it's worth it! (10pm-2am) [[$16.99 Anytime]]  Went with a few friends (4 of us), each paid $15 -no tip added to final price- but still had to tip a few bucks as I work in the tip business.  90 minutes to eat and I have no problem with that because I was waiting for an open table for awhile before I got to sit.  CONS: With the amount of people serving tables. It is a wait just to get your next plate and sometimes had to remind them for the next round.  Still a place I would eat if I was hungry late at night.

7U0lP7X3pHP6n4mm3-fYhQ.text: Takes a long time to clean up table. But its understandable cos grill is hot n need cool down, i suppose. The price is really good but the meat, especially the short ribs are not tender.  I would not be a regular here, just because the smell afterward in your clothes is horrific, we suppose plan go Hakasan  right after dinner. But once i get in the car, that BBQ smell is just a turn off. So word of advice is that make sure your next stop is shower lol.  I wish there is a 3.5 start, because that is what it earned.

B3C1nvvfHFYeJRgwPpDKLQ.text: This place has pretty good korean food.  Aside from the typical side dishes that come along at every korean restraunt there are only probably 5-6 things you can actually order.  This place is a buffet and i say you order because you have to order the meat that you cook. Thats actually a pretty good thing because you know the food is kept at a good place and not left out for god knows how long like at a regular buffet.  The things you can order are basically all the favs of korean places.  Kalbi, sliced beef, chicken, squid, and pork belly.  There might be 2 others but i forgot what they were.  I paid a about 16 bucks which is actually a darn good price for how much i ate.  The side dishes and rice and everything is really all you can eat.  I would also add that idk where they get their meat from but its of really good quality. I would have goven this place a 5star rating but the only problem i had was that the service sucked.  I was really thirsty that day and the lady clearly had an attitude when it came to filling up my cup.  Like im sorry im thirsty but i cant help it.  Also they didnt check up on us as much as they should.  Idk if thats their strategy to make you wait for service so you just get full while waiting for them to come around and ask for more meat.  Mind you this place really isnt that big at all so there was no excuse not to come around to us within a reasonable amount of time.  This place probably only has about 10-15 tables.  All in all i would have rated this place five stars if it wasnt for the bad service we got. I would still go again tho because the food and price was well worth it.

ZeoggMl5w_X5NEZr_XnlsQ.text: This place is kinda small. But the wait is well worth it. Amazing food at a decent price. In my opinion thee best all you can eat bbq's in Las Vegas. Been to quite a few around the area and still Tofu hut wins my vote.   Def recommend you try them out if you haven't already.

e8MtHdlLvJttcnclh8qNvg.text: They have all you can eat and regular dine in. Before realizing they had the AYCE, we would always come and order 2 soups (tofu + veggies, tofu + beef) and the kalbi short ribs-- our absolute faves!   We finally waited one day for the AYCE and haven't returned back to regular diners. Yes, there's almost always a wait but it's well worth it. Service can be kind of slow but with the amount of guests, it's fairly reasonable. The quality of meats and foods is good enough to satisfy your Korean BBQ cravings! Love this place!

9Nt6_YHhryCpZysVlnC8Uw.text: I think I have found my new Korean place to go. I loved the selection of meats and the price not bad at all. $16.99 for all you can eat and special $13.99 for the late night all you can eat. The food tasted much better than other all you can eat Korean restaurants. The service was very fast and our table was ready with our ban chan and the grill already heated up. Love and coming back definitely.

2z4PjqmUsFdZwZDjH5c9hg.text: yeah, no thanks. Never again. I came here a couple months ago to wait for 1 1/2 hours and STILL not be seated. We ended up going to Sura.  Meanwhile, people who signed in after me got seated because of the number in my party (6). Im sorry but seriously? How do you expect to run a place that has like 5 cooking tables (the rest are for a la carte, but no one wants that)... and not expect hungry-angry waiting customers?  Well, I forgave this incident and came back another time thinking it'd be different. Yeeeeaah, NO. Waited for almost 2 hours! We sat at an empty table and were luckily able to at least order drinks, but still! They had forgotten us!  After this I'm never coming back. Oh and when we finally got seated? HORRIBLE and SLOW (can i bold the word SLOW) service! It's no wonder they aren't able to turn their tables fast enough!

yxBFm8YBXnpCyLFe3Lo_cQ.text: Remind me why I revisited this place again after many years?  Oh yeah! It must be so that I can briefly say, "Meh. I've experienced better"

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tIKqkD1fv8kfeWFPo_VX_w.text: My experience here was solid and I would definitely return. The service was prompt and drinks were consistently refilled. We did the AYCE Korean BBQ and for $17 you really can't beat the deal. The meat was tasty and the portions generous. We had marinated chicken thighs, pork belly, brisket and short rib. Everything was flavorful and fresh. I am not Korean so I am not about to get all snobby about the sides, but in my opinion, they were all fine -- including the kimchi. I will be returning here when in the mood for a filling  dose of delicious meats for cheap.

ChYyeOQ-MHmKU0bVuiR9fA.text: I've visited here a couple times after 10pm for AYCE for $13.99. Every time it was about an hour wait. This place gets very busy and smoky. My clothes and hair always reaks KBBQ after. If it wasn't for the cheap price compared to the other AYCE in Vegas, I don't think I would visit here. And after my last visit, I probably won't dine here again. The food was not appetizing at all. Side dishes were disappointing and the only dipping sauce they offered was salt and olive oil. We got tired of just plain meats without seasoning and the only seasoned meats on their late night menu were spicy dishes. Even those had no flavor. Our water had gunk in it. Overall, wasn't even worth a discounted rate.

MRzVeeaGnkDWB0yfyE7TpA.text: Favorite Korean restaurant in Las Vegas. I have been coming here for several of years now for their delicious kimchi tofu soup and bibimbap. However last night was my first time trying their AYCE KBBQ! After 10pm it's only $13.99, cheapest in Vegas that I know of. My favorite choices were the honeycomb tripe and pork belly. I am absolutely in love with their salad! So good!! Defiantly will be coming back!

LtxR5RFQJRg4oITwdFvLSA.text: Tofu Hut is just one of those amazing value places that stick in your head every time you're deciding what to eat. There are a ton of Korea BBQ places in Vegas...but Tofu Hut has the combination of price and quality that is almost confounding.  Expect a wait no matter the time of day. They stop seating at 1am, but I would not show up later than 12:30 because if the line gets too long, they will close the sign up sheet. I still don't get why it's called Tofu Hut, but you're going for AYCE Korean BBQ option, and even though the price is cheaper for late night, I'd still get the kalbi which is a little more because the quality of the short ribs is excellent. Other favorites were the marinated sliced pork, marinated sliced ribeye, and boneless chicken thighs.  The only knock on this place is service, but the quality/quantity of food makes this place a mainstay in our list of late night cravings. For less than 20 dollars including tax/tip....just go.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doesn&#39;t get any better

b-hkhGrl7DxUB71KEfcN6A.text: The food is okay. Gave it 2 star cause they have a late night happy hour and it's all you can eat or than that, the services sucks, not enough grills so wait time for a table is forever. Waiting seats are not comfortable, bathrooms are gross, parking sucks & over all I don't recommend this place.

WBEQw8tyLPkbr0BH18gZ0g.text: Only $16 at dinner time. Not a lot on the menu but the servings get the stomach full! Satisfying. I rather go here than korean garden. Better price and bigger, better meat.  The only thing I disliked was the service. They barely pay attention to you. Greeting/ welcoming was weak. My party of 3 was waiting in line first on the list and then 2 korean guys just walked in and stole our seats.  I made a complaint and the host didn't do anything about it so I chewed them out myself. Told them to get off our table and wait like everyone else is. People that were waiting got pretty upset too. We always had to scout them to ask for refills and they always forget the straws. Other than that, food is good.

nlw3f0lXsCJS3QY9TxzkLg.text: Tofu hut is very good. The place is small and the wait is usually long which is a downfall because it gets very hot and tiring waiting.  But it IS worth it. The food is so good and it is so much fun cooking your own food. The marination is great. The salad is super good and the service is also very great.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bJbykiNsadq1bDyQSsLGQQ.text: Ive been here for KBbq before and was not impressed. Today I came for soondubu ONLY because Mr. Tofu was closed and was still NOT impressed. At all. The tofu is all chopped up tiny and there arent really ANY vegetables in the soup either. The banchan doesnt seem that fresh either.  If it's up to me I will not EVER be eating here again. It isnt HORRIBLE but it definitely isn't GOOD. Two stars cuz the food sucked but the staff was nice!  GO TO MR. TOFU! NOM NOM NOM!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sn_mBwhBhvDvsOTYH3RXRQ.text: Me and my dad wanted to have some Asian food after a long, exhausted drive to Grand Canyon. The restaurants in Vegas Strip were mostly American (burgers, fries and steak) and Asian foods there were either pricey or taste awful. Tofu Hut became our choice and it proved to be the right decision. We ordered two tofu soups and it was hot and tasty!! Plus, the total price was under $20 (Almost the same price for one tofu soup when I was back in Boston) The service was OK. I also saw they have all you can eat BBQ for $16+tax. If you want to have BBQ, usually there's a time for waiting. I'll definitely come back again if I'm visiting Las Vegas!!

T6DnquUizUcFws3x0fOHbA.text: My go to Kbbq spot! $17 for all you can eat dinner. Can't beat that price! Everything tastes good, but not the greatest kbbq I've had but still good. If you come for dinner be prepared to wait

cBvmyMVkWtzB8ytLuCk_eQ.text: We have been coming here for years and I haven't been in a while which makes me kind of sad. We usually come here late like after 9. I've never been earlier probably because my boyfriend likes to get the cheaper price at $13.99 for AYCE instead of the $16.99 price. Same value just cheaper price. They do have a side where u can order menu items and then the other side of the restraunt has the built in grill on the table for grill your own KBBQ.   Service could be better if they had more people working which is why sometimes it takes a minute for them to check up on you but i usually ask for extra Banchan and am busy eating so I don't really need much once the meats have been delivered. What I love is the oil they give u to dip your meat in. Some kind of oil that has salt and pepper tastes so yummy when the meat is dipped in it then put it on your bowl of rice and eat it together. Yum ! Oh and the salad ...... The salad is so simple yet so delicious.  I must find out what kind of dressing they're making for this salad because I would love to make it at home.   Some of my fav meats to try ....   Pork Belly basically it's bacon. Who doesn't love bacon. Only bacon is cured and smoked. I just don't care for a lot of fat on my meat but my boyfriend handles that part. I just eat the meat and cook it extra crispy.   Short rib -  is always tender I cook it not to well done because I like it juicy.   Beef Tongue is also very good tastes like thin cut steak. I would have never tried but my boyfriend didn't let me know it was tongue and I've been a fan of it since. I'm not to fond if those exotic parts of the animal if you know what I mean. I will still try. Some I just don't prefer. But the tongue here is bomb!    Ribeye - Marinated beef almost like bulgogi   The great thing about grilling your own meats is you control how you like your meats cooked. Service could be better but I always come back & I still love you Tofu Hut !

CtYDCsF3yK6dH-yp9F9ndA.text: Love coming here with friends. Food is always great and yummy. My personal favorite is the cow tongue. I know it sounds weird, but trust me, it's DELICIOUS! Every time I come here I have to get the cow tongue, steamed egg, marinated pork belly, and pork belly.  Only complaint I really have is that I wish the waitresses would smile for once.

dVMQOLNgygCu8aMdPc5zag.text: Oh my gosh! This place!  So I'm from LA, and in Glendora they have the best Korean BBQ! This place is just as AMAZING!  Love this place and I tell everyone about it!  Make sure you're hungry!!

L9nwb1h2vI9IOYtq1mvi9A.text: This is the only AYCE KBBQ place I go to in Las Vegas. I love this place because of its affordable price and the quality of meat. After 10pm it is $15! I always get the chicken, brisket, and bulgogi, my dynamic trio! It goes perfect with the salad they serve and the sides they provide (noodles, kimchi, bean sprout, etc.)  I give this place 4 stars because of their amazing food but not the full 5, due to the times they lack service. There are times where they forget to refill our drinks or ask if we need more rice, and all that. One time when I was eating with friends one of the server's appeared to be having a bad day and it showed through her service with us. She never smiled and she rolled her eyes whenever we asked for things. Service in my experience doesn't lack all the time like this, there are great times and there are bad ones. However, it doesn't interfere with the delicious and affordable KBBQ that they offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zhxcfnpfTB-17ZjBNhejlA.text: I've been here always and I liked going here but today the employees serving us wasn't giving us the proper customer service. The 2 ladies on duty today was also giving us the look/the glare when I told them there was a long strand of hair from the rice. It is not acceptable to think we are a party of 7. This is the 1st time that I went here and had a bad service from all the "unni's" here.

FsKzAvVw14iPNgRGKBi8Zw.text: Came here to meet some friends, who claimed this was Korean BBQ even though it's titled Tofu Hut.  Well, they were right, and the story behind the name is they expanded their business and menu to now include lots of Korean meats.    This place was great. The servers were very attentive, the sides were tasty, and the price for AYCE BBQ was very reasonable.   We had a big table, so we got like 4 different meats to start...I like all of them, but the cow tongue was a tad "organy" to me.  My favorite was the prime rib steak cuts.   My only True disappointment is although they serve a chopped salad, they do not have lettuce leaves to wrap the food in.  This is the way I have always eaten it, so I was sad they did not have this option.  But due to the other positives, I still give this place a 5...and I would eat here again....I'll just bring my own head of lettuce.  BYOL ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My plate of food
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed egg
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-2yI9iNTjsWrlV_V-4VI6g.text: This was my first time eating Korean BBQ. Luckily I went with my friend, that is experienced! We went on a Saturday night and they were super busy. We waited about 15 minutes then we were seated at a table with a grill on it. I was very excited lol! We did the all you can eat for $16.99 each.  They brought six appetizers and steamed rice to our table. The appetizers consisted of tradition Korean dishes. Next we ordered the meat we wanted. You're allowed to order 4 entrees at a time and have 90 minutes to eat lol! The short ribs are delicious but a little hard to cut. The sliced rib-eye is also really good...those are my favorites!  They also have a regular dining side where you order regular entrees. My friend said this is a good option if you aren't that hungry since it is only one entree and you can take leftovers home.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So much fun! lol
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizers

VnRAC7amQVDpzq8iFUmttw.text: By giving place 3 stars I'm being generous.  Meat was good, service, good, but the name of a place is TOFU hut. not BBQ Hut.    My Nipponese wife and I ordered Tofu soup and it was as tasteful and flavorful as the faucet water. It just had a color of soup.  I love soup but I was pretty disappointed.   Sorry guys!!!

RVytcy-4iabPPU_cRK_AkA.text: I always come here when I get a craving of some Korean BBQ!! not only does the line get crazy but its worth it.. The salad is like crack! LOL!!  Never a disappointment when i come.. you should try it! but do come early! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cravings satisfied!

xerB1wKG0moVTwhSoOHF7g.text: Since the horrible experience I had a long time ago there are two gentlemen that runs the place when I come in now, usually from 8pm - 3am.  When these two are running the place then service is top notch.  I only come here for the very affordable all you can eat Korean BBQ.  Pick and choose what you prefer but I always stick with the brisket, short ribs, and marinated short ribs.    You'll get the sides automatically and rice but instead of rice I like to ask for the greens/salad.  Even though it gets really busy at night, these two-men duo gives you superb service.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BFDkxJzntNCwgPlC9ILydQ.text: Sat quickly with water and veggies on the table and server was completely on top of the orders. Water was filled often, food was tasty especially the rib eye. Did the all you can eat and the portion sizes were very large. Overall great luncheon!

BBmOj2y4DLlnU0HxungorQ.text: We have been coming here because of the price. It is affordable and the choices of meat were just enough for our liking. We came around 3pm and it was not busy. Service was fast and the server on this visit was very accommodating and tries to check on us to make sure we are having a good time but not to the point of being annoying.  We have just observed that every time we visit (like every 3-4 weeks gap) something had changed. For instance on this visit, taste of the salad, kimchi and bean paste soup were bland. It could be there cutting cost or the supplies they got were just not the same as before. Nevertheless, Tofu Hut is still the affordable, go-to Korean AYCE place.   Hopefully they can be consistent on their products' taste.

v-G7zG5c0HGF4sD4XFwJJg.text: 90 min - $16.99 per person, $5.99 for kids ages 3+, automatic 15% gratuity for parties of 4 or more.    Overall value in my opinion is good - this place is always packed - we managed to get in at about 6:00pm on a Sunday with only a couple people ahead of us which was great.  The service was good - the servers are not overly friendly (but you don't go here to make friends with your server anyway) but they are attentive and will get you whatever you want, just flag them down.  Meat - selection is a little limited but at this price point it's pretty good.  Their short ribs are boneless - marinade is good, not overly sweet.  The brisket is pretty typical of what you'd expect, the squid was good, pork belly is sliced very thin and the beef tongue was sliced super thin.  Of all things that stood out - it was the beef tripe/intestines - they're cleaned well and don't have a nasty aftertaste which was great.  No lettuce wraps/rice paper/radish paper, etc - just a bowl of shredded lettuce salad.  I really liked the salad dressing - just enough to cover but not overpowering.  The grills themselves are nice - the fats drain off to the bottom edges and it seems to cook pretty quick compared to other places I've been.  They don't seem to change them out during your meal though but it stayed clean enough to get through all of our cooking.  I did not see any dessert options.  They just have your typical banchan / kimchi side dishes.  If you are on a budget and/or are able to get in here without waiting forever - you should check it out.  Not the best Korean bbq in Vegas but possibly the best valued AYCE one!  Also there was mention of a late night special pricing but I did not see this anywhere - maybe they don't do it anymore.

t5Dev6Z8elEqVvVD8nhIBg.text: Great, prompt service and fantastic eats! We came in on a Sunday during lunch and both had the kimchee beef meal. It came with a variety of sides, of Seaweed salad, Tofu, potato pancake, sticky rice, bean sprouts, kimchee and a couple other I wasn't sure of. I tried them all and enjoyed them all. Loved the beans sprouts! They had a sesame oil on them. Great flavor. The main dish of Kimchee Beef, which I ordered medium spicy, had plenty of tofu and kimchee. They offer an add a raw egg upon request, which I was a bit apprehensive about, but went ahead with it. Glad I did. It cooked into the dish by the time I was ready to get into it. Great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kim chee beef

L3JQsgjksaDuV3ufvUp9UQ.text: This my 3rd time coming for just a tofu soup meal and i'm so shock to c food server remember what kind water and how i want my soup to be done just over $9.23 meal i recommend this restaurant to any of my family and friends ... PS: not that i leave more tips then 15%

R9fu_Xb5ClVdhNx5hMDxsg.text: Our favorite place to eat K-BBQ, fast service. Love their food! You guys need to expand your space so there's no reason for the customer to wait long time.

yHDWRdLpUFsdHpjn50ph_w.text: Always consistent.  Don't be a bitch because the service is a little slow.  These ladies are working their nips off!

IN6SIm51qmWxyKxXVq5AMA.text: Don't cross this place out just because of the name people! I get it all the time when I tell friends of this place, the usual "yuck i don't like tofu, do they only serve that?" And to answer the question NO! They have chicken, beef, pork, seafood and some soups.  The sliced Rib-Eye, the short ribs, the brisket and the beef tongue are all really good. I have also tried the chicken but after receiving a very salty batch one time I don't go for it any longer.  Half of the restaurant is for the all you can eat BBQ and the other half is for where people order already made plates of food. I personally think for the late busy hours, so that they don't have such a long wait, they should make the entire restaurant all you can eat.  The salad is the BEST!!! They toss some red flakes and powdery type thing in there and its just amazing!  Oh and when it gets extremely busy you don't receive the best service so you have to be basically jump in front of them to get their attention. But the food makes up for it in a way.
