Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yl6f-GwLzAdYY1ryNi5Gvg.text: A yearly staple I believe, the company is always good and as far as Korean bbq goes I believe it is one of the better ones and decently priced, can't go wrong w brisket and barbecue ribeye, I like the egg thing as well

CuO_SLYXOK5X1pLpu86K8A.text: This place was delicious  went here for dinner when my brother was in town last month we enjoyed it not bad .

YhSTQshRbLbXEfSscHLvlg.text: EFFORTLESSLY 5 STARS!  Food: everything is delicious. From the side dishes to the meats. The meats is always fresh every single time my girlfriend and I have went there. Also, they are very kind with the amount of meat that they start you off with and through out the night when you ask for more! Usually, in a lot of AYCE restaurants, they will limit every time that you ask for more, but they do not. They give a good amount every time and we love it!   Customer Service: as returning customers, we've never ever had any complaints about their service. Always attentive, always helpful and always nice. They get us what we need and they're always checking on us!   The only thing I could ever say is that they do not have brisket sauce! Even when people say that you can ask for it, we have asked before and the answer ended up being no. But, that doesn't fail us enough to give them anything less than 5 stars.   Thank you tofu hut for being our go-to spot for Korean Bbq.

C713XMjlVsT78kTeGw6cGw.text: This was the worst KBBQ I've had in Vegas. Most KBBQ Restaurants have the option of side dishes that is included with the all u can eat. Although this one had nothing include. Not even a dessert. The meat was low quality. All of the meat we ordered in the All-Day-Menu was extremely fatty. The grill already had fat all around the sides. The brisket was so thick and chewy and had so much fat. It honestly felt like I was only eating oil and fat. The kimchi... wasn't even CUT. They gave us a quarter of a cabbage. Had to cut the kimchi ourselves. The workers talked to themselves more than serving the customers. Overall terrible experience.   Don't go here. If you're looking for quality KBBQ experience go to Master Kim's KBBQ. The price there starts at $22.99, but I promise you it's worth the price. That restaurant comes with the option to order side dishes (I recommend corn cheese) and dessert! They also have the best brisket that slides down your throat. Juicy but not fatty... unlike Tofu Hut.

nAWlSFBWPq3LVmX1K4ggjQ.text: ayce is 17.99 per person seating on the weekends are always a wait. just recently they changed how u order now you can only order 4 meats at a time

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GhhZ1-8F5Rghl0moo1Jdxg.text: Been to the other huge Korean Bbq spots... this one by far is my entire family's FAVE!!!  There isn't a big selection like the others, but it doesn't matter.  What they do serve (side dishes) are made with an authentic type of Korean love as if you were eating in a Korean home in Korea.   I love the fact that's a small ma and pa business, totally UNBOTHERED by the competition because they put their ALL into food and service.  We eat here at least once a week now.    One Saturday night, the wait was an hour (can't blame them) so we went across the street to HANU.... NEVER AGAIN!!!! It is worth the wait... this is def our all time favorite!

iK8vY3GdGAlWEgFTG-iU2w.text: Don't usually give 5 stars. Food was great. The Beef Marinated Rib Eye gave me reason to give the extra star, making this small Korean BBQ a well deserved Five Stars.  Secondly, your table is ready with the small starters and the table servers were attentive. I left feeling very satisfied. We will come back.  Don't know anything bout tofu. But, for Korean BBQ check it out.

5yCBMceYyMv59q1cztAK1A.text: First off, to enjoy Tofu Hut or any cook your own meat Korean BBQ place you must know how to grill meat!!! You have to understand how different meats such as ribeye and chicken need to be cooked for different amounts of time to ensure that they are not overdone. Every time I come here I see people overcrowding their grills and leaving the meat on way too long. This is what causes the heavy smoke and flames that ruin the beautiful taste of your meat.   Tofu Hut is deserving of 5 stars based on the food/value ratio. My husband and I have been here quite a few times and will never get sick of this place. For $16.99 you get all you can eat meat, salad, rice, and banchan. For the meats my favorites would have to be the short ribs, pork belly, and the marinated chicken. Also, they recently added squid to their menu that you can either get plain or marinated in a spicy sauce. We had the plain squid and it was fresh and tasty, however I believe that the marinated would have made it even better. For the banchan you get kimchi, fish cakes, bean sprouts, marinated cucumbers, rice noodle salad, and Korean carrot and spinach pancakes. Give all of the banchan a try while you are waiting for you meat to cook. The kimchi and pancakes are amazing, however it is new kimchi so if you are looking for the old very fermented stuff this is not your place.   Tips for coming here: Be prepared to wait at least 30 mins as there is always a line. Just remember the saying "good things come to those who wait", and trust me its worth the wait! Grab one of the Cass or Kloud Korean beers to enjoy with your meal. Both are refreshing,full of flavor, and nicely priced for the large 22 oz bottles. The final tip I can give you is be polite to your servers. Some people on here complained that they experienced rude service during their time here. Please understand that the two ladies who serve here appear to speak little English, but both are extremely nice. A smile and a thank you goes along way here and doing so will show they you appreciate them keeping your BBQ full of meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All of the banchan plus the marinated chicken, short ribs, and marinated ribeye

hvyGIwQl6BCzLfa_klvifA.text: My all-time favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Can't beat the price, and the food is great. I've gone to numerous Korean barbecue places around town, yes this is the place that I always go to. Anytime someone comes from out of town, or any friends or family who want to go out to eat and meet up, this is the place to go.

AkEhZlu41gt81cII-n28YA.text: Honestly the first time I set foot in this place I thought I was going to get food poisoning.  But for a cheap and dirty solution to KBBQ, this will do!  Hard to mess up the brisket, which is my favorite thing from the menu here. Second up is the beef tongue. And lastly would be the kalbi that is a little too sweet and sometimes black in some places (where you don't want to eat it).   The salad was amazing the first time I came here, but the second time they only had a cole slaw version with cabbage which wasn't nearly as good. Either they ran out of green lettuce, stopped romaine because of the recall a couple weeks back, or decided cabbage was cheaper.  The small side dishes are fairly good and we get multiples of certain ones. However the other meats not mentioned, and the soup/egg, are all lackluster or seem a little off, and are otherwise a waste of stomach space.   I've tried it twice and though I doubt I will be back again by choice, it's still the cheapest in town and for its price it is just right. The service is not bad either.

ZEnjEsNzDX2xpNc2mS6Q1w.text: Haven't been here in years and it's always such a great thing when you see the same workers still there! For a last minute option, our tummies were definitely satisfied!  Our son had an a la carte order of their fried dumplings - just enough steamed to pan fried ratio.  Brisket, pork belly, marinated short ribs, ribeye, steamed egg, kimchi and that infamous Tofu Hut salad!  You cook the meats to your own liking.. We like our medium - medium well, with the exception of the pork belly being a little crisp because it's like bacon! And you eat it with steamed egg and white rice, mmmm!  Also you have to eat most of the plain, aka not marinated meats, with salt and sesame oil! Maximizes and add flavor to the meats!  I'll be sure to visit here a lot sooner and add this place to my rounds of KBBQ places because it did not disappoint!

YJIhuGxYIGAgoBsPS9QgyQ.text: The place was clean and service was good. We got there at 10pm and was seated quickly and served. The meat was tasty but they didn't have any dipping sauce other than salt and oil. That is my reasoning for the 3 stars as additional dipping sauce would have been great! The price is quite reasonable for everything we got!

Nn16uMKYuMTeKBoA7wl3JA.text: Just had lunch at Tofu Hut today. This place is absolute garbage. If you want to eat garbage come here. Upon entering I noticed the entrance hallway smelled like urine. Found out this place got shutdown by SNHD for violations including employees not properly washing their hands, spoiled food, food unprotected from potential contamination, ineffective pest control measures and more. Just google 'tofu hut dirty dining' and you'll see.

-z0S39GsTLbakE88aXLqTg.text: Great Korean barbecue for a reasonable price. $14 for all the rib eye , pork belly, and other meats you can eat.  Short ribs are $16.  Nice assortment of kimchi and salad.  Staff was friendly and attentive.  You can't go wrong for a late night Korean meal.  It's a great down to earth place to get your grub on!

4RQ8ur-YGrdEhGC-mLn4xQ.text: One of the best Korean BBQ places in town. It may be that the wait makes the hunger grow, but it does make the food taste much better. The salad is filling and the BBQ comes at your request (unlike other places that are BBQ Nazis). Be prepared to wait as they are cheaper than the others, therefore, require a long waiting period.

fgbw2LSL7GiBMUKoLyqpaw.text: Tofu Hut would seem like a mecca for those with aversion to eating meat but vegetarians should be aware that this place is all about the meat.  Beef Brisket, Rib Eye, Beef Ribs, Beef Tongue, and Tripe  The crew I hang with loves this place and I'm in agreement.  Was just there last night grubbing on tons of meat.  I don't really have a negative on this place.  I love the little side dishes of korean pancake, fish cake, kimchi, sesame seed sprouts etc etc.  I've always loved Korean food but it's usually so dang expensive that I save it as a special night.  If you go in the early hours of the morning, you are more likely to get some wait service that can assist you with the cooking, that is when my friend learned how best to do the experience and since she has, it's even kicked the experience up a notch.  I will continue to be a regular patron and sing praises on the all you can eat.  I think the little bottle of drinkable yogurt at the end is a nice touch.

duG1h_VxscJCqb7a-pjSFQ.text: The food was pretty good. If you want Korean bbq this is he place to be. It is a small place, so the wait might be very long depending on when you go. It's all you can eat and the variety is not too bad for the price.

tAwbdEGWqvle8DAYJ50M5g.text: This place had some amazing soup! I had Spicy Beef Soup for lunch and boy o' boy was it delicious. The lunch came with rice and some asian sides (including kimchi) it was all delish! I would definitely recommend their soup here. I gave only 3 stars because customer service was so-so... They didnt talk at all except "what your order?". They didnt refill our drinks. And i had to ask for napkins. Other than that, food is amazing!

vFq1Jqes-xmha4IXiX4a0Q.text: Just walked out of Tofu Hut.  Heard great things about this place but after waiting and being ignored by three unfriendly waitresses we walked out. It seems like they were ALL in a bad mood so we went to Makino instead. I can add Tofu Hut to the long list of poor service establishments in NV.

ogGvZiyruyz8bkuIQfRnaw.text: 5 star for the price and service! We have always gone out to eat here and we are always satisfied! The food is great and the service is good. Best of all it is CHEAP! Only downside is the wait to be seated and sometimes parking.

9HhKUkuiunUi6043JhbBxQ.text: Basic Korean BBQ.  AYCE is affordable. Service is okay..  I really like their salad!

qUq2BnJhpw5HjiYaN-Md6Q.text: I've had several different Korean BBQs. I wasn't feeling this one. The table we had had poor ventilation and I got smoked out and I got so hot I didn't feel like eating. That and none of the food really had any flavor to speak of. There are better options in the area.

kJJMAPkQbED6W4SlCHHkxQ.text: Alway great food for the price ,and we alway love tofu soup one of the best in las vegas. Need to fix  a/c petty warm,service ok

fxwwWLMKj7n8cv3ySzE39A.text: Thus is one of the best Korean restaurant in vegas  food was awesome and the service was excellent. definitely will go back and pass it on to friends. Despite the long wait it's worth it.

nTWqhNOqD2xaEUzwqVLqjQ.text: Me and my sister eat here at least 4 times a month, until something happened. The people/manager who work here are basically protecting a customer who stole my sister's phone by not releasing a CCTV record of the incident. They only sent us a picture of a customer who sat at the waiting bench where phone was accidentally left and stolen. But we wanted to see the actual video before filing a police report because want to be sure that its that same exact customer who stole the phone. In short, we wanted to have a prima facie evidence. They made so many excuses such as "we are very busy right now; we cannot look at the CCTV," "We do not have the correct angle of the CCTV where you sat," as the employee/manager said even after sending a picture of a customer who just sat on the same spot where my sister left! The employee at TOFU HUT even said "your phone stolen is not a major thing!" Excuse me but thats not a very intelligent thing to say for an employee to justify a customer's personal belonging being not a major thing! Its just unacceptable, insensitive, and unethical way to deal with customers! How dare you? Its not just the cellphone itself but the memories, pictures, files and all other important information stored in it that could be lost forever! They don't care (unwilling to help) about their customer who was the victim but care so much about the customer who stole the phone! I don't know what core values this business has, but Im sure they don't matter at all! They failed to protect their customers and for that, we regret going here!

L2V25frZtVqajUMW6OMg0Q.text: How cool! I've never been to a place like this! I guess you could consider it lazy on their part cause you cook the food yourself but that's what I like about it! Nom Nom how fun!  Transfriendly- B+ no issues

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hOpDsYMheED3deFXJ3lvMg.text: Very expensive but the food was good the thinly sliced steak ribeye was my favorite. They didn't ask if we wanted any drink they just gave us water so that was a little weird.

TFNtqbGqurfOblFaELqUuw.text: I want to give this place 3 1/2 star. Compare to Mr. Tofu, I would come here instead. I ordered Kimchi Beef Tofu and I thought it tasted a little better. The guys that was working here were a little overwhelmed by all the business, but they managed to come over and check on us. I thought the service was way better than the other place.  I would come back here again, for sure.

oJj0vztDbok_ZDtNW_2y4Q.text: Service sucks!  Waitress didn't even take our drink order.  Waited for an hr for a table when there were available tables.  Food is just at par with other Korean restaurants in town.  Downtown restaurants are better!!!!

xaX8wyMnlVMWuzbg3PLU5w.text: So delicious! Came here during a lay over at 11pm. Lots of good side dishes.  I normally dont like meat, but the korean short ribs was so sweet and yummy that I finished the entire plate.  Seafood tofu was a winner.

mnfBpP3Q0LPaUvmS9iEqAg.text: Do not be deceived by their name. They're called Tofu Hut, but have much more than tofu. They are a Korean Barbecue AYCE table-grill place. They have kalbi, short ribs, squid, pork, chicken, and many different side dishes.   We waited about 20 minutes for a table. That was the first good sign. Their service was a bit disservicing to us and themselves. They need a bit of a better system, but what can I say? I'm in Chinatown. It's just that they kept going back and forth for one thing at a time, so it takes a while for you to get things some times, thus the one-star off.   They have a really good soup like a Mae Won Ton, that was really yummy. Definitely try every single thing on the item list and bring tons of friends. That's the best way!  I'll be back after I rally some more friends!

4tISCMSUqyMNLGHyn75xtg.text: They offer cheaper prices at night from 10 pm. Foods were good and they are open until 2 am. The only thing that I hate about it is the waiting time. You'll be waiting for an hour (if its super totally packed esp. during weekends --night!) and sometimes half an hour just to be seated. So if you guys wanted to eat here be sure you list your names on their notebook for you to be seated.

jX3U6ZMooRoM1oI1Ca84lg.text: I love this place! Cheaper than the KBBQ stops here in SF so I was very satisfied coming here. I've (previously) gotten the buffet here - but my last visit my friends just wanted to get a la carte - which wasn't bad. We got the combination specials which included the side dishes (+unlimited refills of said side dishes). My go to side dishes: fish cakes and the pancakes (whatever that is, IT IS DELICIOUS). Here in SF I don't think we have those pancake things but they were BOMB.COM!! I could eat that everyday. I ordered the spicy chicken bbq. The tofu soup it comes with is really good - if you like it spicy it's not TOO spicy, but it's still good. Korean BBQ is probably my most favorite kind of food... I'll be back whenever I come to visit my best friend!

LcmM44W7FyAbV1Nsmve1WA.text: It was my little family and I last day in Vegas, so my uncle and cousin (who resides in Vegas) said let's get dinner. I was still a little full but they couldn't stop talking about Tofu Hut. lol. So I was like, what the hey, it's my last day with them and I wanted to spend time altogether anyways.  The wait took about 45mins since they had to accommodate eight of us, it looked busy.... After we got called to our table, my uncle and cousin started ordering so many meats. Well, it is an All You Can Eat yakiniku joint. $16.99/person when we ate there. Can I just say that it was one of the best places we ate in Vegas! The meats were yummy, you get salad, some side dishes, and rice! It was great! If you were in Vegas craving for some yakiniku, this is the spot right here! :) Thanks to my uncles, cousin, and auntie for taking us here.

LyMNm7GCwxgMRYut-zskhw.text: My friend and I come every other week. We always get the rib eye, brisket, and short ribs every time we come and still haven't gotten tired of it! That's how good it is. I'm also not much of a veggie eater, I actually hate vegetables, but this is the only place you'll catch me eating a salad. Mix that with rice and the meat, and it's amazing. The waiters are very attentive. They will spot your empty glass of water like a hawk. They clean up the tables fairly quickly in between customers. For $17.99 (before tax), you can't beat all you can eat and the experience.

ICQsvFqPVXRNqlCA7olBog.text: I never had KBBQ and this was an amazing experience. The food was amazing, the service was excellent, and the atmosphere was great. I loved that they were very attentive to drinks and gladly served us all the meat and sides we asked for. I love this place and will be returning with more friends!

1VQBkDvsIdPDOUxfNOiN9A.text: Tofu hut needs more credit in my opinion.  Their prices are the most reasonable in all of Vegas. $16.99 all day up till 10 pm then it is $13.99 for their late night special.    It's a hit or miss with the service!  You can tell when they are in a bad mood or not.  When they're in a good mood, they're very kind.    The food is great!  I always order brisket,  pork belly,  beef tongue, squid,  spicy chicken,  and the tripe. I don't really like the tripe,  I just order it for the honeycomb that comes with it. Ask for brisket sauce!  It's yummy!  They also have very tasty side dishes: japchae, cucumber salad,  fishcakes, korean pancakes,  and kimchi.  Oh and by the way,  they have the best salad anywhere!  I've tried a lot of korean bbq places and by far,  tofu hut has the best house salad!   There are definitely other places where you can get better meat quality and better service,  but you will never get this great of a deal!    Hot tea is free too!

fBe9dMf6_bkp-5Rq-BGCjA.text: I use to come here when I was still in college and before all the AYCE Korean BBQ that popped up recently. Back then it was a good deal for good food but now there are way better options for similar price out there...Biwon being one of them.

1viKADqYBZBi6PmcDovxYw.text: Iove eating here, it's definitely worth $14 after 10pm!   AMBIANCE: 4 - small, limited seating in grill area! restaurant area usually always open! it's always clean and they revamped their waiting area with wooden benches! usually always busy with people!   SERVICE: 4 - usually fast towards the beginning and slow towards the end! lol but don't you just hate it when they turn up your heat so you leave faster?! hahaha  FOOD: 4 - hot dam, meat is so good! Try the brisket salted with the oil mixture they give you (not even sure if I'm using anything right but it's delicious!!) their side dishes are so good! it's just worth every penny! it makes me wonder why fast food exists when you could just spend $14 eating here!

W5CTtndmji5JD3DNq62M7g.text: Cheap AYCE kbbq $13.99 for past 10 pm and $16.99 for everything else. I come here when i don't want to spend too much but pay a higher price later. I often get sick after eating here because it's not really that clean. Tables don't really get wiped down properly because they are just trying to seat as many people as possible as fast as they can. Avoid touching the menus because they are usually sticky from the oil splatter. Cook the meats properly, especially pork, and heat the tools used, to kill bacteria from raw food. Even after following these precautions I still get sick...  The food is mediocre, there aren't any great KBBQ places in Vegas so I can't really complain.

jHdOVuuhXkmuotO5-AVgGw.text: I've been to Tofu Hut before but this was my first time as a Yelper (I'm not sure if that's a word but I just made it one). Anyways, the wait wasn't too long. You do have to sign in for all you can eat BBQ.   Once seated, the table came with little dishes of kimchee, bean sprouts, and other things I'm not sure of but we're delicious. They also provide you with steamed rice, salad, and water right away. We ordered the chicken breast, rib eye, short rib, and brisket. Of all four, I enjoyed the chicken breast. It's a bit spicy but deliciously seasoned. The rib eye was the runner-up for me.   I was a little disappointed in their brisket this time. Usually that's all I eat when I go there but this time it tasted different. It didn't really have seasoning or maybe it was the grill making it so bland. They may have changed their recipe or gotten this brisket from a different kind of cow or something because this is not the brisket I remember.   Despite the failed brisket, it was good. I do recommend wearing clothes you don't care about when going because when you walk out of there, you'll be smelling like a walking Tofu Hut. I also recommend going to this place in winter since the grills give off so much heat and will keep you warm during your dinner lol.   Will I come back? Probably. Will I have the brisket? Probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More chicken and short rib.
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At the beginning of dinner, chicken on the grill.

ZooYLABg2QDwADMk-ST4RA.text: Pros: Cheap-ish, late hours, easy menu Cons: There's probably a long wait to sit down and they MIGHT slice your meats thinner if you order them a second time... :(  I recommend: Anything you like- the menu is pretty short (and hopefully they don't start slicing your meat thinner)!   I think this place is pretty decent with a concise and solid menu. My absolute favorite thing to order in KBBQ is beef tongue so of course, I order that first. My friend and I savor every slice along with whatever else we had and order another. They bring it out and even just looking at them on the plate, it's obvious it was cut much, much thinner. I have a picture of a cooked slice from both our first and second orders that I will post :(.   Now, I get it- it's a business. I am pretty confident in my ability to devour beef tongue to the point where I question if a restaurant will make money off me. However, slicing meat thinner is not the way to secure a profit! "Just order another," you might say. Well, I say thinner cut slices are not as scrumptious as a more hearty slice. Also, it makes it harder to cook on the darn grill. It will quickly MELT if you aren't gifted with the swiftness and grace of a grilling ninja. Therefore, I am sad.   Nevertheless, I did enjoy my dinner at Tofu Hut regardless of the sad beef tongue. We ordered almost all the other meats off the menu and they were good. I felt service was responsive and polite and there was almost always a waiter nearby if you needed anything. I would come back, but my quest to find a KBBQ place I absolutely love continues...

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The difference between my first (left) and second orders of beef tongue...!

J0T_L_U0HYVjyoaboWdNcQ.text: In my opinion it's one of the better Korean BBQ restaurants with a more economical value. Other places its $35 and up, this one it was $17 for all you can eat, but of course just like sushi, you better finish up what you order or they will charge you for whatever you didn't finish.   My favorite part of this restaurant is they have tv screens playing music videos of Korean Pop, so it feels like an upbeat atmosphere.   I case you've never had Korean bbq, the table will have built in grill and you can order many different meats that will be served to you raw and you can cook them on your grill to your liking. Now be aware you will be doing all the cooking yourself, the servers will not lay out the meat for you. It also comes along with different sides such as kimchi, rice, sweet potatoes, and other items i could not identify but still good.  Alcohol is provided, including Corona and some other brands known to Americans.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, pork belly, short ribs

lwREKSOHfpPQSPdkZWEr5g.text: Great food! Great prices and fantastic staff. Props to them for making us a feel like we were the only customers there!   The brisket is amazing and the tables were cleaned quickly after a party left so that we could be seated quickly !!   It was so good I'm going to be coming back!

tzkaI3EFaevwxdVasD0S6w.text: Since my last review, I've been here a couple times. I'm going to knock them down a star. This is mainly due to the quality of the food.  Many people like to come here because the all you can eat barbecue is the cheapest in town. It's 15.99 and it includes short rib and steamed egg. But recently, the food quality has gone down drastically.  First, let's talk about the kalbi, or marinated short ribs. The beef was average quality. And, it was way too soft. It lacked any sort of chew, which means it was marinated too long.   The spicy pork bbq was really disappointing as well. It had been overly marinated as well and we had been cooking it for a while, but it seemed like it was never done.  The ribeye was acceptable, and so were the pork belly slices, but really, is it that hard to mess it up? All your doing is slicing. What seems to be the issue is the marinades here.  The banchan is very disappointing here. The only highlight is the stir fried fish cakes, but it was average. The pancake and japchae are so bland here. The kimchi does not taste good. The only highlight was the salad.. just what I wanted to eat at an AYCE bbq (sarcasm).  The bean paste soup is so bland and flavorless, and the once good steamed egg tasted like an overly salted, watery mess.  The food, I'll give it 2 stars, but the price, I'll give it 4. The service here is good and fast. I would go here if my friends wanted to go, but on my own accord, I probably wouldn't be taking any out of towners here, no matter what the price was.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aftermath
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed egg
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat

EJnyNpQ25sslQqBPHq57PA.text: Visiting the area and stayed in Palms hotel not far at all from the restaurant. Decided to give this place a try., my nephew and his wife told us about this place, so we all went to eat here for dinner and order the AYCE for four. Our favorite was the short ribs, it was really good. We also had the steamed egg, that wasn't good at all. It had no flavor, it tasted like bad wet scrambled egg with no flavor. But everything else was good, give this restaurant a try you won't be disappointed.

1IUENGKOcBaMg0P5GzkCAA.text: If you're looking for a cheap Korean BBQ place to go, this would be the spot.  Be warned... - very fast - very good - very cheap... pick 2 (at best)  Overall the food is good but the service is slow and isn't very great. There is a long wait time for the BBQ and almost an equally long wait time for food and service. There are only 2 servers and 1 bus person and the demand for service exceeds what they can supply.  Even though this is my first review for Tofu Hut, I've actually visit this KBBQ repeatedly over the past several years. They never had fast or stellar service, but this time was just too much.  I don't know if I would come back again.

7-ykDQEQuLeg5i5uoZMF5w.text: I love Tofu Hut, it has nothing to do with tofu at all! it's straight up all you can eat korean bbq at it's finest. the bulgolgi (sp) beef is great. so is everything else... I didn't have the stomach to try the tripe.. (haha) but everything was great and we left feeling full and happy.

WhwpYDMdDd8bvsqXKh2HWw.text: Located just off Wynn road and Spring Mountain in China Town Las Vegas...I give this place 4 stars straight to the point only because I keep coming back for more. That must mean something, considering there is nothing really special about this place. It's as simple as simplicity gets. This small AYCE Korean BBQ has enough choices to satisfy those Korean craving tastebuds. But on any given night be prepared to wait anywhere from a reasonable 30 minutes to a sometimes ridiculous 2 hour standby. It is pretty much a hit or miss, just expect the expected. After 10:00pm is a discounted price of $13.99 compared to the $16.99 regular price, which is still not bad.  Just know that the discounted price will not include short ribs and steamed egg. You can opt out those prices to get those menu items included.  This place has been on KTNV channel 13 news for Dirty Dining before, but I guess sometimes the dirtiest place taste good! (No pun intended but not saying that is a good status to acclaim). The times I have been here however were clean enough, but behind the kitchen only the prying eyes will know.   This place could improve on size, but I think renovating the place is out or question.  Again this place is not anything special, but a local hot spot amidst the Chinatown district and open late for those night owl cravers. I do recommend it though!

AnSHSjzNH_9MUray6HkZeg.text: Quality Korean BBQ, few selections of meats and few Banh Chan  wasn't bad for the 16.99 price tag. Was skeptical in coming to this place because friends said it was shut down before for health concerns. We gave it a go anyhow and it was pretty good and clean. Meat was fresh, service was great! This place didn't wow me, but it just had the essentials of Korean BBQ. I would stick to the  marinated short rib, that's all we ordered while there hands down, probably wouldn't come back unless it was a drunken night.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ short rib! The only thing u need to order there!

TTf6a6MCBQRiba4PjvpXlQ.text: ALL YOU CAN EAT 17$, this place is a little gem! Very limited seating but you can beat the price! You have a choice of about 10 items ( pork belly, brisket,  etc) to choice from continuously until you can't eat anymore! The side and salad are as well delicious. The interior could use a renovation and that would improve the overall experience.  But when it comes down to the food, it's a good deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly

FbEcjeHadEcFith-GXhRKg.text: I have to say, ever since Tofu Hut reopened, the service and quality of food has improved a lot. The servers are very nice and they often make rounds around the tables to ask if you want water or more meat. It used be to painfully difficult to get the attention of servers here, but almost everything about Tofu Hut seems to be much improved.  So I have to admit, I'm not a fan of side dishes at any KBBQ place so I'll mainly just rate on meat quality, price, and service. Meat selection is pretty standard, you can get brisket, marinated ribeye, pork belly, chicken, and squid for the lunch price of I think $12.99. For dinner you pay $17.99 and can get short rib and steamed egg as additional choices. For KBBQ in Vegas that's the cheapest price I know of. So meat selection (and taste) is pretty good, price is good, and service is good. I'm giving it 4 stars though because I can't help but compare it to the KBBQ in LA which is the same quality for $11. But still, I think Tofu Hut is the best choice for KBBQ in Vegas for people not wanting to pay $20+ each.

6AJTw-QLvkqsdJ821pi9jw.text: After eating hotel and buffet food for days, my boyfriend and I decided to step outside of the strip in Vegas and look for Korean BBQ around town:... and we found this amazing place!!! All you can eat Korean BBQ! You get to pick about three different meat, and the sides come with the whole package too! Definitely give this place a try when you're in Vegas, and you won't be disappointed!! The price is pretty reasonable also. $16.99 for normal hours and $10.99 past 10:00 pm!!

o1hSKajkdID7Dt2d0VBHWw.text: Do not let this little unassuming place give you the wrong impression. The food here is yummy! If you are not the adventurous type, then their  $16.99 all day menu is for you! You get to choose from brisket to bulgogi to spicy pork. The banchan is limited but you can keep asking for more and did I mention they have the best salad ever? A friend of mine who was stationed in Korea said the salad dressing was just like she had in Korea.  The place is small and they only have so many BBQ tables so get there early! They also have a restaurant side if the BBQ is too much for you. The food is good and the service is with a smile.  Give it a try and you won't be disappointed!

FwMYyH15ig97SL9k4ArT8g.text: I'm still waiting for my table. People are out the door. There is nothing special about this place, meat selection is average, salt mix with oil, seaweed pickled w/Daikon and by the way don't ask for a cup of ice. Ain't got no ice.... There better cuts of meat at Walmart. Service is slow, then they rushed you out.   Use to be our spot for Korean table BBQ.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three 4-5 tops table empty for about 15mins now.

DIHob5MeoCGvThWUv3SqzA.text: Tofu Hut used to be my favorite place to get my kalbi fix, but over time I have noticed their portions getting smaller each time my family and I come to dine in. However, It was a huge let down today when the kalbi bbq we had were about 3 pieces of strip kalbi meat, just cut in tiny portions to fill out our hot plate.  The food was good. I loved their appetizers, despite the 'hit or miss' with customer service. I'm a loyal foodie. I always go back to places I like. Although, it was a good run. I have a lot of memories here at Tofu Hut. I came here with friends and family. I came here to celebrate my second pregnancy, I came here every week after my Chiropractor appointments. I came here during my third pregnancy and several times post-pregnancy at about 4 months.  I live on the other side of Town but I drive all the way out here for their food. Perhaps it's time or me to turn in my hat. Adios!

soO4HQwQ7AnCZxYklYuAjw.text: Explosive diarrheas for both my friend and I.  Also service sucked.  Nothing special in the menu. The only dipping sauce is oil and salt.  This is literally the worst ayce kbbq in Vegas, even if I did not get the diarrheas. Also the cheapest.

Fc-bQt8icUObRHAi3XDONg.text: Gone in 90.  Located across the street of the Chinatown strip Mall on Spring Mountain, the Hut is not hard to find with it's big green letters. Yes your thinking, tofu, all veggies right? Nope totally opposite. This hut is an all you can eat Korean BBQ joint. Yup, they have meat.   Always greeted when we walk in and on a busy day, a 5 min wait to get a grill table. They have 8 or 9 I believe, and on the other side of the restaurant, several tables for menu ordering. Haven't seen it yet because we come for the BBQ, and we'll have to try sometime.   What ordered: Marinated beef Thin sliced beef Pork belly Steamed egg Bean soup  90 minutes is what you get, and that's more than enough time to get that belly stuffed though. Everytime we ordered, our plates were stacked high. Maybe it's to keep from reordering so many times, but it's hella convenient. Meats are fresh, and marinated meats are flavourful. The pork belly are like thick slices if bacon. I mean, what can you ask for @ $17 a person. Beef, pork, chicken and a couple of seafood items. Not to mention all the side condiments like kimchi, salad, tofu, bean sprouts and seaweed salad.  Servers here are very attentive. No empty glasses or condiments. Plates cleared, and we were always checked up on. And when needed, our grill was changed on request. Compared to the higher end style KBB, I'd call this the Carl's Jr of BBQs. Go in, eat and get out and go.   Definitely the go to spot for that fast KBB crave.

fX05h_m-d_o8p11Z4r02vg.text: So I came back for more and this time brought out of town family who were told to check out this place. I got a better look around and noticed that there was seating for more than 4,. 2 tables were set up for 8 , and they just added a seat to our table since we had 5. The restaurant was also divided by whether you want to BBQ or not.  I ordered the steamed egg this time which I'd never had before. It came out piping hot. And it was light and fluffy. I really enjoyed that, it pairs nicely with the seasoned meats. And after awhile if you dont eat it all right away, it deflates like a fallen cake.  We also tried the marinated steak this time which is thinly sliced and cooks fast like the spicy pork belly. My cousin thought it was dry so she was dipping it in the sesame oil salt mixture. Maybe we over cooked it..  Second time was a hit!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cabbage salad
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marinated boneless short rib, brisket, soy sauce chicken thigh, spicy pork belly
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan

0dsw_dGs77_7-oh0Fqstiw.text: Tofu Hut is stable mark on my bench of places I frequent. I've been going for over 8 years and this review is way over due.  I was wondering yesterday what gives this place its charm while we had dinner there last night. The long list of kbbq that runs on Spring Mtn, this may be one of oldest spots that I know of. This place is a no frills, cozy spot with an excellent price point. The food isn't top notch but it's exactly what I expect every single visit. Food is 4/5 stars we love the brisket, short ribs and there mushroom tofu soup is freakish good. My partner enjoys the banchan and the savory salad that's included with the AYCE.  The restaurant is not big. Half of the place is divided between AYCE (with 7/8 tables only) the other side for a la carte. There likely will be a wait, even longer waits for peak dinner hours for AYCE.  A la cart side is usually always available to sit immediately. The service here is always good, they work efficiently and quickly to make sure your served quick and full and move along to the next.  Places like Tofu Hut, feel like a nice break from the glitzy kbbq. Sometimes your girl just wanna eat, and look bummy without the side eye.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0K5fULbjptJ0uiCDbpPj-A.text: I've been going to Tofu Hut for many years. They are the original korean BBQ on spring mountain, time to give some props.  Tofu Service and ambiance:  This is a small mom & pop korean BBQ resto.  Smaller in size vs. the current korean BBQ joints but the tables and grills are setup optimally.  Since they pack a lot of customers in a small area, it's going to be a little noisy. Two flat screens on the wall play K-pop music videos and random Korean shows.   This is a casual restaurant where you're here more for the food versus the ambiance/experience.They have tables with the BBQ grills as well as regular table.  If you don't get there before a wait, it's going to be awhile.Service is inconsistent but overall pretty good.  AYCE BBQ and Tofu Soup:  Lunch time stops here for the Tofu soup have been common for me, my favorite is the beef tofu soup.  They come out quick and you get a nice selection of ban chan/small side dishes with your soup along with a bowl of rice.  Priced at $9.23 gets you to $10 after tax...don't forget the tip.  The AYCE option offers pretty good value for the price at $16.99.  The AYCE meats are good quality and the orders come out with good quantity.  My go to's are the brisket, ribe eye and the ribs.  Tasty and they've never let me down.  I haven't done the a la carte option but if it's the same quality meats, stick with the AYCE.  This is a Spring Mountain Vegas classic as they were the only primary AYCE Korean BBQ option many years ago.   They are  holding their own against all the brand new Korean BBQ joints with the value they offer for their food.  This kept me coming years ago and I still stop by today.  Enjoy! =)

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_LFeCdxO9AGo22cGMXtE0w.text: Late night KBBQ throw down!   This is the smallest place I've been to, but they dish out some slammin' good KBBQ. They have all the traditional meats that you would expect as well as all the usual ban chan. Their interior is basic with no fancy decor but it worked for us. We went for the Korean BBQ!  My only complaint was the server(s) we're stretched too thin. We only saw one server and on occasion, the lady behind the counter would step out and mind the tables with him. We complained that our burner's  flames were too low and actually tried to fix it ourselves. Being the stove professionals we are, we managed to turn off the flames altogether! At that point our guy should have not only relit our stove but should have also turned it up. Alas, he did not. He just lit it again. We had to flag him down twice to fix it. Eventually he got the heat turned up and we were able to cook and pig out faster. In the end, we were still fat and happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gingery salady goodness
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meats!

9odLmGY2kySBQy3HPcVyHg.text: $16.99 all you can eat korean BBQ! Need I say more?  We started with the brisket and had to get seconds. The pork belly is on the thinner side (would compare to about 3 bacon slices thick) but was very good. Marinated sliced rib eye was on the sweet side but was tender and was okay. They also had squid and short ribs but didnt get a chance to try them. The steamed egg was amazing!  You get six different sides and white rice to start. I like mixing the steamed egg with the white rice together. They provide oil, salt and pepper to season the meats.   We went on a friday night and was told it was an hour wait so we put our name down and come backn20 minutes later to see they already called us. So we put or name down and wait about 15 minutes and were seated. There is all all you can eat restaurants in this area and a new one that just opened up across from them. Tofu hut has better service and at half the price you can beat it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Need brisket
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An hour wait! Hope it&#39;s worth it.

ImWBxtvBQO891O7IwHRRJw.text: I finally got to try the Tofu Hut that all the Las Vegas locals have been talking about. I hear the the place is usually busy at night and your whole party needs to be present before you are seated. Its small and packed but the food is good and the service is great. They are always checking on you, cleaning your table and bringing out more food. This is Korean BBQ so you will be cooking your meats on the grill in the middle of the table. And its a great way to try meats that you would usually shy away from. Great place to meet up with friends to talk and eat.  Service was good, as waters were refilled promptly. You can ask for a grill change, and they won't do it unless you ask most of the time. Newer KBBQ places will offer to do it, which is nice.  The pricing was really cheap for what you get too. Very good deal for sure. My favorite side dish had to be the chap chae noodles Korean cold noodles. I also loved the marinated rib eye and spicy pork. I can't get enough of those three items and its making me hungry right now thinking about it.  I can't wait to be back to try this place again when I'm in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EP9jcgeTfuMcAYE7U5rQSw.text: Probably my go-to KBBQ in town. One is because of the prices; AYCE per person is priced at ~$14, which is vastly lower than most AYCE KBBQ places in the area. Yes, the options are smaller and limited but the quality of meats are definitely worth the repeated visit. The place is small with a few tables and even fewer grills so a wait time should be expected. But if you're looking for a pleasant KBBQ experience without killing your wallet, definitely check out this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunk menu
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and Brisket

cCW5FnLn6Fb5lIjC3qqoCA.text: Best Korean AYCE bbq for the price. $16.99, cant go wrong with that. Whenever family comes to town we bring them here to get full. Employees are always nice and friendly. Menu is short and simple but I wish they had a dessert menu like their sister company. But best place hands down.

os_u37Dj_D1uTpr8H-GaUg.text: This ayce korean bbq is my favorite spot from the day i started going here.  The servers are always busy but they make sure they attend to every customer. Their place is really clean and nice. And the price is $16.99! Price you can't beat. Me and my kids will keep going here!

Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son :)
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NJobBdgsDwxSx5m_yF-9gw.text: I fell in love with AYCE KBBQ because of tofu hut! First time i tried kbbq 7-9 yrs ago was here and after that i never stopped! I love their kim chi, fish cake, and jap chae here! No option for appetizers at all. We always get tripe & honeycomb, brisket, and pork belly and that's it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first love :)

ns61gINn0X0jU7ysdBzyQA.text: I tried to eat with my kids on 09/06/19, the manager refused service because of the fact that my ex and her husband were there as well. The manager at Tofu Hut said we refuse service because we are not sitting together. I then proceeded to tell the manager that we will pay the gratuity and still management refused service. Needless to say time that was supposed to be spent with my kids eas definitely a waste of time Thanks to the hospitality of Tofu Hut. Not to mention a manager told my son to not eat the food.

-_D895qVtrO-J0JnT5rqYg.text: First time ever eating Korean BBQ, visiting from out of town and family wanted us to meet them here. I thought I am not a tofu fan but what the heck! Totally not a tofu place. It's all you can eat Korean bbq for $16.99. Sooooo good! I can't believe I've been missing out on this deliciousness!! You pick four meats, we got chicken, rib eye, pork belly and short rib. Comes with rice, salad and some side sauces. This was soooo sooo good. There is a bit of a wait when you go, but it's so worth it. Staff is ok, they are busy. Hope to see this place one day in a bigger spot!! Yumm!!!

iX7DzerIMJtDc60-IiLcYg.text: Small location and I hear it gets pretty busy. We lucked out this weekend and came when it was empty so we got seated right away.  Limited selection of meats - but all the ones we tried were good quality. Brisket and boneless short rib was my fave. I normally don't like beef tongue, but this was the best tasting I've ever had. Squid was also reaaally good! Steamed egg was nicely seasoned, and the salad was probably one of my favorite sides lol. Not bad for only $16.99 everyday, especially when KBBQ in San Diego is so expensive!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PYTZr4G6PtWLRDRxZHlBHQ.text: I've been hearing s many good things about Tofu Hut. Everyone I work with recommends coming here. So, I made the trek to with a friend one night after work. To my surprise, on a Friday night, we were able to get parking and be seated immediately.   The restaurant is not that big, there is a lot of room to move around. I did like the fact that I didn't feel like I was packed in like a can of sardines. It can get a bit loud if there are large groups. The wait staff is attentive and made sure to come check the table while they were passing.  They have AYCE for about ~$17.00  a person. Their AYCE is menu isn't extensive, but they do have the basics. We ordered Pork Belly, Sliced Ribeye and Soy Sauce Chicken Thigh. Plates of meat were piled in great quantity - just enough to get you going, but not so much that you were wasting food. Also, whatever the salad dressing was ... that was delicious! Probably the most greens I have eaten that week.  I wish they did have more selection on the menu, but I appreciate the fact that kept it simple. I wasn't staring at the menu and I was able to have a some great conversation with my friend.

uB_0Coa3zJG7A4Kvi-aMfA.text: Food is always good here and fresh. Love the salad and kimchi. Steamed eggs is a  bomb! Gotta have the short ribs.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mt8lexRl5LSOVFuvETvpKw.text: I've been coming here over and over again. But in the past year the food quality has gone down. I like to eat the Kalbi short ribs but the last time I went it was short ribs at all it was something different part of the beef. I will try again in a few months. And let's see if they go back to their past glory. I for one is hoping they do

GSxkMJOrAAf3lYveNLaCvA.text: Tasty juicy meats and as much as you can eat.  At $17/person, it is a very good deal.  We had pork belly, short rib, brisket and marinated chicken thigh.  Service was friendly, but on the slow side.  I come here when I come to Vegas to visit.

pNuWIOm5iggoQZNsBtMMrQ.text: I don't usually like going out for korean BBQ, because I can just eat it at home with my family. On this night, I decided to go with some friends, because we had just finished date night at some paint and wine thing. After three hours of drinking wine and painting, we were hungry. We had decided on Tofu Hut, because of their AYCE option. Also, starting at 10pm, the AYCE is cheaper than normal during the day. It was kind of busy, and we ended up waiting around 20-30 minutes. The old korean ladies are never very pleasant or nice, they never smile. Whenever we ordered meat or food, they would give us a blank stare and walk off. Also, the salad was so bland and tasteless. Part of the korean BBQ experience is eating the yummy salad that comes with it! The salad had no flavor and it was really dry. It felt as if we were eating bunny food - ugh. Next, our grill was burning so much that the bottom started to burn. We thought that my boyfriend's pants were on fire at first and started to freak out. The bottom part of the grill had overheated or something, and there was so much smoke and it smelled of gas. We thought that it was going to blow up - might think im overexaggerating, but for ten seconds or so, we did. The old korean lady rushed over, took off our grill, then dumped ice on everything. After this, we all lost our appetite and did not want to eat anymore. We had asked for our check, and not once, did they apologize for what happened or even give us some type of discount for us not even finishing our food. NEVER coming here again

JM1bHkuwbRPHkBEwo6p0gA.text: This place was my first experience with Korean BBQ. Loved it!!  My husband really wanted to eat Korean BBQ, but I was hesitant since I never had it before. After reading reviews on Yelp, he decided this was the place to try. The place is small, but it's not too busy in the early evening so waiting isn't an issue. We went at 5pm and at one point we were the only people in the restaurant. It got busy around 6pm.   The food was good; loved the sliced rib eye, but my favorite out of everything was the salad!! OmGosh! The dressing is to die for, I put a little rice in the salad which made it that much more delicious.   The service is sloooooooooooooowwwwwww. There are only one or two servers for the entire restaurant, but since the place is small and isn't too busy before 6pm, you should get okay service. But at busy dinner time, I'm sure it's hard to get your needs taken care of.... that's just the vibe I got from that place.    Overall experience was good and the food is delicious.  I will go back!

LiivDTrWPv75NKPEc0e_Sw.text: I wouldn't go back.  The only good thing about it is you can stuff your face for only  $16/person.  However, there is always a line (half the store is reserved for the non-korean bbq customers, of which we saw NONE) because the space is used inefficiently.  Almost all of the meats were very bland, until we added this oil concoction that was already at the table.  No server offered us any advice on using the oil, nor did they even notice our oven wasn't lit when we had meat on it, until we said something.  Very inattentive servers, most didn't seem to speak or understand English.  Even the salad that comes with the all you can eat was very bland.  And then I find out they charge an automatic gratuity on parties of only 4 or more.  And guess what, the tip is added ON TOP OF the total AFTER tax.  That fact is what pushed me over the edge.  It's one thing to charge gratuity on such a small group, then to have to pay it for poor service, and then to find out it was charged IN ADDITION TO the taxed amount?!?! Very uncool and unfair.  Like I said, I wouldn't go back.  BTW, we thought Korean BBQ meant the bone -in short ribs (Kalbi).  Apparently even the meat called "short ribs" on the all you can eat menu, is NOT that.  It is instead a fairly bland-tasting meat with no bones.

7s_ZxAC7g1JOl3aX_Y88nA.text: This is 1 place I actually like even though yelp only has 3 and a half stars for it. This is a Korean BBQ spot to hit up if your in Vegas. You can order by entree or if your feeling adventurous you can cook your own meat. Like most people we want the food to arrive cooked. I ordered the bulgogi and short rib both dishes were amazing. Bulgogi is my favorite Korean dish. If you never had it, it's shredded like beef seasoned with Korean seasonings. Our entrees came with 5 or so side dishes like pickled tofu, beansprouts, kimchee and other goodies.

sJiz4rmsD9nONNNXGsyi7g.text: $14.99 ALL YOU CAN EAT KBBQ and I'm a semi - Vegetarian..   So I had the Vegetable Tofu Soup. Extra SPICY!  Soup base and spice level is perfect! A bit spicy but they don't make it spicier by adding Chopped Jalepenos like some other tofu houses.   It's Bold and has a great kick.  The sides were great too, kimchi had a sweet tang to it, this pancake thing is tasty with the dipping sauce.  Food is a 4 to 5 rating.  I seldom give a 5 rating even if the food is really good.  The service has to compliment the whole experience.  This guy seems like a manager or owner, but he is like a 1 man team. Does the seating, register, serving and all that.  He left a water pitcher at our table because we were 5 hungry and thirsty people. He always came and topped off our water anyways.  Came  by multiple times to ask if we needed more KBBQ and my friends were sooo stuffed. I was very happy with my tofu soup.  And this guy even came out and asked if I wanted the soup base cooked a different way to omit the beef broth.  As he probably assumed im a full vegetarian, but I said no it's ok, just make it the standard way and I really appreciated him taking the extra mile to make sure food is up to par for the customer.  Will be back soon with all my so cal friends since they all like KBBQ!

er3qN6g9SJQIAKC4L2_qcg.text: Went here with some friends for the all you can eat dinner. Pretty cheap compare to other place and the food was good. We got seated as soon as there was a table available. We order our meats and our server was very attentive refilling our drinks and bring more meat as we ordered. Everything was great from the beginning. But beware of smelling like Korean food as you leave!

4WUoB824c_yI3UlvqfrCXA.text: It seems to me, that I always run into bad service in Chinatown.  Is it the culture, or are they not happy to be there?    I really, really, really LOVE this place, but the one thing that kills me is the service.  A group of our friends sat down and waited for the waitress to come take our order.  I kept looking at her to come over, but she would always brush it off and go back to whatever she was doing.  It was until she finally decided to refill the other people's table with water, did I get her attention.    Things to order: - Beef Tongue - on a good day, you can get the really thin big ones. Fry it to medium, and it's nice and soft.  MMmm, dip it with the oil they offer you.  It intensifies the flavor!  - Pork belly - I don't know what it is, maybe it's the oil that gives it more flavor but I can't help but keep eating it!  - Beef bugolgi - MMmm....on a good day, you could get it really marinated. Mmmm! and boy it is good!  - Steamed Egg - I don't know what this does, but it goes great when you eat it with the beef tongue.  The flavors just ooze out like crazy!  - Salad - Ohhhhhhh man, I don't know what's in this salad but it's soooo addicting! It's like sweet, salty, and crunchy! My kind of mix!  They used to offer yogurt at the end of the meal, but they don't anymore.  If you're coming here, do all you can eat.  It's not worth it if you don't.

EuurdUXKl5KBnsA5HFcamA.text: Ahh.. Tofu Hut.   This place most often comes to mind when finished drinking and partying on the strip, mainly XS, Tryst or Surrender nightclub, since it's right down the street. That being said, my most recent visits here have only been during these late night hours (open until 3am), so my review is based among these parameters.   With a name like Tofu Hut, you would imagine that this place would be a vegetarians' Shangri-la. Well, it used to be when it first opened about 5 or 6 years ago, serving mainly piping hot, Korean spicy tofu dishes. It seems now as their main focus has shifted towards catering towards the AYCE crowd, as 9 out of 10 times, diners are grilling meat on the table. This doesn't bother me much, as I'm an avid carnivore, but I understand how it can bother some.   The AYCE pricing during it's special hours is set at about $13.99 per person, but excludes certain items such as Kalbi and certain side dishes, which are available at an increased $16.99. The banchan (side dishes), are of your average bunch and are of average quality. The meats are also of average quality. My only gripe of this place is their kimchi is of the "just-made" type, as I prefer my kimchi aged and sour. They do still serve their full-menu at night, and the spicy tofu soups never fail, neither does the charred rice bowl at the end (Noo-roong-jee).  The service can be hit or miss sometimes, depending on when you go. Usually, if you're there after midnight, there is only one server working, so if there are several tables being serviced, it is a tad frustrating to wave them down if you're in need of something.   Regardless, Tofu Hut is a good place to go if you're in the mood for some tofu soups, crave Korean at wee hours in the morning, or if you want to fill-up on Korean BBQ for a very reasonable price.

rlPNFWvBezQgNowovnOl9A.text: my family used to LOVE coming to Tofu Hut. Every birthday dinner, special occasion, etc. For a long time, the staff knew us and remembered us. Then things changed.   Before things changed (it's been at least 2 years), I would have given this place 5 stars. Now, I give it two.   I haven't eaten here probably in at least 2 or 2.5 years, so things may have changed since then.   My husband and I went out to eat one night and decided on Tofu Hut. We arrived, waited 5 minutes to be seated (with no reason as it was not busy), waited another 5 minutes to get water and have our drink order taken. Oh, and they didn't give us menu's, either. Good thing we already knew what we wanted and didn't need them. We placed out order when we ordered drinks. The drinks came when my husband's bulgogi came to the table. There was another table that was seated after us who had already received their food - about 5 - 10 minutes before Chris' food came out (yet AFTER we ordered), the other table ordered kalbi, which is also what I ordered. When Chris' food came out, my food did not come out. A couple minutes later, the other table received their food. I told Chris not to wait for me to eat as his food would get cold. We were not checked on at all.   After about 10 minutes, the waitress brought ANOTHER plate of kalbi to the other table and looked very concerned that they already had one in front of them. She did NOT bring my food. Instead, she went into the kitchen where 5 staff were talking over why there was an extra plate, which I am sure they were assuming was an order made twice. They packed the food and offered it to the other table, NO CHARGE!   Chris finished his food before any staff ever came to check on our table. I had still not received my order. I was furious! Apparently, though, our waitress remembered my order and put it in before her co-worker (notice, NOT our original waitress) passed by to check on her table next to us. I commented to the woman that I would not be paying my bill, to which she was very concerned. The manager came to ask me why and I explained the situation. Rather than apologize and offer any sort of acknowledgment of their mistake, the manager became angry with me and insisted I pay my bill because my food was almost ready. ALMOST READY?? At this point, I had been waiting NEARLY AN HOUR!   We paid our check, though I was tempted to simply pay for Chris' and walk out. We wrote a note for points of improvement and considered that our tip. We have not been back since.   Note, this was long enough ago that they did not have an all you can eat option, if that says anything about the timeframe.

A81AJkuXiQn0iNDuWlIwCQ.text: Really nice people. Great service. After 10 pm, the cheapest and the best AYCE korean bbq I've ever had. This might be a really simple review, but it's just that good. Grab some soju and a couple bottles of Hite and it only makes the experience better. Thumbs up.

ccnXMfpb3uwEEfE7y_KSow.text: 13.99 ayce. Or 16.99 if you want egg + short rib. I always order marinated pork and chicken grill them together, ask for jalepenos, onion and garlic to grill with it. The salad and kimchee I mix with the egg and rice and it's awesome. Great value and great food. It's always packed so expect a wait.

SDzbtMO4OJWLh7HF5sRIbg.text: Been here a few times now. All but one visit was for the AYCE, grill it yourself korean BBQ. It's not a real fancy place and not too big, so yes, sometimes there can be a wait when it's busy. Last time, we had to pass on Tofu Hut since it was full and some people were still waiting. You will leave there smelling like a korean restaurant unless you avoid the grill, not to say that's a bad thing!(Most of the time) Service for the most part is decent. Like some of the previous reviews noted the AYCE is $16.99. $12.99 after 10pm unless you want to order kalbi & steamed eggs I believe? A medley of korean side dishes and rice are served with your meal. Instead of the traditional green leaf lettuce to make wraps they have an unusual but tasty twist. A salad of shredded lettuce with a vinaigrette composed of soy sauce, sesame, chili flakes and probably a few other seasonings. The only real knock for I is that they have no steak like a tri-tip found at some BBQs, but that's more a personal preference and tends to be usually a dinner option if it's available. I tend to favor spicy pork & steak when I frequent korean BBQs. Can't really vouch for their non-AYCE portion of the menu but overall it's a decent place to get your korean fix.

N7O4bd1uFvA0my8Sg9UcoA.text: Love Tofu Hut and always have. It's so good that I haven't bothered checking out any other jigae places around Spring Mountain. The location is fairly easy to get to (right off of the freeway) and it is close to anything Chinatown that you'd want to go to after - groceries, boba, Karaoke.   I always order the Tofu soup medium and it is delicious. Very flavorful, and filling, too, since it comes with banchan and rice. I've been there with others, however, that order the ayce and it is always great as well (I manage to sneak a few bites when they aren't looking). The best part has to be the cabbage mix salad that comes with the ayce. You're supposed to eat it with the meat and it is SO GOOD!! The ayce servings are big, and they require a minimum of two people ordering to get it, because otherwise, you'd get full off of one serving. It's best to go after 11pm when the prices change to get the best value.   My only complaint would be the service. I don't know if management changed or what, but my favorite people there weren't working the last few times I've been, and honestly, they were better than who works there now. They also seemed to get rid of "stone-pot" rice, which is sad because it was almost better than the jigae itself.   If you're in the mood for Korean, you definitely have to check this place out. It is my spot -  I try to go at least once a month. It is cheap, satisfying, and authentic. Make sure to come on an empty stomach!

Nb28Oe5zbkRXT9TKGAWnsw.text: Amazing Korean BBQ as well as entrees.  The sides are always nice and are changed/different all the time.  Everything is fresh and prepared nice.  Friendly staff and the customer service is great.  They do have a "white" broth for soups which I find funny since I am not Korean.  All and all it is my FAV spot in Chinatown for Korean BBQ.

Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soju and Hite

oUJ1BvK7JRwzwWpQVAcpkw.text: The small dishes are a lot better comparing to all other Korean restaurants on Spring Mountains. The price is decent and the portion size is very generous. Other korean restaurants sometimes reluctant to give out seconds on the small dishes, Tofu Hut has no problem with that. Ther servers are nice and they always remember what I want!!

1nOG7k4u756119tzk0mmFA.text: Everytime I go to this place, I come hungry and leave happy. Not only is it the cheapest AYCE KBBQ that I know of in town, it also boasts of great quality meat (90% of the time).  My girlfriend and I get the following each time we go to this place: 1. Ribeye 2. Brisket 3. Pork belly 4. Short ribs* 5. Steamed egg*  *We only get these if we go before 11pm, since they charge you 16.99 instead of 13.99 if you get these items after 11pm.  The meats are almost always fresh, the brisket always has that bright red color, and of course it tastes great!  One thing that really made me a fan of this place was when we ate here one afternoon, the server actually taught us the correct order of cooking the meats. She said that you cook the non-marinated meats first before you cook the marinated ones. Being non-Korean, that was a very useful piece of information that she gave us, and it changed the way we ate KBBQ since then.  The thing I really don't like about this place is that it gets really packed during the weekends. They only have so many tables for AYCE BBQ, so the wait can be very long and gruesome (especially since you have to come hungry or else your dinner won't be worth the price). On our last visit here, they told us there was at least an hour wait, even though the two long tables were open, because they had a party of 20 coming in. We were starving, so we decided to get out of there and try out the neighboring KBBQ place. *Disappointed at Tofu Hut*  Another thing that I'm not a fan of is the service when it gets really busy. A few times, I had to practically hold my glass up in the air just so I could get a drink refill. They rarely ever come to check on you unless you signal them to do so, which makes it so hard to order the great meats and banchan that they offer. Speaking of banchan, their fishcakes and pancakes are soooo yummy. They're the best I've had anywhere.  Overall, I've been to this place enough times for Yelp to call me a regular, so I must really like, maybe even love the place.

korgRvVUUMG8e6UI4u8-aA.text: About a year ago, there was a line out the door at Pho Kim Long across the street and I thought, "Well, why don't we try something new?  How about that Tofu Hut place across the street with the all you can eat? How bad can it be?"  Thankfully, the experience wasn't bad at all and I've been back a number of times since then.  (Note: This was also my first  Korean BBQ experience.  Thank you, Tofu Hut for being open super late to offer this!)  This is on the cheaper/lower end of the Korean BBQ spectrum that Spring Mountain offers, (IMO the higher end being Honey Pig, but that's another review altogether.) Their all you can eat specials really do it here with AYCE (13.99).  Tons of decent food with about 12 choices available of meat to cook, about eight side dishes, salad, a pretty rockin' tofu soup, and the whole thinly sliced meat combo.    My only complaint is that there is no AYCE for one person, you need to have at least two.  :(  The staff here, as one review stated, is always flustered because they get huge groups of loud crowds that show up half drunk and the place ends up mobbed and they're unfortunately under-staffed.  The staff here is friendly and I get a kick out of the Korean programs they show on the television, which are usually karaoke or K-reality programs.    If you go at night, particularly Friday or Saturday night, this is a hot spot for after-the-club crowd around 1/2/3AM.  So if you're looking for a quiet dinner, I don't recommend it on those particular nights.  My current favorite thing there is their tofu dumpling soup; spicy tofu soup with some hot dumplings simmering away in there.  Their spiciness level is pretty good, although I could do with a PINCH more for medium.    I also recommend their bibimbap in the clay bowl as that sucker stays hot for quite some time and you can take your time.

p8e7NkI8cv1Hrd2tyMTt3g.text: Compared to most KBBQs here in town, the variety and setting does it for me at Tofu Hut. I stumbled on it after a get together with some friends after our first semester of radiology school ended. It was my first KBBQ outside of California and after trying the others like Woo Che, Korean Garden and Kimchi Korean BBQ on the strip, Tofu Hut satisfies my palette and leaves me with a pleasurable stomach ache (from being soo full)! ;). Each and everytime I've come to this place, I'm with a huge group. Now, this place isn't super big but the staff, especially Rachel, is very accommodating and helpful. I'm not talking about groups of 6 or 8-- I mean groups of 12 and 15!  If you've been there already, you know what I mean.  Most of the time, we visit this haven of BBQ late at night and go for the 13.99 special of AYCE. Aside from AYCE, they do have an ala carte menu as well. Their side dishes and salad are a bonus to the festive and colorful flavor of Korean cuisine.  My favorite is the pancake.  The pancake is a mix of vegetables fried with batter usually served warm.  The starchy texture brings more of a soft and chewy feel to the crunchy bunch of little appetizers they bring to you.  If you come a little earlier in the evening, you can order steamed egg that I like to mix my rice with! A twist for the Asian folks or anyone who likes fried rice. What can I say? I work with what I got to make it the best! Haha! And now for the meat:  Brisket-- It's the most popular choice from the AYCE menu! The thin slices are easy and quick to cook and serve. They seem to burn really quick if you leave them on the grill for a minute longer as soon as they're browned.  Add a bit of soy sauce or lemon while it's on the grill for extra flavor! ;)  Ribeye (bulgogi) -- The meatier of the meats!  My personal favorite from the meat department.  The ribeye is very tender and takes a bit longer to cook. The flavor is exceptional and I suggest adding a bit more to the  majority of your choice of meat.  You can also order some garlic slices on the side that you can brown on the edges of grill! BOMB!  Marinated Chicken-- My least favorite. It takes a while to cook and you can't eat chicken when it looks like a vampire bit into it's neck. Unlike the red mea of the meat family, the chicken isn't as flavorful but if you like chicken with a bit of a spice to it, take the patience to cook it off to the side and get back to it when you can because it does have kick!  Beef tongue-- I was very skeptical about this one at first but after taking a chance to try it, it's really flavorful. It looks like the brisket so if you are only comfortable with having your own tongue in your mouth, ask your friends what's what before you start shoveling it into your face! ;). Burns quick, so pull it off the grill fast and enjoy!  Squid-- you have to be with someone who knows how to cook this right. if you aren't and you decide to be Mr. Iron Chef, just know that if you over cook it, you'll feel like Fido at home chewing on rubber! Add some vinegar and hot sauce with some garlic chips and you're set!  Pork belly-- Looks like a big slab of bacon and it tastes pretty much the same. I like to cook this one extra crispy like I do my bacon! Add some sesame oil (the stuff in the tiny dish with salt in it) for extra MM MM flavor!  Note: If you aren't a radish fan, don't eat the square vegetable in the reddish sauce, that's called daikon. But I always suggest trying everything once. Other yelpers will appreciate you taking one for the team! Oh, and if you decide to take your date here, give them a courtesy reminder that whichever car you decide to take will smell like BBQ for a few days! Hahaha ;) Happy eating!

JifL5_f0HBG8tCZUS7nxsA.text: Well what can I say about this place.... Its not that bad. But not worth going again...  The food was alright but the service could be a lot better... At most kbbq joints, I never had to ask for a bowl of rice to go with the meat I cook. They did not replace the grill until we had to pull someone aside (which is hard to do) just to do it. Whenever my husband wanted to ask for something they walk by as if there were no hands raised over anything. Now I'm not going to pull out no race card (even though we were the only *cough* *black* people there in the entire restaurant) but everyone else seemed to have been taken care of more than we were. (Sigh) it doesn't matter... I won't dwell on that.  Overall, the food was good but it wasn't ALL THAT. Soju and beer was great! I would prefer to spend my money elsewhere for Kbbq... Or I wouldn't mind going again if they would have better service....

ugGW0US_hh6YQSw5vOwPCA.text: First time here for kbbq. They have a sign in sheet. SIGN IT and pay attention when they call you or you'll lose your table. There are only about 10 tables that actually have grill.  Mind the fact they set the table for the size of your party before seating you. Including all the sides before you order. After ordering I quickly, I figured out our grill was a little bit below the bar. It took probably about a good twenty minutes before it was really cooking the meat (It was set on three flames which is the highest besides maxing it out, so it really was just a terrible grill). I was sadly, missing that first great sizzle as you're setting your meat out to cook. Once we got the grill fired up and hot, everything was easy and the service was excellent. They check on you often and bring everything in a timely manner. One miss is that once the grill side filled up, it becomes very hot and the humidity is very noticeable, even with the vents on. I personally think their vents could be stronger. Considering I had a lot of bbq meat facials during the cooking process. I enjoyed what we ordered but wasn't blown away from anything. Great place for a quick fix but there are better places out there.

9S85hbjgBJWREI5fBofsUA.text: Service this time wasn't great. My main complaint here is they're still charging gratuity. Bad service and they still get 15%. They argued with me saying it says on the counter about party of 4. I've tried telling them it's law that they can't charge gratuity automatically anymore.

WssjJsD98JLHTt9hgEDN4A.text: WORST Korean Tofu soup place EVER!  Its pretty hard to have a bad tofu soup, i mean most of the time, the general tofu palces are just average, not too good but not too bad, its something you can tolerate. but man, this place has the worst EVER, how do you mess up on tofu soup? AND you are called Tofu HUT?!!?!?  I stumbled across this place because my usual resturant, Mr.Tofu, was closed already, i was really in the mood for tofu and notice that accorss the street was Tofu Hut. So i thought hey, perfect! WHAT A MISTAKE!!!  I think the only reason people come here is for the BBQ and because it opens late.  There is no way people come here to have the tofu soup, its so tasteless and suprisingly DRY...  Do not recommand, stay way, go accross the street to Mr. Tofu! you won't regret it!

wFeFL7Bf62KXz28X7ijt8Q.text: It's our first time and the only thing I didn't really like is the service. No one even greeted us when we are waiting and the server even walked past us a couple of times to check the list without even saying a word. So rude.
