Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wbvky4Y0mUgrjD_m3NOzAQ.text: Good all you can eat korean bbq at a great price. If you crave korean bbq, but dont have much money for it, just go here. Its all you can eat, but you are locked down to what meat you can get depending on the package you order. I think the package I usually get is the Las Vegas one, but I cant tell if im thinking of a different Korean BBQ joint. The environment is on par and theres nothing to complain about it. Service is also on par with no complaints at all.  The meat is good at a good price. If you have a friend whos never had korean bbq, this is a good place to have them start off since it has good and affordable food. If I were to define this place on the korean bbq scale in town it would have to be the most introductory one. Decent and filling food at a decent price is all I can say really.  Service is good and the employees are always willing to cook for you which only adds more to the introductory title.  Environment is nice, but somewhat small. With a small building, its going to have a limited amount of seats. Theres a waiting list at the host stand that is used often, so try to get there before the lunch rush starts.  Pros: perfect for people who are new to korean bbq, good food at a good price, good service. Everything is pretty much on par.  Cons: can get busy easily, seats can easily become unavailable.  Advice: bring people with you, its suited for that obviously.

cmCeHxmXFl9A1G1AaaJKmA.text: Not bad at all. First time trying Korean BBQ. Would recommend the short rib! Make sure you do fully cook your meat, please. Your own wellbeing is at stake here.

ZiRtt6V18EcO3Jfouw9M0A.text: Delicious Tasty and Good ! One of the Best in Vegas ! Excellent Service , not much of a wait time and very affordable .

u6Ii4H21dkV8wtU3UqEXPQ.text: This place was dirty. Service was lousy. Food was alright. I've had better KBB. The only reason I'm giving a 3-star is because I don't speak Korean (which you honestly need to, to communicate with the employees), so I can't fairly judge the customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CZpOQE0_xupiR3YwiWh6lw.text: Had high expectations, was disappointed. The service was prompt but not friendly. The four of us ordered the all you can eat so called Korean BBQ. The side dishes were as expected, but there were no sauces to go with the meat. We were allowed to order 4 selections total at one time for the four of us. Had repeatedly flag the staff for service. This place was overrated, is there by could not have been sliced any thinner you might as well have called it and ground ribeye. Will not return, if you truly know Korean BBQ I would not recommend this restaurant.

8kWGUtHIR5R7aaiRJ1pyJQ.text: I've been coming to this place since I was 13 it's my favorite place to come and eat and now that I work in China town I can come in after work and enjoy a great meal. The staff are amazing, their environment is clean and always smells good. I cannot wait for the next time I come to eat here. And their salad is to die for my goodness theirs nothing as good as the salad they have.

WlL7ytVoj0EfHV8GsFXsDQ.text: Is it just me, or has this place gotten better? Maybe I was just seriously craving KBBQ, but either way, I left so satisfied.  When I first moved here, Tofu Hut had recently re-opened after a bunch of health code violations.. We still went anyway. I don't think you can beat that price anywhere else and that may still hold True today (please correct me if I'm wrong!). 16.99 +tax for all day special which includes Kalbi, $13.99 +tax for late night special (10pm - 2am) and kids 4+ are half price.   Big bowl of salad, all of the traditional KBBQ sides- Korean pancakes, kimchi, bean sprouts, pickled cucumbers, etc. were all on point. We ordered Galbi, marinated pork belly, brisket, ribeye and a steamed egg. Everything tasted great. The Galbi wasn't bone in though.. Not that that is a big deal, but just a heads up.   Service was great- friendly, prompt, and I like that they didn't keep coming over while you were in the middle of eating/cooking.. The ladies just walked around frequently, eyed your table and took away any empty plates almost immediately.   You won't be disappointed!

unovZ4zSZcQFInmR09IENA.text: Worst customer service EVER! waiting for our table over 40 mins right now and they refuse to sit a table of 7 at a table of 8 that was empty over 10 mins. When i asked to be seated at the table of 8 i was RUDELY advised they were going to seat a party of 3 at the exact table because they walked in 2 seconds before us. Did i mention there are only 2 tables of 8 and about 10 tables for parties of 4??? And im sorry u demand a 15% gratuity if u have 4 or more? As i type this still waiting. So much for an easy graduation celebration.   NEVER EVER AGAIN.

KajHb5wU6DDl5eIZCI_sBQ.text: 14$ AYCE late night special! Was craving some kbbq in vegas and did a yelp search and this was the only one that popped up.  They only have about 8 - 10 tables total that have a bbq grill so its a fairly small spot.  Came after 10 pm and ended up waiting over an hour to be served.    Right across from the plaza with pho kim long

XZl0Ab8nXfqEq9Lvio7Zww.text: The food is decent, but look, some things are good because of the value.  Best value for the buck while offering decent quality tasting food for korean bbq in Las vegas, especially late night rates.  Was the go to place for quick late night eats for my gf and I.   Took many people here and were fed properly.  The problem is when you go for the late night specials sometimes they run out of properly marinated beef and pork, so it tastes bland.

fY3NAtiWksJYQQ6pbBnrSQ.text: I had been here a couple times in the past, but it had been a couple years, mainly due to the recent health issues they were having around 2013 but decided to give it another try so I came here last month with Rachel S, Stephanie K and Michael K. It was a Friday night and when we arrived, there was a 30-40 min wait! Wow, I've never seen it so packed! I guess people weren't concerned about their health violations anymore which was a good sign to me.   Once we sat down we ordered a bunch of food including: marinated short ribs (kalbi), spicy pork, pork belly, marinated pork belly, marinated rib eye (bulgogi), beef tongue, and steamed egg. We were also brought a big house salad, rice, and banchan dishes while we waited for our meat. The banchan was ok and I really only liked the kimchi. The salad was surprisingly very tasty and I actually wanted more! The salad and banchan are refillable so don't be shy! It's all you can eat!  As usual, my favorite meat was the pork belly! It was basically just sliced pork belly but it was great with the salt/pepper/oil sauce mixture they give you. The kalbi and bulgogi were good too but the thing I kept wanting more of was the pork belly! I also couldn't get enough of the sauce even though it was so simple. Goes to show that sometimes the best things in life are the simple things! The steamed egg was also awesome and I could've eaten multple bowls! My least favorite was the marinated pork belly which looked mushy and was chewy and not like pork belly at all...  The grills were ok, just make sure yours is turnt up because ours wasn't and in the beginning we were trying to figure out why it was taking so long to warm up. The vents also do nothing here so you'll smell like grilled meats when you leave here so I'd suggest not getting all dressed up to come eat here. The staff was ok as well. Sometimes it was hard to get a server's attention because it was so busy so you have to flag them down as they walk by otherwise you won't really get checked on. Parking is also pretty horrendous on busy nights so you may have to drive around multiple times to find a spot at all.  At $16.99 AYCE Korean BBQ, this place is hard to beat in value for what you get and it will remain my go to KBBQ spot.

-Ud12wkVppkWfNlIg6Xx5Q.text: Great place good price, and my 7 yr old daughter was half off. cook your own food, nadm maybe the cheapest in China Town, very clean simple decore. Oh and the staff all smile and care.

PF9TNnt-VKBXqpoL_Y4WNw.text: My wife wanted to give Tofu Hut a try.  It's close to home, lots of available parking, and no wait to get in [and now I know why].  No hot tea, no rice, no side dishes/desert buffet.  The only dipping sauce was sesame oil mixed with table salt.  The selection of all-you-can-eat meats was very limited compared to other all-you-can-eat Korean BBQs on or near Spring Mtn Rd, although the portions were large.  The kalbi, bulgogi, and beef tongue were delicious.  The beef brisket was tastless.  The chicken readily burned on the outside and the inner meat was mush.  The waitresses are inattentive. Decor is blah.   We will never go back.

-ldK72H_ebT-_ZApvnD0YA.text: Best kbbq place in Vegas! Good food for a good price!  Cons: The wait can be kind of long on the weekends after 10PM (since AYCE becomes cheaper after 10PM) and service is mediocre. But if you're on a budget, this is the place to go if you're craving kbbq.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy thursday night!
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, beef tongue and pork belly!

gqVifzTn33oGXBcz5knxMQ.text: Came here for tofu soup. I didn't know that the restaurant was split into two halves (one for regular menu and one for ayce). Ended up getting ayce kbbq for 16.99. The selection diversity wasn't the greatest (I am slightly bias because I came from LA and there's a lot of kbbq places). The meat was good. Their side dishes were delicious especially the potato pancakes. Service was great!  I will definitely come back to try the regular menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat kbbq $16.99. Not a lot of selections but meat was good! Especially the short ribs!

wOzbPaBo1EtxPWxlwQK6ug.text: Waited over an hr & a half. Not worth the wait nor the price. Meat selection is mediocre. Side dishes were alright. Can't compare to Socal KBBQ.

gpIcX-GSm9aXQZPzEp9Pfw.text: It's really hard to say anything bad about a place that serves you piles and piles of meat. There is a bit of a wait since it's a killer deal for the all-you-can eat K-BBQ, but it pays off in the end, and it's highly affordable with a good selection.   The only thing I can say is that the service could be improved. I had to ask for a beverage, and our water was never refilled the whole time we were there. I was also left without chopsticks for half the meal, which made things difficult to say the least. It won't keep me from returning though when I'm hungry and on a budget.   Are there better places to go? Yes, but worth the money for sure.

5mwTef7phLeMUVIzNBQahQ.text: Literally everything about this place is perfect. Get to cook your own meat to your own liking, and there are tons of choices. Servers have always been super nice. Only Korean BBQ place I go to

vO6DAIGMF7ITuMsVrIvGrg.text: I have been going to this place for years. It's always packed. They do not have a tremendous selection but then again all I really want to eat is the tongue and the brisket. It's Korean BBQ so you grill your meats on the table. It does get smoky in there, so be forewarned. Take your oxygen pills before coming in. Waiting is a process where you sit and watch people play on their phones or listen to idle chit chat. I, usually wait outside. They come and call your name outside anyway. Unless you like to experience what a sardine must feel and partake in the sitting arrangements in the comfortable hard wooden bench.  The place will not win any awards for looks but the food is good. The staff is small but they all work hard and fast. Especially, the poor busgirl. She is superfast. I hope they share tips with her. Maybe, I'll just tip her directly. I hate when hard working people get stiffed working at restaurants.  So, I have tried everything on the menu. The steamed eggs is available in the daytime but costs extra at night. Why you want a steamed egg, I have no idea. It's a steamed egg, people! I steam them at home all the time. Take a few eggs, fill it with water, and whisk the heck out of it, and steam it. If you put too much water in, it will be ok, because the water will just shift out. BUT, if you put too little water, the egg is not silky smooth and pock mocked like the moon.  I did not care for the pork belly. It tastes like, well, whatever that porker ate. It's very porkish tasting...in a bad way. I usually skip the ribeye and go for the marinated ribeye. I am not a fan of the tripe either, tasteless. The squid is a giant squid and kind of bland as well. I don't BBQ chicken so have never ordered it. The short ribs are fat as heck so I stay away from that stuff.  The bean paste soup is tasty. It is cooked with squash, onion, and full of flavor. I usually get 2. I love the salad, I am not sure what they put in it but it is crunchy and full of sesame oil flavor. Ok, it's probably sesame seed oil, some Korean red pepper, and sugar, but I cannot duplicate it at home.  I tried to go early and pay the extra $3 to eat at 9:30 but the wait pushed me into the discounted $13.99 price if that tells you how busy they are. Why don't I go earlier? I have not the slightest idea. It just seems we get a craving late nights and dredge ourselves in protein that would normally kill a horse.  Service is fast and they do bring it out. Sometimes, they are so busy that they may forget, so just order a bunch of items at once to make it easy on them and yourself. Unlike Kona Grill where you are made to feel you are judged, service here really is just too busy to serve all your needs at once. No complaints here.  The soda comes in a can so if you are like me and want to imbibe in enough carbonation to float to the ceiling, you may want to pass.  One last thing, you can ask for a new grill once the old one gets crusted up. No need to sit there and breathe in carcinogens or squint to see people around you. :) Unless, you are hard up training for that chimney sweep position, then by all means...

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket I believe.
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bean paste soup consisting of squash, onions, and other tasty stuff

F7yBARA7Q1JlpoLKvO5WPA.text: Disappointed. The LA BBQ had too much fat. Where is the beef? C'mon..  Maybe because I had the combo? Cheaper than the regular price so I should deserve that?  I mean the tofu soup was fairly okay, but you have to have tofu soup and LA Bbq together because it is just a perfect combination. Maybe because SoGongDong Tofu place in New Jersey gave me really good experience, so I might have had a high expectation, but I still feel that this isn't right. I will try another tofu place next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LA bbq had too much fat. Not good. (Top two were okay, but next to them and below them were Ewwww)

XdcOsG-18VZf64fppyyAJQ.text: Come here with an open mind and an empty stomach!  The only reason why they wouldn't get a 5 is because of cleanliness. Put that aside and BAM, you've got the best KBBQ in town for the BEST prices!  You can never go wrong with Tofu Hut. I've never had issues during or after my visits (and trust me, I've gone more times than you could ever imagine).   I'm a firm believer of, if it tastes good, and cost is reasonable, then WHY NOT. Nothing bad has ever happened to me, so until then, I'm on Tofu Hut's side.  They have AYCE KBBQ. After 10pm it's cheaper, and a DEAL TO STEAL!!!!!   My top three to order would be: brisket, bulgolgi, and squid.  They have the BEST salad in China Town. No other KBBQ salad could ever compare to their salad. It's got a yummy sauce and a little spicy kick to it that will make you crave it on the daily.   Their steamed egg is okay, I've had much better in another spot in town.  But, for price, and quality, you can't get any better than Tofu Hut.  Screw what the people say, my friends and I will always be found here.  Be careful for wait times, it can be extremely long if you're with a large party!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y1mRmPa7fxeEsU7EfN6acg.text: With so many Korean BBQ restaurants opening all over Las Vegas this one will always be my favorite.  The food is awesome and the sides are great. There is always a wait to get in. This time I was particularly bothered by the ventilation. The fumes from the grill were all flying into my face/ eyes and there was nothing they could do to make it stop. Had to suck it up and enjoy the food. Other than that it is the best of Las Vegas.

J61NTMc5ChTKNKqSVl2f8w.text: While a ton of folks recently are giving Tofu Hut dismal star ratings, I'm gonna go out on a limb here at up mine a 1/2 star...now up to 4 stars!  Yes, I know it's tough finding stellar AYCE Korean BBQ in Las Vegas, especially with all you visitors from Cali-for-nia.  But I've been to Tofu Hut twice within a month for some reason, even with that other AYCE Korean BBQ joint right down the street (which shall remain nameless but we'll call it SUUURRRAAA), so it must be telling me something.  At Tofu Hut for the price of $16.99 AYCE all day long?  Hard to beat pricing.  But with the $13.99 AYCE late night special?  Even harder.  Try finding a table at 11 PM, HA, you got a better chance of getting tickets for the San Diego Comic Con!  That line is ridiculous!  Mainly because Tofu Hut only has like 12 tables available for AYCE since the other half of the restaurant is menu offerings exclusively.  Yes, I know that sometimes the quality of the Korean meats is not consistent.  You go one time, it's decent, you go the next time, it's lackluster.  First time I went the quality was suspect, but the last couple times I went the meats were actually better than OK.  So to each their own.  But their kalbi short ribs are damn tasty!  Just wish they would include the bones for me to suck on, the cartilage around them is HEAVEN!  And is also good for your joints by the way.  Yes, I know that you have a LIMIT of only 4 meats (sometimes 3) per table at any one time.  Just order your meats and be done with it.  No sense in arguing.  Just cook your first order of meats, eat BBQ, drink soju, be merry, sing along to some Big Bang or Girls Generation, THEN order another 4 plates of meat.  Get the Steamed Egg while you're at it too because it's delicious.  Yes, I know that their banchan may seem like a small selection compared to other Korean BBQ places.  But you know what?  They aren't that bad at all.  You got all your basics - kim chee, seaweed, bean sprouts, and a couple others too.  Just be like me and politely ask for an extra TWO orders of kim chee.  Wife hates me, but tummy loves me.  Don't forget to get a large bowl of salad!  Good stuff.  Lastly, yes, I know that the service at Tofu Hut can be strenuous at times.  Just remember, you're in Chinatown...almost NO ONE is nice!  I'm not saying it to be racist, I myself am like an eighth Chinese!  So yes, the employees at Tofu Hut can come off as a bit rude or uncaring.  What are you expecting, turn down service from a French maid?  (Hmm...I'm sensing some role-playing in my near future.)  These guys must be tired of running back & forth for the unlimited amounts of carcass and rice we are devouring!  And imagine...these folks have to be around fermented Korean veggies ALL...DAY...LONG.  That's bound to make anyone have a bit of a stinky attitude.  Plus, they're surrounded by smoke and HOT @$$ grills for an entire shift.  You ever scrub one of those cast iron grills with burnt on meat & caramelized Korean marinade?  Get ready for tennis elbow.  Believe me when I tell you...if you're never been in the food service industry, you just don't know.  And if you don't know...well now you know.  IT.  IS.  TOUGH.  UNGODLY even.  So while I hate bad service and I do realize someone did take that job of being a server or a dishwasher...I know it ain't easy keeping a smiley face all day.  Luckily for us, our recent visits have only been on borderline rude, almost pleasant even!  What it boils down to is this:  want fairly good AYCE Korean BBQ, with a fairly good price?  Tofu Hut is not a bad bet.  Need to find the cheapest late night AYCE Korean BBQ in Vegas?  Tofu Hut is probably your best bet.  You want the best service?  Take yourself to a Gordon Ramsey restaurant!    #aycekoreanbbqwithextrakimcheegivesmemadgas

2-hQ36ZjtBn1vAfQwCTWmQ.text: Took a long time for us to be seated, you gonna wait 5-8 mins for a grill change, they don't have brisket special sauce. Only 6 choices of sides.

M_6iMuPIbGkPa_Hjwt_T7A.text: What a great place and service. Paula was our server. I wanted to eat vegetarian only today. I told her about my restrictions. She custom made me a tofu bowl with all the fresh veggies and bunch of sides. Me and my hubby was in rush. Food was very good and fresh and loved the service. Thank you Paula, We will come again and try your hot pot.

iOkgwUmNejvDOwPP84nTkg.text: My favorite barbecue and my favorite salad are very busy every time. I have to wait for half an hour, but I'm still willing to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k_iZ-h3zERK2pgSQp0bzBw.text: Tried the AYCE late night and definitely worth the $14.  Before you even find parking, GET YOUR NAME ON THE WAITLIST. Waiting is tough, but watching others enjoy KBBQ while you wait nobody deserves.  Decent selection of marinated and non marinated meats and tons of banchan. They even have unlimited salad :)  It's self serve so you'll do all the cooking, but the servers are always circulating making sure everyone is doing okay/need anything.  If the grill gets burnt, you can always ask for them to swap it for a fresh one!  Each table will have a list of things you can order so more table space for food.  Great place to eat late nights or after drinking. (Oh, and they have soju so continue drinking)   Definitely would recommend this place. The meats weren't the best of the best quality, but considering the cost, you'll get that $$$ worth.

BQzbpaGnjQGwzK8JmnXzKQ.text: Closest KBBQ from the strip, if you're not down paying the ridiculous $$$ to the ones in Las Vegas Blvd. Price is fair, people are nice, service is fast.

nG5gS5D7r0kxRcYbLltVug.text: I've come here many times before for the $13.99 late night special which is after 10 PM until 2 AM, but after going this past time I will not be going back here again. There are many other KBBQ places that are a couple dollars more, but so much more worth it than going to Tofu Hut.  When you go into Tofu Hut there is a paper waitlist that you just add your name to. I came around 10 PM and the wait was already really long. We waited about 40 minutes before the host was SUPPOSED to call our party's name, but he let his friends that came in and waited barely 10 minutes ago in front of us. This already angered my party.  Cons: - No rice paper - Charge an automatic 15% gratuity for 4 people or more (which is ridiculous) - Horrible staff (rude, does not change grills, no customer service what-so-ever) - Small selection of meats - Long wait time - Only half of the restaurant is KBBQ - Staff will place their friends in front of you on the waitlist  Pros: - "Cheap" Price (if you go with 3 people or less)

R4grF9bM7esbTVF3-z__Hw.text: Parking can be hectic here!  If you are coming here for the all you can eat korean bbq, the wait can be a while. Half of the restaurant is designated for all you can eat and the other half of the restaurant is designated for a la carte. We decided to do the a la carte because there was no wait. If you come for the all you can eat, remember to write your name down on the wait list upon entering the restaurant. The all you can eat korean bbq is cheap and I would definitely come back to try.  The food we had on the menu was delicious. The Korean bbq short ribs and bulgogi were tasty and a good amount of food was given. The tofu soups were also delicious! When I come to visit Las Vegas, Tofu Hut is usually my to go to place for korean bbq. I'll definitely be back!

fYjw1AA4GX0oGf_JCwRfnQ.text: This place is one of the cheaper buffet I can find in Vegas for Korean.  The buffet is $16.99 but BE MINDFUL of your bill, 15% gratuity is ALREADY ADDED TO YOUR BILL.  I do not mind if tips is addeD BUT TELL ME SO YOU WONT BE DOUBLE TIPPED!  I think this is very unethically and unprofessional Bc when you pay by cc there's a TIPS LINE!! The short rib, rib eye and chicken see good.  The squid was very bland, not taste what so ever.  The pork belly is nasty and not fresh!  The beef tongue was ok,  I can skip it. The Kim chi is limited to only 6 side dishes.  I was a little disappointed bc I LOVE Kimchi.  So that was a little disappointing!  The wait was not bad we early arrived around 3pm to beat the crowd.   ALSO there's only a 90 mins to your eat and can NOT order more than 4x of each dishes. Technically is it still call ALL U CAN EAT IF THERE ARE CONDITIONS??

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

lAHKD5lUJ_7wxfkcHBbXfw.text: Tofu Hut has been my go-to AYCE kbbq since day one! I've tried a few other places with more meat and side options, but at the end of the day I would still choose Tofu Hut because of their price vs food quality ratio. $16.99 all you can eat can't get any better! Side note, compared to other kbbq- they DO have the best salad, so good that I have random cravings for it. Just like other good places, expect to wait during peek hours- but totally worth it. It's also in a huge lot so you can always find parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Updated menu

BWDGRSEFEMJF-Qr1hB9fZA.text: This review is not for their ayce... Came here after watching Zarkana hungry for some Korean comfort food. We ordered a bunch of stuff including all their special bbq plates of bulgogi, short rib, shrimp and scallops and spicy chicken. They came with a small soon dobu and we got the kitchen beef and mushroom flavor.   5 stars:  short ribs!!  The galbi was very flavorful and tender. Not heat at all like some places can be. The texture was so soft and delicious. We got two orders of it.   Besides the short ribs... All the other stuff was just mediocre. I use to live in Ktown in la and was really disappointed in the tofu soup. The color is way off... It's a watery light pink color. The consistency was too watery.. And the flavor just wasn't there. I think mr tofu across the street serves wayyyy better tofu soup. The spicy chicken and the shrimp and scallops were good but nothing special. The bulgogi was decent as well too.   As for their side dishes..they served really good kimchi!  Not too fermented and crunchy just the way I like it. They also had seaweed, japchea, bean sprouts and Korean pancake. Usually Korean pancake is my favorite thing but this one was extremely thick and doughy with little flavor. It was also soggy.   I think for meats.. The galbi is unbeatable. For for tofu soup I'm gonna visit somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken

5GZ7xaIUtLf9GGzvvY32jw.text: My go to AYCE bbq place had been a little iffy so I brought myself back to this amazing restaurant. There is a bit of a wait but it is definitely worth it. After you sign in, make sure your entire party is present to be sat because they are limited on seating. They have a small but filling selection to choose from for the grill. The beef tongue, brisket, and short ribs are our favorites. The food is fresh and you can enjoy the little dishes they bring out for you as well. Love the salad and the clear noodles they serve. There is a 90 minute which I think is more than enough time to enjoy your food. There aren't desserts but the food itself is so satisfying that you don't really have the space for it. The staff was super friendly and attentive to all our needs. We can't wait to come back again.

e6cbRsLu2AHqw00-MYmDLg.text: Definitely my favorite Korean Bbq in Vegas! With all the other restaurants they have in Vegas, we still never fail to make a stop at Tofu Hut when we visit.   Definitely come in hungry. All you can eat for $16.99!!   All the sides are good, and the salad they give you is so tasty!!!! I can just eat that! My favorites are definitely the brisket and ribeye!   Ohhhh, my mouth is watering just thinking about tofu hut! Can't wait for my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RaKT8PqpSFUwmi7L_dl5Xw.text: I have been here couple of times. I have try different kind tofu pot. They are all good , especially the little side dishes.  However, I have never try their Korea BBQ. Because it's a good price so always wait in the long line, even it's in late midnight.

pNWg9jGkSb9yM0KmmLcMew.text: Just tried this place for the first time and it was amazing! Food is delicious and we had a great time, very friendly service. My only complaint is a the wait time, we waited almost one hour but it was totally worth it.

ridFot77S1YScZvWzcn2Qw.text: One of my favorite Korea. BBQ spots. They do things simple. They don't have a huge menu. But boy is their food great! . The salad is amazing! I could honestly come here just for the salad!. Great place

XQOemAMsNCn8BI-xE4YozQ.text: First time eating here. Just an FYI...There are two sides to the restaurant, alacarte (order off of menu) and BBQ grill (where you cook your own meat.) Decent pricing. Great service and environment. We sat on the alacarte side. I ordered the bugolgi. It was amazing and delish. We'll be back for more. Check for hours of operation. I believe they are only open for a couple of hours during the midday.

AdQuY_EWleLX8F8Kuox7Ew.text: Love this place and food is great for the price! Farther drive from our home, but we're willing to go the extra mile just to eat here. My only gripe is this, hence the 4 star review. (could've been 5 stars!)   The LONG lines and waiting when you can see the other side of the restaurant not being used! They only have 7 vents and tables for the Korean BBQ grill. The other side is not used, they're just ordinary tables. Management knows their restaurant is famous because of the Eat All You Can Korean BBQ, and yet they still chose not to convert the whole place with table BBQ grills. It just contradicts every practical business sense. They should have VERY GOOD reasons for keeping all those unused tables the way they are until now!   We were 7 groups waiting and I counted 7 potential tables on the other side, saving thier customers the time and frustration. But you will know thier food is fantastic, as we were all willing to wait. Made me want to just call management and ask them their reasons, as it baffles my mind.   But other than that, if you don't mind being on a waiting list and wait for atleast 20 to 30 mins on busy hours, by all means go and try this joint! Thier food and price will NOT DISAPPOINT!

97i65rCbwgyWYR6GGMkLXg.text: The $17.99 AYCE deal is always good at this place. I always get the steamed egg, bulgogi, short ribs, ribeye and brisket. I even like the salad dressing they serve their house salads in. I like coming here once every couple months.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TMmWJesH5mmtnGWxIhHbvA.text: food was ok & I'm not going to lie, but I rather me a little bit more for more selections.  Also for some reason our server didn't really come to our table to check on us.  When he did come, it's because we called him over.  & while we told him we wanted more food, he would not hear us out completely.  Would not go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b5HCCAwB7p9C9sYFzOIVLA.text: Ahh, Tofu Hut. The most incorrectly named restaurant in Vegas. Make no mistake, this place is a giant meat-fest. Tofu is going to be the last thing on your mind, and the restaurant places zero emphasis on it outside of its name.   The best way I can describe this place is that it's a great, well priced AYCE Korean BBQ option for when you're not sure where to go or don't want to bother with being fancy. You know this is not the best Korean BBQ in town, but its pretty darn good and that's just fine. You want tasty meats and you want it now without any fuss. The fundamentals of good food and good service are there, and that's what's ultimately important. It's definitely the default option for myself and my friends when we get a Korean BBQ craving.  1. Food: The meat is medium to high quality. You'll rarely get meat that is a disappointment in terms of flavor and texture. Selection is Korean BBQ staples such as pork belly, marinated steak, short rib, chicken, squid, intestines, and my favorite, beef tongue. The only thing I would recommend avoiding is the intestines, as they're chewier and more rubbery than they should be. It's AYCE, so go nuts on portions without being "those people" that order too much and waste a lot.  Sides are standard Korean BBQ fare. Kim chi, bean sprouts, potato, seaweed, that bready stuff I don't know the name of, and sweet tofu. You also get salad, which is surprisingly good. You'll be faced with an internal battle of how much of these you'll want to eat since they'll take away valuable real estate in your stomach that would otherwise be occupied with the onslaught of meat.  A minor quibble is that they don't offer a variety of sauces for your meaty goodness. You get oil and salt (which honestly is usually sufficient), and sriracha if you request it. That's it. Some other asian sauces as an option would be super.  They also offer no dessert, so plan for a trip to one of the nearby boba or ice cream places after. You'll need it after the savory overload.  2. Service: Generally solid. It's not difficult to get someone to assist you when you need to place another order or need a refill on oil and salt, sides, or drinks. They check on you periodically, but sparingly. This is actually a good thing as they're not as overbearing on service as some other Korean BBQs I go to where they hover over you all the time. The staff is friendly, though sometimes ordering can be a bit muddled due to the language barrier, depending on who is serving or seating you.   Most importantly, and I can't stress this enough, they let you cook your own food at your own pace. This really defines the Korean BBQ experience.  There are numerous places I've been to where they cook it for you, and usually, that means they put the whole plate on at once. I hate that. It's not good service for this kind of eating. A large part of the fun is cooking it to your liking, in addition to eating what you want, when you want. You have power over your meat (insert obvious jokes here). It's the worst when you get to the second half of a plate of meat and it's already cold from having been cooked earlier when you didn't want it yet. You're stuck either reheating it, making it tougher, or letting it go to waste.  3. Environment: It's small, and it's crowded but clean and not unpleasant. That means you're going to want to plan on going there when it's not busy, otherwise, you're in for a long wait. Korean BBQ is not a fast eating experience. Getting seated before 6 pm, especially on Friday and Saturday, is your best bet.  Decor and ambiance are mostly no frills, in good condition, clean, and not bad to look at it. Let's be honest though, you're here for the meats, not to admire the art on the walls or how nice the chairs look.  In summary, if you want a lot of good meats at a good price ($18 AYCE) without frills or fuss, and complete freedom in how to prepare your food, this is the place for you.

-VCPmTe3UJJpdWySN2h0Ew.text: This is most definitely the best Korean BBQ I have had so far. Price was not too expensive, food tasted very good and service was not bad.  Pachan was served with the kimchi plates.  The short ribs were with out the bones which made it easier to eat and cook.  Was marinated well also.  The marinated rib eye was so tender and tasty I wanted to eat more but was too full to order anymore.  Also the served steamed eggs which alot of others charge you if you want it.  I will definitely return here when I am in Vegas. I highly recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3uAJj2P_ROjZ1EnyZCfwEw.text: I can say that this place is my fave kbbq so far. All meat were very tasty, good condiments, and excellent customer service. Just one bad thing is the waiting time.

QCfEnVKGOp4yiOcq3ZF-Jg.text: Underwhelming. The food quality has declined considerably. The bulgogi looked like its been sitting for a few days, beef tongue is sliced into sad, thin little dots. Pork belly is mostly thin subpar pieces that really doesn't hold much flavor.   Price is great but it's sad to see once outstanding Korean BBQ joint descend into this less than mediocre mess.  Even though we came after midnight, the place was still pretty busy, service is slow but attentive.   to sum up: come here if you are looking for great price, but there are many better alternatives.

iEZmh3MgjRJhMlYHShTcpw.text: Tofu Hut is probably on of the most affordable AYCE Korean BBQ out there. Not only is it cheap compared to others, but their choices are all delicious and they always serve you with multiple sides of different dishes as well as salad which I found oh so good. Whenever I come here with friends we usually get the short ribs, briskets, and marinated ribeye. Of the three, the ribs and briskets are my favorite! I can eat that all day long.  Their happy hour starts at 10pm. It's around that time where the waiting list begins to lengthen.  4/5 would eat again and recommend.

76EYURBmFMsuaOTPrKBEuA.text: Good Korean bbq place. It serves a reasonably priced grill and also has a table order section in case you want to see their full provisions. That being said, there is limited amount of space so you may have to wait a while longer since there isn't as much grills. The salad is great and comes with 4 sides for the all day all you can eat bbq grill. A nice grill menu but lacks things like some veggies that you can put on the grill. Great place to choose for a niche bbq place. I would keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5xvEAlGDmOAxXliKUtVh7Q.text: My favorite AYCE Korean BBQ in town.  Tofu Hut is like a hut - only because it's tiny.  I've gone here about a handful of times, and even though it gets super packed, the wait times are never ridiculous.  Also, Tofu Hut is cleaner than most AYCE korean places that I've been to.  The best price - $16.99 for AYCE.  They have a late night special price, but I forgot what the dollar amount is.  Generous portions of meats.  It's not the kind of buffet you get up and grab.  They bring the meats to you.  I love the ribeye, the marinated pork belly, and brisket.  There's a list of about 10 choices for AYCE, but if you are sharing with one other person, 2 or 3 meats are plenty.  Also comes with a side of salad and of course kimchee, bean sprouts, tofu (the usual 8-10 side dishes that come with your meal for every korean restaurant ever).    Wash it all down with hot barley tea.  A must every time I go to a Korean restaurant.

G96ZVXSdREcXa-nRnEkWtA.text: Great for the price!!! Lots of meat choices!!! Have super delicious beef tongue. It will be better if it has more kinds of sauces.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rT_D7wfgPnxYIA9Mm92w8w.text: Really good for AYCE since it's probably the cheapest one I've found in Las Vegas. The meats taste great and the sides are also pretty good! Docked one star due to service sometimes not the friendliest but it's understandable since they can get pretty busy. Overall my go to AYCE KBBQ

hyClW9juK5AsD4SAI14Epw.text: I love This Place. I don't have much to say but the only thing would be, I'm getting addicted to the food there and its worth my $ . I definitely recommended this place to all my friends and family. They love it a few didn't but IDGAF if they don't lol. Just a place for me to spend time with family and friends

Wneg_x_tiKpOc9txs0QkvQ.text: My boyfriend come to Vegas often and although we do love the strip and the overpriced food we were recommended this place by his cousin. Its not too far away from the strip - the wait was under 30 minutes and the service was great - as odd as it seems my favorite part of the entire meal was the salad! It's unlike anything else I have tried. I will be coming back to eat this.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dKPbwHEWJOAtpAqTbfN3aA.text: This place is not good at all! They didn't change the grill when needed and the brisket sauce tasted like water. The marinated pork is not appetizing. Also they ran out of brisket sauce!!! They could've made more!

GOyQlq0dZinhJc7O0-hgnQ.text: I love the place. One of the best AYCE restaurants in town. We go there so often as the meat was good with a great price, $16.99 per person. We tried everything in the menu but we now only order the beef tongue, pork belly, squid, kalbi and the steam egg which we like the most. The salad and the other sides were pretty good as well.  I think they offer $13.99 per person after 9 pm, but for this price you can't get the kalbi and steam egg. Their place was small, you may have to wait if you get in during the dinner time.

F6XaSs7_FA0Ggblap80XMQ.text: Below expectations! Tiny, smoky and smelly interior. I know it's a Korean BBQ, but it doesn't mean that we have to smell like we work in the kitchen.  We were 3 people. It was busy in general. Had to wait about 20 mins.  The sever was close to careless. Had to ask for refills, 0 assistance with the grill ect.  Not much choices for meats to grill too.  Probably won't come back, unless I crave it late night and I'm in the area.

lFoxZF7pv3GlfwOP7UK1uw.text: Been here several times, and had both the AYCE BBQ and the non BBQ menu on separate occasions. Their prices are awesome, and the food quality is top notch. Depending on the time of day, prepare yourself to wait in line for a bit as the restaurant is small and demand is high. Definitely order their spicy tofu soup, or soondubu, and try all the various meats.

xa1z5JlNuHfZ-TxIAFxkpg.text: I've been eating too much lately. Way too much. So what do I do when I get a text invite to do Tofu Hut AYCE at 11:30pm?  It was my first time there. I really didn't know about it. At $13.99, this place kills the $26 table-grilled item I ordered at Pho So 1 just a few nights ago. (Then again, you're probably supposed to share that one). For $13.99, you get to choose from everything but the last two items (short ribs and steamed egg); those are available at the $16.99 AYCE price, but we were happy with sticking to $13.99.  We started with Sliced Ribeye, Brisket, and Beef Tongue. The ribeye was the most flavorful, but I have a soft spot for beef tongue, nay, I freakin' heart beef tongue! The brisket was OK. We liked the ribeye so much, we ordered another plate. I also added Tripe Honeycomb to the mix. I love tripe too. It had a nice spice to it and charring it on the grill added nice flavor.  On our final round, we went with the Squid and Marinated Pork Belly. The squid was OK, but not a lot of flavor. The pork belly had good spice and went well with the steamed rice I had left (I wasn't eating much of it up to this point). Speaking of steamed rice, they bring out a plethora of side dishes to go with the meats - Kimchi, Pickled Cucumber, Pickled Radish, and other stuff I can't name. Everything that hit the table was delicious.  Oh yeah. My friend wanted to order OB, but they were out, so we settled for Hite. Not a bad beer, but nothing memorable.  Overall, I have to give them four stars. Granted, it was my first time at any place that does that style of AYCE, but I fully enjoyed it. It was a fun time with some photographer friends that I hadn't seen in a while. Jason put it best when he said, "I don't know if I needed the giant meat fest, but I sure enjoyed it." That's what she said?  One last thing: your clothes will definitely smell like food when you leave!

G9jrA_RivdxOb7de2ktgUg.text: Delicious food! Cheap prices. Generous helpings on the a la'carte menu. The 6 side dishes (seaweed, japchae, bean sprouts, kimchi, etc.) added to generosity of the helpings and complimented the soup and entrees well. I was totally satisfied by the end of the meal. The KPop playing via projector on the wall was entertaining, but not to loud. I need to come back to the Tofu Hut real quick for the Korean BBQ! It looked and smelled awesome and there was a decently long wait list for a Thursday night in Chinatown.

ccez5QEacWSEyQ0mw-SeAg.text: A nice show stopper restaurant to take family and friends (to impress) where you grill your own food. Food was amazing (it does help if someone in you party knows how to cook meat...if not it will definitely be a learning experience for you). All you can eat and over all a good place. Only recommendation is if your traveling in a big party, arrive early. We were a party of 7, so we waited a bit for a table. Also (if traveling in a big party), apparently gratuity was included in our bill without the server informing us or indicating on the bill...just a heads up if you don't want to double tip

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu hut - cook your own food

WNAKKGIgNLoYDyLDMk3pgA.text: Tasty food, If you enjoy all you can eat BBQ then for the money this is a terrific place to visit.

uT0EAyV5pBUVdGTnrpk4UA.text: 4 stars because the food was great.  We were very satisfied.  For the two of us our total bill was only $36...way worth all everything they give. We did all you can eat.  The salad was very good and so was the kimchee. All the other sides didn't do anything for us. Our favorites were the marinated pork belly, short ribs, and marinated ribeye.  Forget about the other cuts of meat. They are bland and unseasoned.  Im taking off one star for atmosphere..it could have been better ventilated. I came out smelling like korean bbq from grilling the meat. Also because of the wait staff.  They weren't the friendliest group.  Like...sorry I asked for more kimchee and meat! I dont need the smug attitude. I asked for one thing!

-UbxJYIBE9UCMsSFiD9E2w.text: This place was "authentic and delicious!  The service was not impressive, but the food made up for it! It was my first time there, so I used these reviews for guid nice. The short rib BBQ was superb, and I also loved the shrimp and scallop BBQ that my friend ordered!

YIZ3LX_cHe57itFgul_blg.text: I've eaten at a lot of Korean BBQ places in Vegas and Cali, and this place hands down has the best salad everrrrr! Other joints just can't compare. I've always enjoyed coming here with friends. It's cheap, open late, and the food is good. Plus I've never had a bad experience and service isn't bad either. I usually just fill up on the briskets and I really can't complain.   Serious bang for your buck

R26TKfJ8cGqQfigQGmt60w.text: DELISH!!! For us (family of 3) it was $48, you are allowed 4 meats only for your order. The brisket was bland, but what brisket isn't. The marinated beef and short ribs was good. My son isn't meat eater and he greatly enjoyed the short ribs more than the others which made me extremely happy cuz I didn't want to lay for him if he wasn't going to eat.  The salad is amazing. So good for a salad. Sided are no different for any other sides I've had at others but I would for sure come back again. We had about 6 sides and it comes with a bowl of rice for each person.   The entire place seemed to be remodeled/updated because tables and space looked very modern and clean. The bathrooms were just as updated as the dining space which was a nice surprise considering the small hallway you take to get to them.  Anytime price (the hours that are not listed below) is $16.99 per person Hours between 10pm and 3am the price is $13.99 per person.

msYTzs9koNHTJGzLq5xKGg.text: Food was Great. Meat choice is in great quality. Service can be better when serving the guest. The only reason can't get 5 star because space is limited and not big enough. Waiting time took us 1 hour to be seated.

DD7ShowI6ELl6lLkNKUlMQ.text: An excellent and affordable (AYCE $16.95) DIY Korean BBQ joint. I'm sorry Sura, but I think I like this place a little better. For the most part, the cuts of the meat are great. The beef tongue, brisket, and ribs have great meat to fat ratio. Although, one time the tongue had no fat and we ended up with charred rubber-like disks...but oh well.   My favorite part of the meal are the little banchan plates that accompany the hot meat so damn well. Kimchi, cucumbers, bean sprouts, fish cakes, and noodles are given. The plain looking shredded salad surprised me the most. It's laced with delicious vinaigrette and it's so good, I want the recipe now!

6UV13AGx9TJSimEmVUTQNg.text: Hello All... I went to tofu hut around 2 pm... and it was slow... I asked for the all you can eat bbq... But they said its 2 people minimum lol...never coming back here

RBVkegPWbZOh-rbs682ozA.text: Were invited as a guest. The place was really cool. You actually BBQ at your table. Food was fresh and the taste was amazing.   A new favorite.

8MOWZy2iHt1grX4ioO169w.text: We decided to have some soft tofu soup that they should be known for. The layout of the restaurant is one side is the grill tables for AYCE Korean BBQ and the other side is for the non grill area. The grill side was packed with people.   We sat to have Soft tofu soup and dolsot bibimbap. We had to sit ourselves and get our own menus. After waiting twenty minutes, they finally took our order. They only have three workers working both sides of the room. We order a cold noodle dish which they didn't have. They messed up our order even though I confirm with him twice. It was loud and you couldn't hear yourself.   Overall, service was horrible! Food was bland. I will not be returning at all. In the past, I remember their soup having good flavor, but now, no taste. Again, thumbs down. Don't go.

4xAxXx3y_Pw9tXfgYP7m0Q.text: I was there about 2 days ago when I went to Vegas for family vacation. The food was not bad but the service was very disappointed.  I got there @ 1045 pm which they had special price for the customers eating between 10 pm and 2 am.  We had 3 adults, and 2 little kids.  They said kids will be charged half price of adult which was fine however they did not tell us that short rib order won't be covered for promo price.  We ordered 2 short rib, 2 thin beef, 2 pork belly, and  2 steam eggs for 5 people.  Because of 2 order of Short rib they wouldn't want to charge for promo price, even for kids who ate meat barely.  If we ate a lot of meat as usual all you can eat places, I wouldn't be mad. However, it was late night and we only ordered 6 portions of meat but still got charged full regular price even with kids, made me very disappointed at their customer service. Before we left, I told them how I felt about getting charged full reg price but they did not CARE!!  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE..

hsoShWbVOzKpwGm6is2nnw.text: A lot of food a little inconsistent with food, dined several times. Salad is amazing, meat is delicious, wouldn't try the squid again but glad I tried it at least once.

xZFsn4ursco_KAqw459JpQ.text: Food is good. It will satisfy your Korean cravings. Service is good too and the staff is also friendly. The restaurant is also big so no lines if you visit!

My84-JZ84CiY1boFO8daqg.text: My first time here.. And definitely my last! While the food was okay, the cleanliness level definitely turned me off from ever returning.   I came here with my fiance and 10 month old son on a Monday afternoon. When we arrived we had to wait just a couple of minutes for them to "clean" off a table. When we got to our table, we noticed that it was still dirty! Still had condensation rings from cups, and still greasy and sticky on multiple parts of the table. We ended up cleaning it ourselves with baby wipes.   We needed a high chair for my son - and oh how I wish I had a high chair cover for what was provided for us. Their high chair was the nastiest high chair I have ever seen. There were lots of dried up food, and it was sticky all over! I tried to clean it with baby wipes - but there was only so much I could do. I doubt they have ever cleaned that high chair. It was so disgusting and nasty.  We were seated against one of the windows and you could just see the amount of dust and dirt on the window sill. The floors were also super greasy.. You could literally slide around on their floors. And I just loved getting my banchan served on a filthy tray that had pieces of raw meat and rice on it. Would it kill them to wipe down their serving trays?  Normally we wouldn't stay in a place like this after all the red flags. But we had an appointment to get to and didn't have time to go somewhere else.  We ended up ordering the marinated ribeye, short ribs, beef tongue, beef brisket and pork belly. They were all pretty standard as far as Korean BBQ places go.   Standard Korean BBQ in a filthy restaurant. No thank you.

6ZjkIWkksoC2RCf5zE7-dw.text: TOFU HUT!!!   This is my favorite place for AYCE Korean BBQ in Las Vegas... actually anywhere. It's not the most upscale, classy spot but, c'mon, for the price of your food?!  It's $16.99 AYCE during normal day hours and after 10pm it's $13.99 (if you don't order short ribs).   If you're a hungry-hungry-hippo like me, then this place is a steal!  I always, always, always get beef tongue. (For anyone who hasn't had beef tongue, don't start. It's gross... haha. MORE FOR ME!) My boyfriend will always get the pork belly. I recommend the non-marinated choice. The marinated pork belly cuts are almost straight fat.   They don't offer a huge variety of meat, but again, for the price I don't mind.  The sliced ribeye and brisket are pretty good. The tripe honeycomb is ok. It's not at all like any kind of tripe I've eaten before. I didn't really care for it. The squid just comes in a plate, whole. A little weird, not too much seasoning either. I don't like getting chicken just because it takes FOREVER to cook. The steamed egg and bean paste soup are not bad but I've had better ones.  Their service is hit or miss. There's one server who is really good and tries really hard to keep up. But it seems like they have all of 3-4 servers at a time. So they fall behind on the service, especially during prime times of 7-830pm.  Oh and another thing I love is the SALAD. I swear its laced. Just kidding but oh my gosh I could go there for the salad alone.   All in all this is a place I happily bring visitors too. Always a good spot after going out & drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly no marinade
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tongue. If you ever look carefully they look like little alien heads.
Photo of Tofu Hut - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazeballs - they must lace this with crack... haha jk

II3jh-rbHndFPP3DNEIl6A.text: Good place to get your KBBQ on! Late night ayce is very affordable. The only thing that sucks are the long lines! Hope they expand their restaurant to accomodate more people at a time. They tend to lose customers when there are long lines since there are a lot of ayce kbbq nearby, yes probably you'll pay a little more but ill take that anytime rather than waiting for an hour to eat! Especially when Im really hungry....or buzzed... =P

ZNXLPXfELIazk28mKigkAg.text: I went to Tofu Hut again for the first time in over a year just to see if it got any better and I was proven wrong. The food was okay but what really grossed me out was seeing a roach crawling around on the floor. Not planning to come back here again.

vvRNIir51biTgzTqz4FT6g.text: I love this restaurant! I would probably give it 4 stars just for the food, but I have so many good memories here and it ALWAYS hits the spot perfectly. Ribs and Bulgogi are great. Side dishes are good, not great. The salad is a little known delicious surprise. Also, get a steamed egg. Totally worth it. I wish they had dipping sauce for the brisket (like a lot of the OC Korean BBQ places) but the meat quality is solid.

7TH3apRp9EvQt5Xpe1EiGg.text: This place has a real deal All You Can Eat Korean BBQ: $16.99 per person for dinner and $13.99 for late night (excluding short rib and steam egg).  The place has only several BBQ table so if it is full house, you will wait for a long time, though they have time limitation of 90 minutes for the AYCE.    Their side dishes are all delicious.  Do not forget to order their salad!  It is included in the AYCE and super tasty!  Their soup and steamed eggs were meh to me.  We ordered brisket, short rib, tongue and marinated pork...Excellent!  Their squid was tender and not chewy either.    I live in Tampa now and used to live in NY and the price here is ridiculously cheap!  I have no idea how their kitchen menus are and it is funny this place is called "Tofu Hut" because they serve a lot of meat, but I would recommend you to go for their AYCE BBQ!

SQz-Ykd43zFW22ZItxAgRQ.text: The stuff here is always super nice!!  The food is delicious.. all you can eat  at a great price :) I love the spicy chicken.. everything is good.  My favorite thing though is the salad it has a unique flavor I could eat the whole thing by myself

5-xGbsJ_aOv_nYb2btveaQ.text: The food is good but the service was absolutely horrible.  This bitch was hiding behind the counter so she doesn't have to bring us more meat and whatever else that we needed.  And when we finally got her attention she gave us attitude and horrible gesture.  I lost my fucking appetite after that and didn't eat. And it's the same bitches that work there all the time.  But what do you expect from cheap Korean restaurant, cheap food=shitty workers

STYYjSA70-Cdeuwxn_fHRA.text: I can't even count how many times I've been here, my go to korean bbq spot!! I Always get the brisket, beef tongue, marinated spicy pork belly and of course my favorite tripe honeycomb (love this stuff!!) $16.99 all day, you cannot beat that..  Service? All I can say is it's located in china town, sooo get the picture??  I never come here during peak I hate waiting! May I suggest to perhaps expand.... :))

PC_UajQqWEDc87g1x8Y1yw.text: 7 of us stopped here for lunch today after our hike. 4 of us ordered bolgoki and the other 3 got variations of tofu soup.  We all enjoyed our meals.  It was quite filling and quite good.  There were 9 banchans today.  I was a bit disappointed that their spicy was less spicy than I expected.  Next time, I'll have to order the very spicy version for my tofu soup.  Service was good.  It is a small place that I have driven by many times.  The restaurant was very clean.  I will be back, and the other 6 feel the same way.

M-nNxouqE4lpHyHWnZaqPA.text: Pretty good for the price! Honestly, coming from New York where cheap KBBQ is at least $30, seeing AYCE KBBQ for $17 (!!?!?!??!?!?!?!?!) is insane.   Place is small, but we got there at 5:10 on a Saturday and probably had to wait 10-15 minutes. The line didn't get too unmanageable during the time we were there until the time we left (probably around 7:00pm).  Recommendations: short ribs (obvious choice, well seasoned and marbled, so good!), rib eye, and steamed egg! Would avoid the sliced pork belly as it's pretty salty and the regular pork belly is probably what's more of the standard. Brisket was ok, but there was way too much of it.

5SeUP3AHc21bynSQ665lqg.text: This place is great.  I have a group of friends, several of whom are Korean-born and raised in Korea.  They do frequent this place, and I love it, especially when I have a cold, etc.  I will say this is NOT 'typical' Americanized Asian food.  It's KOREAN food.  Service is very good, and I think prices are quite fair.  They do serve a lot of "extras" with their food.  I will say that I am sort of a foodie and am picky, but their food is GREAT.  I definitely recommend this.  Oh-lived in LV for 5 years.  I recommend one of their "hot pots".  You'll get out of there for 10 or less per person.

DcqhAXo0DLfiuUoLnuOhcg.text: Cheap and good. Love the bulgogi combo with tofu soup. Nice variety of ban chan. If you do the grill, the meat as well as the salad are my fav. Nice service too. Don't dress nice here cuz the smell's gonna ruin ur clothes.

oXkuJWhwFB7P86-VzbBI7A.text: Went here with a friend after the library closed to grab a bite to eat. It was a Monday night i believe.  Walk through the door and you're just hit by this sesame seed oil aroma that just says 'welcome to a Korean place' . That was nice.   The first thing that shocked me is they ran out of Korean beers, no Hite or OB left because of the lunar new year. Then again the place was empty so they must not have restocked since the previous night.  I ordered a kimchi and tofu stew and several times asked for extra vegetables to be added in. extra vegetables weren't added in... overall the stew hit the spot and my friend's spicy chicken was to her tasting and then some.  I did enjoy the food and service here but a few reasons will keep me from coming back:  1) Price - To be honest i'm cheap, money shouldn't be thrown around epically in this piss poor economy we're in. This place has very little of anything other then soups under the ten dollar range  2) Variety - I expected to see more tofu centered dishes instead of seeing a large section dedicated to taking advantage of the table grills for Korean BBQ, instead of 'Tofu Hut' call it 'BBQ Hut'  3) Ignored my request to add extra vegetables - It's not like i'm ordering a cut of premium meat with a side of extra premium meat, sometimes you just want more then tofu and kim chi like say...other greens. Hell i don't care if they charge me extra for it i would have paid a little extra just to enjoy the vegetable enhanced soup.

y5PX46359zbMGM4I8cx_Qg.text: After a night out at the clubs in the wee hours of the morning, my friends and I decided to head out to Tofu Hut. The restaurant was small, clean, and welcoming. We obviously went during happy hour around 3AM, and the Korean bbq never tasted so good!!  For $12.99 you can get endless choices of meat (not including short rib) and side dishes. I was very skeptical about the cooking yourself part since I had a bad experience in San Francisco, but this was just yummy! I gotta give it to them, for a 24 hour restaurant, the food and service was exceptional!

CJfLhSOpuETZgIfF6geWHQ.text: LOVE this place! Def my #1 place to fix my kbbq cravings. But the only thing is, its hard to flag someone down for water or to order extras when everyone is in the back. Although, everyone is always so nice, so it doesn't bother me so much. And they'll always keep me coming back for more.

Kltfs7SqtL6HYz6qCPA1XA.text: Price is good. Food is great! BBQ ribs too fatty for my taste but really tasty. Been here twice and will be back for more. It is always packed! Gave it 4 stars because the wait is long to get a table at the eat all you can eat tables.

1Yjq_dQJL0MBm_LugcVfyQ.text: Since they now have an all you can eat BBQ  option, 4 stars. With tax and tip ----you don't have to tip well, service consistently blows-- about $20. Worrtthhh it. Just have to be a bit proactive with everything...  Just reiterating, with Asian food, my ratings are weighted far more heavily by food than service. And what's not to love about unlimited grilled meat?

5O_IVfnyXyKxEGfxutTNvA.text: $16.99 All you can eat korean bbq!! Beef tongue, brisket,  short ribs, pork belly, marinated chicken and pork. Dip it in your oil/salt/pepper sauce and eat it with rice....sooo good!! Don't forget to order some garlic to throw on the grill!!

x3xdI_FNeAEaqpj2Hwnl7A.text: I gave this place 5 stars because of their constant improvement against all the new Korean BBQ restaurants opening in Vegas. When this place first started, the menu was based very consistently around tofu dishes but now, they are more on the BBQ edge. I went there about 1 week ago and the galbi was marinated nicely, the taegi bulgogi was very fresh, good portions, and 10 dishes of panchan, very fresh lettuce, and the service was incredible. It was very reasonably priced as well. I'm definitely coming back as always.

nnquDUfHBfc_dhQbIYfSZQ.text: My boyfriend, my sister, and I came here on a whim and im glad we did because it was such a fun experience! We waited less than 5 minutes to get seated and we got a pretty nice view lol  I loved that they play kpop and not to mention that the meat was ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE!! My favorite was the marinated sirloin and the ribs. Everything from the kimchi to the potato pancake was delicious even though it was a bit pricey ( $65 for 3 people) it was definitely worth every penny!

Zt4csGgds6NTgWMyvZ7a9g.text: Beware!!! As numerous other reviewers have mentioned about their poor service, poor quality of meats, dirty establishment, etc...  This place was shut down due to numerous violations 2 weeks ago. Staff are not trained properly and do not have any common sense. Seating is first come first serve even on waiting list. A 2 person group will be seated at an 8 person table while a group of 6 (2nd on list) will be left waiting for next available. Meanwhile, 3 groups of 4 ppl are left waiting for the 6 to be seated first before they can sit at one of the many empty and available tables.  Gratuity is automatically added to the bill if you are on the bbq side, even though it is not specifically mentioned anywhere. Will not be returning.

RAkIaO6QBAGKARW6KqoKVw.text: If you're expecting great service.. then this is not the place for you. BUT if you are there for delicious tofu soup or all you can eat korean bbq then this is your place.   All of the tofu soup don't exceed 10 dollars.  You do get all the little korean side dishes if you just order tofu soup and or all you can eat korean bbq.  I think the all you can eat korean bbq is cheaper than most places in Vegas. If i remember correctly dinner time for all you can eat is 18 bucks or so.

cBzTgDo0FaUR5WCvwZtraw.text: the all you can eat korean bbq is pretty damn good, just don't get the soup, it's extremely salty.  the egg, however, is awesome!  didn't order the stuff from the menu, will try next time.

8nxycJBEBaN6rSVqUMYiTA.text: Had a delicious dinner with my hubby.  I had the kimchee beef tofu & my husband had the tofu bimbimbap (mixed vegetables w/ rice) & tofu soup combo, both medium spicy.   The prices are very reasonable (under $10 for each entree) &  were very satisfied with the food.  No problems with servce here, the staff brought our entrees out real fast, tofu crocks piping hot...just the way we like it.  Everything was yummy.  Love the hours, open til 4am!

eFlxeDPGssCDHKp3oXh09w.text: Wanna get your late night grub on, go here!  Been going here now for almost 2 years and it's by far my favorite place.  I always end up going after work and it does get packed.  Sometimes the service can be shifty because they have such an overflow and limited staff but be patient because the food is amazing.  Marinated pork belly, korean short ribs, and some of the best salad ever!!

jQWIUjXiHeO5jmJ9pTbibg.text: I am a fan of tofu hut and I go there quite often. Food are great they have the best marinated beef ever! But one thing I'd like to mention is they are lack on health training. I went there and have lunch today and I saw a bus lady with very long hair which she was playing and flaking her hair around at the side dishes station and took off her hairtie placed it on the counter where they places on-going food. I saw she did that a few times while I was walting for my food but I didn't mention to the server since she was having a hard time understanding my order. At the end, food was good as always but I couldn't enjoy the meal totally cuz of the inappropriate moves had already grossed me out.

cox8NWkuR0P3FiQhxHGhZA.text: This is the first time I ate here in all my years here.  I am surprised I never tried it earlier.  There seems to be a few of these yakiniku spots in the Spring Mountain Chinatown area, although, this place is not bad.  I typically like it when I do not have to go picking my food from a salad bar full of raw meats to cook up...similar to Camelia's back in the islands for my Hawaiian folks.  This place is more like Million's, I take that back...only in the sense that you don't have to pick your own meats to cook and they serve it to you.  Might be scary for some that aren't used to cooking their own food and this style of restaurant, but it is a cultural experience.  Just remember not to make any other plans afterwards...you will be reeking like you just got done working an 8-hour shift in the kitchen.  I know some don't understand the concept of paying to cook your own food, but its a cultural thing again, so this place may not sit well with explorers that are not familiar with Asian culture.  Nothing pisses me off more than wannabe foodies that only blog about burgers and hot dogs and like to bad mouth other food genres.  So if you are not already used to this, try to keep an open mind.  But if you are very particular, do yourself a favor and pass.  Still, I have seen better, but you can surely get your fill for a decent price.

fGyuybh8_W3pecJ0kqyzkg.text: For the price and the amount you can eat you cant really complain. The food was decent but the service was slow. The all you can eat is pretty much what your paying for and the only reason why we go. Dont get me wrong the food was ok but you might wana check some of the utensils  as our was dirty and we had to ask for new ones. Other than that the place is decent. Parking is abundant and not a hard place to find. It sits in eye view if your driving along the main road. Didnt seem very busy when we went but it got later as we were paying.

cVZR7NU8ScN_IMdp39eYsA.text: Grt price n the sides r awesome..service is average...but food and value makes up for the personality on the service side...yummmyy...get ready to burp kimichi from over eating..burrrrppp

BF4eXeCZodb1eVVthrspYA.text: Ok so I did have a bad experience at Tofu Hut. But through coaxing with one of my Korean rock star friends I decided to give it another chance. This time for a little something feastllike. Yes All you can eat bbq. Well first off at the price of 13.99 - uhm economically hit wallet was economically happy. It was one of those late night things. But I  had the brisket, tongue and pork belly. those made me really happy. The salad was pretty tasty too. I especially liked a giant bowl of salad with crushed red peppers and onions. All the little side thingies were definitely not disappointed. I guess I didnt like the marinated ribeye so much, It was a little too sweet for me. Just give me the meat with no seasoning so I can dip it in my concoction of sesame oil, salt and pepper and symphonize a ballet in my mouth. Plie, plie.....now arabesque along with the lettuce......
